content:
Posted: January 23, 2015
Early Access Review
								The Forest is currently not 100% completed, so it leaves a lot to be desired. There's nothing worse than playing an open world, exploration game and seeing there is an area that is not yet available. The crafting and building aspect of the game is very fun and the learning curve is very quick to figure out. The Cannibals are very realistic and diverse in the way they approach you, and each of them have their own unique way of dealing with you as well. I like the fact that when you do die, you have a chance of waking up in an underground hold, which is either lightly guarded or not at all. But your health is severely reduced along with your hunger pains, but you do keep all of your crafted weapons, medicine, food etc. I'm not sure if this is right or not, but when my health is depleted and have armor left I usually end up alive in one of the underground camps. The "Calm Mode" is okay I guess for people that want to use it as a building simulator, but there just isn't enough content to keep me interested or entertained without having the Cannibals as company. You are able to use "Calm Mode" as a crutch, so that you can set up your whole camp to a tee; and then use it in regular mode with the Cannibals with a huge advantage, if you wish. The atmosphere and constant weather changes are very nice to look at as well.  So I have mixed feelings about this game. The positives outweigh the negatives for me, but I will say that this game is not for everyone, especially if you crave constant action, or a narrative.

content:
Posted: September 2, 2016
Early Access Review
								I could write a little story about any number of awesome situations this game will throw at you. But I don't feel like it truely explains what you will be buying.Here is what this game offers:Pretty graphics - The game looks awesome,from watching the sunrise because you finally got a break from the night raiding parties to watching the sun disappear knowing things go bump in the night and every moment inbetween is beautiful. Focused crafting - Everything has a purpose or is planned to have a purpose..even the little things like cutting up a cannibal and showcasing him in your yard will upset his buddies.Active devs - I've never seen another EA project match their dedication. On the home menu, it literally has a countdown timer for the upcoming patch. These devs actually give themselves a deadline so they don't lose focus and they use that time to give meaningful updates and minor changes. They listen to their customers. I've seen them add features, tweak features and remove features based on feedback. Your opinion matters here.True horror - Players have put hundreds of hours into the forest, explored every inch of the island, built a fortress and slayed hundreds of cannibals...yet still refuse to leave their base at night or dive deeper into the caves unless they're stuffed with flares and explosives. There is an element of fear in this game that you never really get used to. Things lurk in the shadows, make unnerving sounds, harass you at night, sneak up on you during the day and drag you into the dark when they win.A story - Son gets nabbed, theres a door in a hole. Right now, the story is still in the works and I expect it will be all the way up to release. but, little things are released here and there that really  make you want more.Building - Matched with a horror atmosphere, this is done really well. You build with wood, sticks and stones. You can lay a blueprint for a pre-built structure or build something unique piece by piece. You can build in the tree tops or out in the ocean..both have their positives and negatives. Building a base will keep out the night but there is no promise of safety as things can still find a way in.Truely, a game I love.

content:
Posted: August 24, 2015
Early Access Review
The Forest is an amazing sandbox game that is in early access full of mystery and thrill and as the name says you're in a forest.The things that i loved of this game and as others of its kind, is that you have to craft things to survive, since a small building up to a big fortress, find food / fire / water to survive another day.But isn't all, you're not alone here:The story begins when your plane crash and lands in an island, a naked cannibal (or a native from the forest) takes your son and you have to find him (but it's on early access and there is not campaign yet) and you have to survive and defend from the cannibals and the mutants from the forest, finding secrets about what happened in the island and weapons to survive, these are the story points.Now the facts of the game makes it an unique experience, apart from the story:- The craft system is small but good.- There are only a few animals (deers, birds, boars, turtles,etc.) not much as there is in real forests.- The 50% of the time that you spend on this game is chopping trees- You can make your custom buildings- The cannibals / mutants come from nowhere to ruin your day / buildings. You have to combat them- The graphics look quite amazing- And as this game still in Alpha version it has some bugs, but these devs works on it on coming updates quickly. Each update is full of cool thingsThe Forest is one of the best open world / survival games that i have, i'm 100% sure to recommend this game for you if you want to have fun, or get some jumpscareLooking forward to seeing where the game goesIf you have enjoyed this review, please consider to follow our Curator pageThis review was written for : The Panda's Corner

content:
Posted: December 1, 2015
Early Access Review
								From the time this game was released I did not play it until November 1st for the simple reason I knew it was in early stages of Alpha and had a long road ahead of it. With that said I feel like I have done about everything there is to do in the game after playing it for less than a week when I started.The graphics are astounding, and the ease of blueprints and controls are really a plus for me.The mutants are challenging but it can be EXTREMELY frustrating for a new players in Single Player Mode not knowing what to do. I have come across several people who "just bought the game" and they joined co-op to figure out how to simply survive regardless of the mutants.The survival guide gives you very basic information, and up until the last patch I was googling some of the most basic weapons to craft and now they have added the materials needed in the back of the survival guide.Sure pick up some soda, drink some dirty water from a pond, or boil water if you can find the pot - Sure it sounds easy to a veteran player, but for somebody new to this game they are completely oblivious. I will say I am seeing a trend like this with Survival games where the developers want you to figure out things on your own. Either you continously die until you give up or join coop or you survive to see another day.With all that said, the game could really use some major improvements. There are some simple bugs like the log glitch that can be duplicated without using cheats or mods. Theres the log issue where the trees do not generate logs after so long. There are times when a player will go down and is not "saveable" or resurrectable. The traps and tree houses do not disappear if the trees are cut down. "This is recent as they did before the last patch"Players need the motivation to complete missions, explore caves, craft new items, customize their bases. Everything in this game is quite primitive. The most technological item is a bomb or a explosive trap. The bow weapon is very simple. It could easily be upgraded to a compound bow, or you could find an upgraded bow off of a chieftan or a boss.If there is a spawn of an armsy for example there should be an alert that comes across your screen to where everyone can hunt it down and kill it. Then the Armsys only drop certain kinds of materials to craft certains things. (Just a thought)There needs to be locations on the map where players stumble upon different tribes with different technologies. The compound or upgraded bow is a good example. Blowguns, tommahawks, Spiked clubs, slingshots, bone armor, helmets that are craftable out of animal hide or bones.One thing I would be very happy to have craft is....  a SHEILD, SHEILD SHEILDs!!!!! Give us a sheild!The mutants or tribes are distinguishable by their posture, heigth, effigys, and color of their skin. The tribes and buildings need to be more distinguished and unique compared to each other.Some people complain that this game is too easy while others complain that it is too hard. I am an adult and have over 100 hours logged on this game or close to. I will say that by about day 5 the mutants, cannibles, whatever you want to call them easily overwhelm you if you do not have a simple base or unless you are living in a cave.It takes roughly 4-8 hits to kill a mutant while it only takes them 3-4 hits to destroy you. The fire mutants fire damage only takes about 1/8th of your health down which seems like it should take more down if they are burning you for 8 seconds. While if I get touched by a pale mutant im down in about 2 or 3 hits.... So in a nut shell I have to use the traps or hit them from a distance. I really don't think there is close combat in this game unless you have all of your armor or you can burn them OR you have a weapon you can swing fast enough and does enough damage to knock them on their butts. Otherwise they roll over you easily.There needs to be more wild life. Sure boars, deer, sea turtles, tortoises, rabbits, lizards, racoons, crocodiles, squirrels, and fish are great. Lets add some mountain lions that prowl low and can randomly attack you when you least expect it or maybe some coyotes at night that are in packs that are sounding off and cackling arounding you.What happened to the sharks? I have yet to see a shark in the sea. I don't feel threatened at all unless im freezing. Maybe even a prehistoric sea creature in the sea would be amazing.The game doesn't have a leveling aspect. Meaning that you don't have to spend time to unlock blueprints, structures, or craftable items - I REALLY LOVE THIS.With everything said, I can tell you (The Devs) really put alot of time and effort into this game. I am pleased with the product the way it is for $15.00 bucks. I am just hoping that the game is more customizable, and adds a variety of different crafting items... LIKE SHEILDS, house blueprints (like fireplaces) and chimneys, and the tribes need to be more unique and distinguishable.In the current state im not 100% happy with the game, but I know its in Alpha and the Devs have plans. With that said im going to recommend this game to friends which I have already done.Kudos to The Forest Creators and Devs

content:
Posted: May 22, 2016
Early Access Review
								Day 1:I've crash landed on a strange island. Don't know how I survived, but I think I caught a glimpse of some strange tribal man before I lost consciousness. After I awoke I set to the business of building a shelter. Who knows how long it'll be till I'm rescued.Day 2: The tribals seem unfriendly. They showed up at the edge of my camp and eyed me while growling. They have clubs made out of human skulls and seem to be wearing teeth around their necks. I'm going to set up traps tonight.Day 3: Some random skinny tribal tried to eat me! He came into my camp giggling and laughing, I had to kill him with my axe! Its the first time I've killed anyone. I dumped his body outside of camp. I don't like to look at it.Day 4: The more healthy tribals tried to siege my camp today. Attacked me uprovoked but a few of my traps caught them. I killed the last man with a more modern axe I scavenged from a camp. They'll not catch me unprepared again. I'm not dying on this bloody island.Day 5: After seeing that they have some kind of displays made out of human remains, I decided to do the same. It was disguisting and unthinkable but maybe now they'll realize this place is dangerous and give me some peace. Got a little hunting done too.Day 6: I've been forced to build a wall around the perimeter. The healthier, smarter tribals seem to be warded off by my effigy but the starving ones are desperate enough to risk attacking. I'm going to fortify this place. I'm not becoming somone's lunch.Day 7: While checking my traps outside camp I was attacked by some kind of weird tribal leader with armor made out of human arms. He and his war party were no match for my defenses. I stuck their heads outside camp. Maybe now they'll learn what will happen should they come here again.Day 10: I've been a little too busy to write in my journal recently. I decided to take the fight to them and burned one of their camps with molotovs. A week ago, their screams would have bothered me. Now I was just relieved. Maybe now I'll be able to sleep at night.Day 11: A huge monster with a ton of legs busted in through my outer wall. Fortunately I'd stashed away some explosives, so that made quick work of it. On closer examination this thing seems to be made out of...people. Sewn or mutated together somehow. What is happening in this place!?Day 15: I cut off the heads of every tribal leader and put them on sticks. The sticks litter the outside of my camps. They'll regret the day they attacked my camps. I'll kill every last one of them if I have to. Even those mutant monsters will die.Day 20: I decided to start adding legs to the effigies. It seems to complete them a little more. Even the starving tribals are wary of attacking me now. They know that death has come among them.Day 30: I'd been so busy fighting off these tribals I didn't get a chance to hunt for days at a time. Haven't had time to write in my journal either. I'd walked into one of their camps I'd ransacked and saw an arm stick cooking on a spit. I was so hungry I took a bite. It wasn't too bad actually. I'm trying not to think about it.Day 45: I added arms and legs pointing in different directions to each of my effigies to spell out "YMCA". Nothing really else to do to pass my time here. When I was putting them up, I ate one of the legs. I was very hungry and none of my traps have been yielding any fruit, but these perfectly good limbs have been sitting here all this time...Day 62: I'm starting to like it here...All the limbs I can eat. Good sunshine by the beach. This island isn't so bad.10/10 would decend into madness again.

number of helpful: 59 of 61 people (97%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: April 15, 2016
Early Access Review
								I REALLY like this game. It started off with many bugs, but has come a LONG way! The reasons I like this game:1) The AI: The AI is extremely impressive. The natives apparently climb up trees (I say apparently because I have not seen it myself), have hunting parties and scouts, are creepy and it's hard to predict their next move. E.G I encountered a group of 3 natives once, and they ran around me and made some form of a triangular shape around me. I went forward to one of them who backed away. Then I turned to another one who dashed forward, and instead of attacking me like I thought they would, they stopped closer to me, where I then attacked them. This time one of the others came at me from behind and the other made a load roar/shrieking sound alerting their friends of my presence. The hit from behind stunned my character and I was brought down by the natives.2) The Atmosphere: The game produces an eerie atmosphere, especially at night. When I hear a native laughing or screaming it sends me running to my base, or hiding from them wherever I can. Even when there are no natives around, I'm still at the ready, as I never know when I might come across a native hunting party.3) The Graphics: For an indie game the graphics are amazing! The light coming through the leaves is a nice touch. The graphics are stunning for an indie game. End of.4) The Gameplay: Now the most important part of the game. The gameplay. I do like good graphics but when there's good gameplay ,good graphics aren't NEEDED (THIS DOES NOT MEAN EITHER OR. I LIKE BOTH TOGETHER!). The game is a great mix of horror and survival, not making it like a horror game where you find a few cool items and nothing else, but at the same time not making it like a hardcore survival game with some enemies, hardly capable of stopping you. It balances the two just right. It is best to gather resources to build a base, and then look for resources to make more tools to aid my fight against the natives. There are still a few unique tools, that cannot be crafted, but I won't say what they are because you might  want to find out for yourself and get a great feeling when you find them. The natives are powerful, creepy and terrifying. Now scores!The AI: I think they are a great enemy to have in the game, and this is in an alpha build! Some little glitches but overall they're great. 9.5/10The Atmosphere: It's eerie and suits the game perfectly! I like a good atmosphere in a game, and The Forest really deserves a mention for the atmosphere it creates. Obviously co-op is a little less scary, but they can probably find a way to make it a creepy a singleplayer. 9/10The Graphics: The graphics are brilliant for an indie game, but there is room for some improvement. Also playermodels are limited but who really cares what you look like in a game? 8.5/10The Gameplay: The atmosphere and the gameplay work very well together. Obviously some room for improvement. 9/10Overall: I've had so much fun playing The Forest. I will have a lot more fun playing The Forest. The game is a great game overall. It has many elements to it, and will still get better... 9.5/10P.S I don't really write reviews for games, but The Forest definetely deserved one.

content:
Posted: December 10, 2016
Early Access Review
								There is this problem, games start in alpha, copy someone else's idea and then they have the nerve to charge you almost 30 bucks to help them make the game suck less then it does, that is if they even plan on getting it out of alpha. Lucky for us, The Forest is none of that crap.I have owned this game since it came out, based on a recommendation of a friend, and I do not regret buying this one. The game looks great for starters. The graphics are somewhere in between a Unity game and a AAA title release. The sounds are fine. No music unless you choose to play it with the in game Walkman so it is very immersive. The fact that your enemy is cannibles and not something worn out like zombies or Russians brings new elements to the game. Tons of options to build and craft. Day/night system as well as weather. There is an ultimate goal, but they are adding the story elements as they go so for now it is mostly a sandbox survival game. The best part has to be playing online with your friends and all the silly stuff that can happen like messing around on the walkie-talkie or stepping on a turtle shell and being launched into the air. They even give you updates as to when the next patch is coming so you feel involved in the development (they even listen to your feedback).TL;DR:      Survival crafting game where you fight off cannibles. Still in alpha yet there is high hopes. Tons of fun for single and multiplayer.

number of helpful: 69 of 76 people (91%) found this review helpful6 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: January 15
Early Access Review
								V0.52 reviewThe Forest is a survival horror game, in which the player has to survive in an island infested with cannibalistic mutants. The game starts with your character and his son crash landing in a plane. Your son is then taken by the mysterious man in red. The player must use the resources on the island to not only find your son, but survive.  There are many tools available for the player to use, all found in the players best friend; the survival guide. In the pages of the survival guide, players will have access to all kinds of tools and structures. Everything from log cabins, gazebos, walls, catapults, water collector, drying racks, noose traps and even effigies made of human remains can be found in the survival guide. Players can build everything by collecting resources from the island such as rocks, logs, sticks, leaves, turtle shells and even bones. These structures and tools help defend the player against waves of cannibals. The sound of The Forest is atmospheric and scary. Nothing is more terrifying than quietly cutting down a tree and suddenly hearing footsteps running towards you.  The art design and how the island looks and feels work wonders for The Forest. The island feels like a living breathing thing the longer the player is on it. Even the trees have a tendency to look like people. The graphics are not the best, but for an alpha build it fits quite well. The game is littered with bugs but those will be patched out, however the bugs do affect the immersion.  The story of The Forest is slightly hidden, only being revealed when the player finds photographs, drawings or magazines. The story overall, is fantastic, however, not much is official even after the release of the "ending." Fan theory's and speculation aside, the backstory remains a mystery, while the main story is fairly straightforward. Overall, The Forest does a lot of things right: The story is rich Genuinely scaryThe multiplayer is solid and funThe building mechanics work well The enemy's have varietyThe enemy AI can be extremely clever Atmospheric Wide variety of tools and weapons Weapons and tool modifications can be applied The Forest does a few things wrong:Extremely buggy Enemy AI can be buggy The ending can be confusing to someCan be slow to start Sometimes difficult when playing alone (more so on hard mode)The Forest is still a work in progress build, that being said, it has come a long way and shows promise. Overall The Forest is a fantastic game, especially with friends. This game, when completed, will be a new peak in survival horror. If you're a fan of the genre, pick it up. It's a great deal of fun alone, and even more enjoyable with friends. The cost of $16.99CND is well worth it.Have a good one. ~Doc

content:

Early Access Review
								This game is pants pee-ingly good, but good luck trying to get your friends to play it with you after watching the trailer (believe me, I've tried).The thing I like most is that there's absolutely no way to avoid the monsters. I've tried swimming to the middle of the lake during the night -- it rained and my character began to get hypothermic. I tried building my shelter on an island -- I kept running out of food and fire tinder and eventually sharks began appearing in the surrounding water and the mutants were waiting for me on the shore. I tried to build my shelter on a mountain -- they got suspicious after I was picking too many blueberries.The AI in this game is incredible. The only way I can manage to escape them is to build a new shelter made of sticks every day, but then the game loses its horror aspect and becomes a scavenging game (not a bad thing, imo).The only downside to this game is that I'm too scared to play it normally. I've tried building a log cabin, but I got a bit chickened out after groups of 4 of them started appearing and their legs multiplied .. so there's that.This is the only game to have scared me other than Amnesia and Exmortis, so needless to say, I am impressed :)10/10 would press 'esc' key again

content:
Posted: May 30, 2014
Early Access Review
								JUNE 4TH, 2015 UPDATE: The game is very polished at this point with a few bugs here and there. I highly recommend playing it with a friend too although multiplayer can be somewhat laggy sometimes. Fantastic game with great devs who care about the game and haven't let up since release.NOVEMBER 1ST UPDATE: This game is what early access games should be. Since my last update they have piled on gigabites of patches and the game is fully playable and optimised. I highly recommend this game to anyone who enjoys survival games, but beware, do not expect to survive long. This game is hard and if you don't play smart, you will die within the first day. I'd now give the game a 8.5/10.JUNE 16TH UPDATE: The devs for the game just optimised the absolute crap out of this game. I have gone from getting 15 fps on maximum graphics to a steady 50 fps on maximum. Before the game was terribly optimised and would lag, even on the lowest settings, now it feels literally like it looks in the trailer! Fantastic job dev team! You guys are awesome!ORIGINAL RELEASE REVIEW: After playing 10 hours of this game, I can safely say that this is going to be one of the best survival games you could likely ever ask for. It is missing a lot of things and game isn't really stable right now, but this game is going to be amazing, mark my words. If you want to get in early, spend the 15 dollars to help the devs because it's going to be between 30-45 dollars when it is released.If you're after a Minecraft/Rust/DayZ experience with a side of horror, you will enjoy this when it's finished I guarantee.I'd give this game a 7/10 as of the very first release. I've been following the 4 man dev team for The Forest for nearly 2 years now and I honestly expect great things from this game.

content:
Posted: October 4, 2014
Early Access Review
								WARNING:I'm only recommending this game because of the direction it's going, it's awesome developers, and it's very high promise. PROS:- Very awesome concept, lots of promise, great developers that give great updates about the progress of the game.- Cheap investment with potentially high returns of a $30-$50 game. - Very cool plot, reminds me of Bioshock (even a similar intro sequence) but you're stuck in a forest with a bunch of 28 Days Later style zombies/monsters- Crafting system is easy, awesome, and very useful for when you find a safe place to settle- The gathering/hunting/inventory/survival aspects are all very realistic and fun to do, unlike Rust.- Very gorgeous game for it's level of developmentCONS:- The save feature is atrocious. Had to start over several times and got so annoyed I've stopped playing.- The enemies are very easy to kill, not scary at all, and far and few between. Not at all like the trailer and getting attacked is a rarity. Making setting traps feel useless.- It's basis of survival is very easy to achieve. Took me about 3-4 hours to have a log cabin, a♥♥♥♥♥♥ton of traps, wood/sticks stockpiled, and a wall all around my area. I think I was attacked maybe twice over the entire time and it was by singular enemies. - Zero objectives. The intro makes it out like you're gonna try and find your child while fending off this enemy horde and trying to survive on this remote island but there's literally nothing to do. I got so bored that I explored the entire island, collected all the pages of my survival book, attacked large mobs of the weird people with only an axe and lived. - Physics are off. I'll walk into a random zombie encampment and the tables and chairs will randomly shoot straight into the air. When I chop down trees the logs explode and I'll have to chase them down. CONCLUSION:If you got the money and the patience, go ahead and buy it; even if you don't plan on installing it for awhile. It's got a lot right going for it. A few bugs that are easy to work out and some difficulty/objective issues to smooth out but other than that it's a great game for being in just alpha. The developers give frequent updates on the game that make it easy to follow even if you don't decide to install it just yet. I feel like my money is actually going toward a great project with this game instead of others I've invested in that turned crap (Rust, Nether, etc.)

content:
Posted: December 22, 2015
Early Access Review
								I clearly remember when i bought this game, it was back at V 0.06, and i believe the game had just implemented co-op.Like litterally a week before, i remember this beacuse after looking at trailers, and everything ( the game already had me there ) , i wanted to know why thoose 10 percent or whatever, had given this game a bad review. Now alot of times it might be beacuse of a bug, but sometimes you find that one guy inbetween, who actually tells you 100 percent complete review of the game, and even tho he likes it , it still made it to the negative in the end.This game however, only had bad reviews beacuse of people who didnt understand the diffrence between "Pre-alpha" and a game like World of Warcraft.enough said, i'm here to tell you about my experience.As i said before, i started playing this game at 0.06, this means that the game was a complete mess.i remember bugs we had like unlimited wood, and the log sled that flew up in the air, but never returned back down again. But that doesn't matter, me and my brother had lots of fun exploiting the game after we had our fun running through the caves.The thing is, even tho the game was so unbelievably glitchy, that at times you wanted to punch a child, the game itself astounded me and my friends.I remember the very first day, i was looking more at the details of the tree and leafs and how my axe was chopping into this tree, almost like it was surgecly removing the tree as it was supposed to irl. ( a bit faster, but if you wanna do it like real life, i suggest you go out and do it, in real life) That same day, my brother asked me do you get damage if the tree falls into your head ? i smiled a bit, and told him sure why not, thinking to myself that a game like this wouldnt do that.But not only have you done this, you have taken my breath away countless times now.I keep relogging every now and then, and read your updates to see what's new, and whenever i see something that i REALLY need to do, i get the crew back and we build, expand and explore !This is propably one of the best well though and well designed games, i've seen in a while.The passion theese guys have for the game is amazing.again and again they take our breath away with survival aspects, not like any other game. Atleticism, custom buildings, ramps and a roof above your head. Constant upgrades to the game that you just can't complain about.Not only do they have what you think should be here, but the research is so good, that they are doing stuff i never even thought about myself. Turtles, use their shield for water collector, Rabbits, use their skin to collect berries,Deer's, well let's make a water pouchI won't spoil to much, but i like that everything that is in the game, is there not only for being watched at, beacuse god the graphics are beautiful, but they also have a purpose.So if you look away from the glitchy buggy stuff, that all of us (gamers), know can and should be in Pre-alpha, let's look at the game and give that some grades. First the graphics :       This is an easy one, the graphics is 10 out of 10, again there is unpolished areas, but the trees beeing cut into, cannibals and the island itself is an absolutely amazing place, it is almost like wonderland, and this game will surpass alot of the other ones out there once it's done. Second the Audio and the mood of the game :       I had to add that beacuse thoose two are one and same, without the other they won't do.Again they've nailed it, from crazy thunder, to water dropping down from the ceiling in caves, or crazy screams throughout the night, this game sets the mood for you, not vice versa.that's another 10 out of 10  Now on this one i was trying to figure out something, beacuse we can't give a game grades on what it has, when it is developing everything it has, so sadly for thoose pessimist out there, this is going to be for how good they are at developing their game. Which After being here for 24 updates i have to say, they'r doing better than H1Z1 and HoTS by far !  So "The forest" gets 30/30 ! BUT THAT BEING SAID:This is a game still in development, DON'T expect a fully polished game, where there is no errors or bugs.

Early Access Review
								Very few games of this type deliver like The Forest has. This has to be one of the few games that can give goosebumps and make me squeal like a little girl, no matter how many hours I put into it.The enemy AI is magnificent. At first you might see a cannibal acting curiously around you; following you around, yet keeping a safe distance. After a little bit they will test you... Maybe hit you once, then run away to see how you react. Another interesting example, is when I encountered a couple of them surrounding a corpse. They seemed to be very protective of it, running in circles around it, as to say "This is mine. Stay away". After a little bit of playing around with them to see how they would react, I found myself surrounded by several more and mauled in a territorial dispute. Another awesome feature in the AI is that you can go many days laying low, without them even knowing of your presence, while if one spots you near your base, they will come back later in a larger group to investigate, marking the area with effigies to warn others of your presence.Night time is absolutely terrifying before you establish a solid defensive base.  Even then, while remaining undetected, there are warring tribes fighting amongst themselves throughout the night.Overall, I highly recommend this game. If you are a fan of survival or horror games, you owe it to yourself to check this one out!

content:
Posted: March 17, 2015
Early Access Review
								The Good (as of v14):- Open World, Semi-Sandbox- Full survival features: thirst, hunger, hypothermia, sleep, infection, etc- In depth crafting: trees can be cut down, plants harvested, animals hunted, weapons ugraded. etc- Homebase: Can build a variety of structures, including a home/fort- Highly intelligent enemy AI- Beautiful Graphics- Addictive and engagingThe Bad:- No crosshair.  This makes aiming with projectile weapons extremely difficult.  This is compounded by the fact that obtaining the materials to craft/find said projectile weapons is time consuming and arduous enough on its own.  So you can imagine the irritation one gets when you think you are throwing a molotov or shooting a bow/fare at the enemy, but instead it veers off in a completely different direction.  Suggested solution:  Have a crosshair appear as soon as a projectile weapon is equiped.  Or, at the very least, allow a crosshair to be toggled on or off in the options menu.- Lack of motivation to keep surviving.  Reason 1, no quests or direction.  There needs to be a driving force behind the survival.  Otherwise once you've built a fort and explored and collected everything (which isnt much) the game is simply, eat - drink - sleep - mess with cannibals - repeat.  Which get boring fast.   Reason 2, very little possible items to find.  There needs to be at least 4 or 5 times more variety of items to find/craft and weapons to be found.  If there is no story to drive me to the play the game, then there needs to be the promise of an abundace of rare, hidden loot to drive me to keep exploring and surviving against the elements and cannibals.  Right now, there is simply a miniscule amount of this.  There are literally only 2 clubs, 3 axes (which are very weak against enemies, oddly enough), a stick, a rock, a weak sauce stick-spear, a molotov, weak-sauce bow, and flare gun.  And the melee weapons all do very similar damage amounts.  Also, like I mentioned before, the projectile weapons are almost impossible to use without a crosshair.- The island is not large enough.  We either need an island about 3 or 4 times larger, or multiple islands/areas we can explore.  Another solution would be to have the island seed be completely randomly generated on each new game.  Not just have the pieces of it be re-arranged each time you start a new game (like it is now).- The cannibals take WAY TOO MANY HITS to kill.  If realism is what they are going for, I shouldn't have to hit a cannibal in the head with a hand axe over 8 times to kill it.  The cannibals should go down with half the hits it currently takes.  Conversely, if it takes me 8 hits to kill an unarmored cannibal with a hand axe, then why does it take a cannibal only 2 or 3 hits with their club (or just 3 or 4 with their bare hands) to kill an unarmored player?  That makes no sense.- There are far too many bugs with the traps you can make.  Particularly the noose trap and birthday trap.  Cannibals who get caught in the noose bug out and spin in giant loops around the map.  And cannibals that get stuck in the birthday trap appear to be dead, but when you reset the trap and try to retrieve the corpse, they either come back to life, or change into a completely different cannibal and start attacking you.  Final thoughts: I completely recommened this game as a low cost early access title.  You'll get a good 10-20 hours out of it until you run out of stuff to do.  However, I cannot justify paying any more for it at the time of its release unless they add much more content and address some of the issues I mentioned.  But, if they do fix what I mentioned, this game has the potential to rival the popularity of Skyrim/Minecraft.

number of helpful: 99 of 129 people (77%) found this review helpful234 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: November 6, 2015
Early Access Review
								It tastes like chicken.  Well, after a while at least.  How long has it been dearest Margaret?  Today in the woods I found the bracelet I gave you in Nantucket.  I hope you don't mind I had to eat your arm to get it, but we'll get to that in a moment.  After the crash I searched for you everywhere and I did run into...some people.  They proved a bit of a nuisance at first, what with the dragging me through the woods and hanging me upside down in their cave.  How rude, and to think they don't even have a valet.  I'll never get the stains out of my shirt.The first few days were indeed a bit daunting, I'll grant you that Ole Margie.  Covered in blood for one thing, and another, I awoke to find I'd spilt scotch all over my brand new knickers!  Ah well, C'est la vie non?  Anywhoo, I got out of that dreadful plane, of course after relieving it of any useful supplies, and right away found the luggage - yours and mine!  Why, I rather didn't expect to find our bags after a safe landing in Monaco, let alone here in this dreary place.Well, Margo, you know me.  Mummy & Dad didn't pay good money for finishing school for me to be some boorish land-groper, no my dear, right off I set about to a bit of exploriing.  I'd found this trusty axe you see, ah, liberated from the chest of that lovely air waitress, what was her name again?  Oh bother, I can't recall - still the same problems with the old bean eh?So I found this lovely handbook, and in it's pages I found the key to suriving here on this most unusual island.  As I said, the first few nights were indeed a bit terrifying, natives howling in the night, pangs of thirst and hunger gnawing at my stomach, why, one of these primatives actually screamed at me - and naked as the day they were born I tell you!  I gave them the old once over with the trusty axe and they settled right down I tell you that.A few days later and I'd managed to build myself a small walled enclave, I fitted it proper with some traps, a firepit, Margie it was perfectly prehistoric!  I'd eaten most of the energy bars I'd found in the luggage, and gone through most of the pop.  I eyed the booze, but really thirst wasn't my biggest threat, it was the dreadfully low energy from not having had a decent meal.  That savage I, hee, well rather savaged days earlier was a bit ripe, but as I was dragging it across my compound I must have dragged part of its hand through my fire...What a curiously delightful aroma!  Oh Margo, for a Pinot or even a nice tart Bordeaux!  Ahem, a left bank varietal of course my dear, let's not throw all civility away?  Anyway, soon after that my problems were solved!  I hummed and sang as I whacked away - a bit more loin?  Why yes, I do believe so, and is there any of that lovely kidney left?When I finally found your bracelet dear Margaret, I was well on my way to how would you say cannibalinary greatness, so I do hope you don't mind - mixed in with some chicory and a pinch of Aloe, you could swear you were back in Hastings, missing only the bread pudding!I must sign off now dear Margie, it's been lovely talking to your skull and thank you again for sitting so fiercely atop of this stick, it's been fantastic warding off those beastly savages!  Though in truth, the sounds in the forest get louder and closer every day, and I could swear I spotted some large misshapen thing stomping through the underbrush.  Ah well problems for another day - I hear a scream which can only mean my neighbors have come calling again!  As usual, I'll invite them, ahem, for dinner as it were.  They will decline in that awful gutteral way they do but...I'm afraid I'll have to insist.  I'd be crazy not to.(**Seriously perhaps the best survival game there is and I've been playing less than 24 hours.  True anxiety, realisim, fear and triumph!  And really, after a while, you can't tell it isn't Chicken...**)GREAT JOB GUYS, 5 STARS!

content:
Posted: March 22, 2015
Early Access Review
								(Just a note that this game is still in alpha so alot of this review may become reduntant as the game progresses)Visuals / ProgrammingI've had the Forest for a while now, the first thing I would like to say is that this game looks amazing, the textures are nice (Where the scenery is completed) the animations are nice and it just looks superb, it also seems fairly easy to run as far as I can tell in terms of performance.Now the game may look amazing but unfortunately at times I find the movement a bit dated for want of a better word.  The   hit detection seems to be somewhat lacking on the smaller objects and there is a large ammount of bugs which is to be expected for a game in it's alpha.  At this time the map is not complete and i do admit feels rather small once explored which takes maybe an hour, this would not be so much of an issue for me if they made these areas less accessible ( For example walking into a cave which seems to go on forever only to find it leads nowhere only to find yourself falling through the map.) Apart from this and some rather incomplete structures and tools the creation seems rather fluid so far.MusicThe music is amazing, it really feels like you are there hearing what the player hears, the effects all sound really solid and realistic, and the screams from the Cannibals are just chilling. It makes for some really intense moments.GameplayThe forest is a horror survival game wherein you are crashed on an island inhabited by Cannibles and mutants, the key is to well ...survive. You will have to scavenge around the map for crafting materials where you can then proceed to build a range of shelters, traps and storage Etc. The building system is really nice and the structures look good in environment, (give or take a couple).  There are a variety of supplies and debris from previous inhabitants and the plane crash scattered around the island generally containing crucial items for you. The one thing I dislike about this is the lack of variety, once found there is no challenge to find the items again.  The Cannibals have scattered villages strewn across the island, with totems and effigies marking patrol routes, I personally found the Ai really good in this game, they will circle you; retreat; patrol; and even give the illusion of planning attacks. They are one of the best features of the game and hopefully more will be added to the villages as they are really empty right now and some future developement could prove very interesting.When killed you will be transported to a cave system which can sometimes be infested with Cannibals or mutants which seem to only exist in the caves for now. It's a nice mechanic, like a second chance to escape and survive without losing straightaway, the notion being that after being beaten you were dragged into the Cannibals "nest". The only problem I have currently is that the cave systems all look incredibly similar and lots do not have a clear exit. (Which may be interpreted as a part second chance) But personally I found it downright frustrating at times.MulitplayerRecently added was a multiplayer feature, really nice addition but feels badly incomplete, player models look clunky and animation is not done well as of yet. No real objective means that there can be a lack of things to do, and too many players makes the game way too easy. Nice is the fact that a large ammount of players can join a single server, although brought down by the small map size.ConclusionGraphics 8.5/10 - Looks amazing but Areas not complete, or textures too repetitive.Music 8/10 - Really immersive and rich sounds, unfortunately lacks variety after a while.Gameplay 6.5/10  - Very nice Ai , If you build away from the designated patrol areas you simply won't see any cannibals, Some bugs with combat and deathMultiplayer 5/10 - Nice that it has been added, sorely lacking in completion, models are glitchy and look bad, game does not incorporate for different levels of peopleThanks for readingHope it helped, If i missed anything or if you don't agree on anything please feel free to let me know

number of helpful: 60 of 71 people (85%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 26, 2014
Early Access Review
9/10 (Alpha v.0.4.3) "LOST with a deeper story."The Forest starts pretty much where LOST started, you crash with your plane & find yourselves alone in a forest. Soon you realize you're on an island in nowhere. Unlike the overestimated tv series, TheForest simply does everything well by letting U decide over your own stranded survival story and not some lazy story writers. Especially for an alpha stage, TheForest offers already a very good amount of craftable&buildable stuff as well as a nice explorable world. The extensive cave system is just great, and you'll get lost easily, if you haven't prepared yourself. And there are no hints, what you might need! Another aspect is the somehow rogue-like system. If you die, you can collect your backpack with all your items in it where you've died - but your todo-list and map will be empty. At this current stage I can definitely  recommend the game - to people who don't bother to get an, yet, unfinished game! You can easily have fun for at least 30+hrs alone or with your friends. Additionally about every 2 weeks, since Sept.2014!!!, a new update comes out - fixes+new stuff. The Forest is a scarry 1st person open world survival horror adventure. For how long can you survive TheForest?Pros:+ great gameplay+ great atmosphere+ great controls=> easy crafting&building+ great coop+ very good graphics+ good sound+ you have to prepare (without hints) to survive+ fair price tag & many features for an Alpha + exemplary what 4 people can achieve!+ no freezes/crashes/lost savegame (for me)+ online 8 player coop + SLI Fix => click=> I will never forget the feeling when I hung down in the cave and opened my eyes, for the first time.Cons:- some mechanics need to be polished   (e.g. adding cloth to a stick to get a torch, every 180sec.)- alpha means unfinished=> actual status click here[survivetheforest.com]Robinson Crusoe[www.imdb.com] meets The Descent[www.imdb.com] - in a game!

content:
Posted: September 21, 2015
Early Access Review
								This despite being alpha/beta, or what ever the term used to describe a game at this point in its development,  is enjoyable. Pros+ Decent sized map, and due to the terrain and foliage, its easy to get lost.+ Regardless of how long you have lived in the game, how much resources you have obtained, groups of enemys will still startle you.+ The number of resources one can obtain and use is massive in number.+ The crafting system is being added too and as is, very pratical in design.(Traps, homes, fires, weapons, ext)+ Wide variety of selection of food, there is more than just chicken.(Deer, fish, lizard, rabit, people, etc)+ The game has a countdown in the main menu that is only there to inform the player of when the next update is.+ The game encourages you to exsplore.+ Graphics are high quality.+ Combat is challenging and fluid.+ Variety of enemys.Negatives- Glichy, glichy, glichy. I could list a wide variety of potential gliches but they are constantly being fixed, and being created; and everyone exsperiences different ones. Some exsperience near none (Like me, thus all reviews are bias as a result)- Enemys, despite being mutated humans, they have a strong resistance to weapons in a way that makes little to no sense.(Large no longer huminode mutants exlcuded, those things are hulks of flesh amd should be a threat)- Some crafted items make littles sense in the real world (Such as the timed bomb, Upgraded spear using bone and not stone)- The canibals will sometimes glich out after hiting traps and permantly be gliched.- It is normaly required for you to start over after each update, this happens (on adverage every ten days)- Animals have no sense of self preservation. (I watched bird after bird fly into my bonfire)- The terrain has a few graphical gliches (Ground is invisible in some places, though very minor in size)- The plane crash (starting area) use to be random, now its not.- Few feet equals death while jumpingTo clarify, this game is still IN DEVELOPMENT and I can't stress that enough. All these negatives and even postives may be made worse or better during the time they work on this. Summary.Worth it, its fun had a good time, still play every now and again.

content:
Posted: October 6, 2014
Early Access Review
								This game is very tense.  My first try I looted the luggage from the airplane I was on that crashed.  I encountered a primitive that quickly ran off.  I began gathering lumber to try to make a shelter, however, I noticed another primitive.  This made me cautious so I became hyper vigilant, always looking over my shoulder.  The next thing I knew there was some sort of hunting party of primitives chasing after me.  I ran for a while until I found a beach.  Out in the ocean there was a boat.  I was starving so I figured I'd see if maybe there was some food.  What I found were sharks.  They ate me.  My next try I gathered supplies again from the wrecked aircraft and then took off.  I ran for a while until I found a small island out in the middle of a lake.  I set up camp there and painstakingly constructed a shelter while swimming to and fro from the island to the shore to gather lumber.  There's blueberries on the island so that's what I've been eating.  I seem to be outside of the primitives' territory.  For now, I'll stay on Blueberry Island until I figure what I should do next.  However, the clear and present threat of death persists.  It's only a waiting game now...

content:
Posted: January 24, 2016
Early Access Review
								This game has significantly improved over a year. The game has terrifying moments from both jumpscares and just gritty, stark atmosphere. I can't play this game alone, only co-op. I would never leave camp. They come for you so fast. Small groups at first, but then they learn that you are building and advancing. They start to come in larger groups and mutated versions that will haunt your dreams.Some improvements I wish to see:*Balancing of some of the sounds (sometimes they are too loud and the ones that are too loud can't be heard when they should be audible). *Less AI dumbness of walking into the fire (sometimes its useful, but othertimes you just run around a fire until they eventually touch it and burn). *The bow and arrow is inaccurate and hitboxes on the mutants are difficult to hit when you know you are hitting them. (Add some headshots).*Colors/textures on Effigies and stronger mutants (they look like blobs, still terrifying, but could use some features). *Exploded gibs/limbs are silly random looking polygons of the tone of flesh. *There are random pockets of "Air" underwater that you can stand in and it is difficult to traverse when it acts as though you are not underwater until you can magically find the water again.*Some slips of the map where you can fall through, namely, when you go into the Sinkhole on the ledge, you pass the little camp and go to the other end, if you attempt to traverse the ring, you will fall through, thus resulting in the impossible retrieval of your backpack. *Random character skins. *When you pick up the mutants, they change to default model.*When you are bleeding out, the breathing sound fx sounds like a woman (old audio I believe). *The islands seem useless, thus the rafts seem useless. The Islands should have something lol*I hate to say this: I can't wait to see flopping wangs when the nekkid mutants are running at you. It will add to both comedy and horror. I would certainly run in terror. I am better at nitpicking negatives than telling the Pros: but to summarize, it has been one of the best developed games out there. The Inventory is awesome. The graphics are pretty. The world is explorable and there aren't many crashes anymore. The Co-Op works and is fully functional. You can TRADE items now instead of dropping stuff. Caves are terrifying and a unique experience that haven't been introduced successfully by other games yet. It's dark and terrifying. It is unfair and challenging. It is fun.

number of helpful: 650 of 1,007 people (65%) found this review helpful47 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: November 7, 2015
Early Access Review
								I tried to like this game, I really did. I cannot recall the last time I was so excited to purchase a PC title. $15 for this beautiful game? How could I not buy it? 90% rating on Steam? How could I not buy it? Recently added multiplayer mode? How could I not buy it? An open world game with survival and horror elements? That's right up my alley! Unfortunately sometimes we as humans become enamored with items that are hyped and advertised heavily. Often times we might even suffer from buyer's remorse. I'm not going to bash the developers or "trash this game." I just want to throw out my honest ideas and feelings about this game. The game really is visually stunning. I can only think of a handful of EA games that can compare. Shader details are good and the attention to detail is extremely impressive. Game mechanics are buttery smooth and make for an enjoyable gameplay experience. Interacting with objects is quite nice and just in general has a realistic feel to it. Optimization (for me anyway) is quite good. I get decent framerate while having the game on max settings. No one is going to dispute the graphics, mechanics or optimization for this game. But can a game thrive simply by giving you solid graphics, mechanics and optimization? Unfortunately for The Forest, it just doesn't have a whole lot more to offer. Crafting and gathering gets repetitive quite fast and the balance of thirst/hunger is just bad. I feel like my player is constantly hungry or thirsty or just doesn't have any stamina left despite eating large quantities of food. The balance of combat is also leaves a lot to be desired. Hitting a mutant can take 10, 11, or 12 times just to kill it. I'm hit 3 or 4 times and I'm dead. It's so unbalanced and needs a whole makeover IMHO. Speaking of mutants, there are just so many of them it gets overly frustrating trying to battle 5 or 6 at a time. It just really takes away from the game knowing you have zero chance of surviving against that many mutants. My biggest problem with the game is that it just lacks content, direction, creativity and variety. This game has been out for just over 18 months and while updates are released, they seem to be for only minor things (bugs and hot fixes). There doesn't seem to be any sense of urgency from the devs for map expansion, character customization, new weapons/tools, missions, enemies, or the like. The game just feels bland, boring and seriously lacking in creativity. That's the most frustrating thing to me. They have this beautiful game but they just don't seem to know what to do next. I've only played for ~3 hours and I'm pretty certain I've done everything there is to do in this game. This shouldn't happen IMHO. Give us more to do, give us customization, give us a sense of purpose, give us more to explore, give us more crafting and base building options. Keep the players more interested and engaged with the game. Adding more content and a reason to keep playing will ultimately make or break this game. I'm not recommending The Forest in its current state, but I would be more than happy to change my tune if and when the ball gets rolling on the creative end of things. I will definitely appreciate the likes. If you disagree with me, please comment and tell me why. I'm an adult and have no problem having civil conversations. I feel like thumbing my review down and explaining why could actually be helpful in the overall development of this game moving forward. Thanks everyone for taking the time to read my review.

content:
Posted: February 7
Early Access Review
								I've been following this game since it got greenlit on Steam. The description sold me and when I bought it and played for the first time, I just knew it'd get better. That's exactly what happened too, this game is fantastic! It's obviously still in alpha stage, but unlike some others, this game actually plays right and has a story added. Anyways, the gameplay is fun. You have your basic survival needs, but this game really nails it. They added a whole new system to rely on and it definitely works. The enemies are pretty advanced, they will stalk you and attack on sight if needed. You will be battled by bigger enemies as you keep killing. Things will get intense, even if you have a full gear going. The basebuilding is fun, you can build some really cool stuff. You can also build beneficial stuff as well that can help you out in numerous ways. Traps to secure your base, or traps to capture food. It all works, stuff may be a little buggy but again, it still works. Multiplayer works good, it was broken when first introduced however it has shaped up pretty nicely since then. I highly recommend this game at the state it's in. If it peaks your interest, don't be afraid to check The Forest out!9/10

content:
Posted: March 2, 2015
Early Access Review
								About 5 hours into the game so far, time for a first review (updates will follow) as this game really deserves one :)I read a few reviews and watched several Let's Plays as I was hesitant to buy another Early Access game and being so very used to buying games on sale I felt like the full price of 15€ might be too much... now I must say the very positive reviews were all correct and I would gladly pay full price again! Even FULL price like 50€ or so.Sure, there are still some minor alpha bugs, but I've honestly seen released games (at 50€) that had way more problems! And nothing game breaking here, mostly glitches, lighting or stuff that still has to be added.Pros / What I like/love about The Forest:- Freedom! This really feels like an open world in which YOU decide what to do.- Adventure! Really feels like you're out there, lost in the wilderness, trying to make it through the nights and building shelters, collecting rain water, hunting small animals, exploring, washing off the blood/dirt to avoid infections etc.- Beauty of nature! I didn't expect it at first, but the game looks awesome! Finally we have a "real" forest that is dense, thick, populated, immersive, green, overgrown, realistic, scary and dark at night etc.- Gameplay! It's smooth and feels good! Really fun to play and good accessibility!- Coop and Single Player! This game and the terror of being lost and alone may work best at Single Player, but I LOVE to have the option to play with my friends!- Sense of achievement: Making it through the nights and slowly building an encampment, adding your little habitable space to that harsh forest is great fun. Really feels like that's your part of the woods now, your hunting grounds! But still scary at night sometimes! ;)- Immersion! It's like I'm really out there on an adventure in the wilderness. This game must be great with Oculus Rift or sth. similar! :)- Details: You can feel Endnight's love for details when you chop down a tree and it really falls and isn't just added to your inventory or when you open said inventory and your backpack is spread out on a blanket on the ground in front of you etc.Cons: Might become too easy over time? Don't know but it doesn't feel as brutal as other survival games (just played The Long Dark e.g., which isn't nearly as much fun, but way more challenging). For some people this may not be a Con but a Pro, but it feels a bit too easy too get food, potable water, to deal with the cold etc. I'll have to keep an eye on that. On the other hand this increases accessibility and lowers your frustration levels ;)Alright, I'll add more to this review later on. Check it out yourself, it's a great game already with more features being added on a regular basis! Unbelievable that this is done by only 4 people... Very often feels like an AAA-title.Definitely recommended! This is the survival / building / open world game I've been waiting for! :)

content:
Posted: May 31, 2014
Early Access Review
								Day - 1  I awaken dazzed and bloodied quickly scavenging things around the crash site, i can hear howls and screams getting closer. I grab all i can and run in to the woods, the lanescape is so full of wildlife, but i hear a strange sound to my right so i decide to to investigate. When what evers making the noise comes into sight through the tree line i can see 3 tribesman all crouched in a circle, i choose to push forward to get a better look. I am as close as i can get and i am shocked, the 3 tribesman are EATING SOMEONE. Theres another close to them with a skull mounted on a stick above his head just watching, i think he's the captin. I'd better leave, im in no position to fight 4 men with just a axe.Night has fallen and i have almost contructed a basic shelter, it's starting to rain I should build a fire to cook the meat i've hunted. i continue to chop wood when i hear a new strange sound behind me, I turn instantly to check it out and theres a tribesman just stood there. Watching me, he says nothing he does nothing we stand for about a minute staring at each other locked in this gaze. Suddenly he howls turns and runs, i pick up leaves to wipe my♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥myself).Day - 2 Since i was discovered theres been alot more patrols around my camp it's becoming increasinly hard to gather precious resources, but i press on starting to see if i can start on a cabin when i hear a scream in the distance. It sounds like a womens in trouble, against my better judgement i go to seek out the source of this skin scrawling screech. I heard it again i am getting closer, i come to a clearing and decide to duck down behind the tree's to check the area out. I can see a total of 6 tribesman 4 in a pack and 2 wandering (appeared to be anyway), when all of a sudden i see the captin arch his back and let out a bellowing scream (the same i heard that made me investigate).♥♥♥♥♥♥it's a trap! I turn to escape before i am seen but my fears have already been realised, theres a tribes-woman behind me, god knows how long she was there but as soon as she knows i've seen her she turns and runs. I run in the oposite direction but it's to late, I'm being hunted! I take a breather to eat to recover stamina and i have a quick look to see if their still on my trail but i can't see much. I can see a single light in the distance well out of reach, it's the captin looking for me then all of a sudden i hear a loud THUD. I frantically turn in every direction to see what it was but theres nothing there...HOLY♥♥♥♥♥♥THEIR IN THE TREE'S3 men drop down around me and instantly signal the captin, theres no more running it's now or never. we all start hacking at each other franticly, i need to drop one before the captin closes in. I manage to kill one and wound another, but before i could finish him a tribes-woman appeared from the bushes to drag him away. I still have two of these ♥♥♥♥ers trying to cave my head in i can't afford to turn my back to chase, I'm about to die, the captin is unscathed and the grunt is so close to death when i knock him down. I instantly raise my axe when (CRUNCH) i am dead.Day - ???I awake in a cave in complete darkness, i use my lighter to check where i am when to my horror i discover i am in some sort of meat gathering chamber. Theres bodies handing from the ceiling everywhere, atleast 40 all dismembered differently. The floor is littered with the body parts of previous victims, How long have they been here? There wasn't many people on the plane, no where near enough for this. I check my inventory and to my supprise i still have all my gear not that i have much that can help. It's to quiet nothing but the sound of water drops, after a quick search i find the exit and a flare gun THIS SHOULD HELP! Ii have to crouch low to leave this cave and follow this route. It's never ending cave expansion after expansion limbs after limbs when will this end! I start to hear a new a very ♥♥♥♥ing freaky sound from the next opening, Luckily theres ambeinent light coming from a pool of water so i switch my light off. I can see something in the distance and it's big, I tread closer at a snails pace around the slight corner to get a better look only to find theres another 2 meteres away.I am unsure if they can see me or let alone at all so i decide to get the ♥♥♥♥ outta dodge and make a dash for the exit, i can see light and i've been going through room after room i have to be close to the surface! I make it to the next section without them noticing but it's not getting any better. the light turned out to be a fire, a fire being used be at least 12 of the grunts and women. Bricks were♥♥♥♥♥♥ I make a dash for the exit (or atleast what appeared to be) OH MY GOD as i run crouch run through the space to escape i notice teeth dangling from strings. I don't have time to look i have to get out and now, as i am escaping i come into more rooms like the last filled with more grunts. it feels like im being chased by the entire tribe and i dare not look back. I finally come to the surface, it's♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥down with rain and pitch black i can use this to my advantage and escape through the tree line stopping for nothing. I escaped with my life for now....10/10 i know this is not a review but i wanted to share my first experience with the game and i am so impressed.£10.99 well spent i look forward to content updates

content:
Posted: December 1, 2014
Early Access Review
								Let me tell you exactly why you should buy this game.Don't let the fact that it's early access dissuade you from purchasing this gem. Unlike most early access game, the devs work around the clock to find and fix new bugs, review consumer feedback, implement new features into the game, and generally improve the game in each and every update that they release. The major updates are usually released once every month, while smaller updates (bugfixes) are usually released about 2-4 times a month.There is a ton to do in this game. The building takes such a long time, but it's because of this long arduous process that when it's finally done it's all the more rewarding. The buildings look practical; like something that you could, and would actually build in the wilderness.Now on to gameplay. The game feels very relaxing at first. The sound of the forest will build up a false sense of security. It's for this reason that the horror aspect is so effective. When I say horror I mean horror. This game will make you afraid of the night, and when you do finally build that fortress you won't want to leave it. The combat is rough, but it's not impossible to take on 3 mutants and survive leaving all of them dead. With the right tactics you can bring the fight to them. The resource gathering is probably the most unique of any game; very realistic and enthrolling. The inventory system works great too, and you can find everything you have in the first glance. The crafting aspect of the game is simple too, but it feels like something that could be done in real life with the same ingredients.Don't let the system requirements dissuade you either. I play this on my laptop when I'm on vacation. My laptop has 4 GBs of RAM, and no graphics card. I set all the settings on the lowest I can, and still play the game. It doesn't look very good after that, but it's still a fun game to play.In short, this game is fun, arduous, unforgiving, and rewarding. It stands out among the many titles being released these days. It's a shiny diamond in a bed of coal, and it's well worth 15 dollars US. Buy this game. You won't regret it.Just want to add even more to this review. The Dev's are awesome. They've added loads of new content and fixed tons of bugs since the release of this game. It's 100x better now since I upgraded my GPU. It's a truly beautiful game.It's also truly terrifying if you don't build a base. If you want pure horror, just run around in the woods and scavenge for food. Christ, the mutants are probably the scariest thing I've ever encountered. You never quite know when they are there, and you want to stay out of the woods, but you know you need to go in for food/supplies, and that's when they get you. The weakest ones, the starving mutants, are definitely the scariest. They are skinny and bloody, run at you really quickly, and overall just make you crap your pants. Even worse, there are ambient sounds in the woods now that sound like leaves/branches falling, so it's even harder to tell when they are running up behind you. I don't think i've ever been so terrified while playing a game before. It's not even the mutants most of the time, it's the idea that they are lurking behind me.EDIT POST 12/14/2016 UPDATE:LORD BABY JESUS THAT F***NG TWIST

content:
Posted: December 16, 2016
Early Access Review
								Been playing The Forest off and on since 2014 and can say that the dev's are excelent at providing updates and hotfixes that actually make a difference on the users end.  The forest is more than just a game.  It can easily be a hobby, a tool for production in social media or other avenues, or you can just use it for what it is.  A well crafted application that lets you build and construct what could possibly be a great community (in co-op) with the right people.  Building and crafting are not the only elements to this game as you can also venture off into the underground caves of The Forest in search of your kidnapped son, Timmy.  If you decide to go the story route, trust me, the end game is worth the travel, espeically if you are a sci-fi enthusiast..  If you decide to just sit back, chill, kill some cannables with your buds and build a town..you can do that too and have just as much fun.The Forest is an all around great time and I'll tell ya what..AAA dev's and publishers could sure learn a thing or two from both the developers who created The Forest as well as the game itself.  Life-long replay value and much more.  You won't be dissapointed, and if you are..you have no taste :)

content:
Posted: May 11, 2016
Early Access Review
								The Forest is still very much in development, so occasionally you will run into some awful bug - recently I was trapped in a cave, for example - but updates are regular and I find the game quite playable even as it is. Disclaimer: I generally play with cheats on - and I love that this is an option! Mostly, I play in Vegan Mode which disables all the cannibals and turns The Forest into a creepy survival game rather than horror survival game. I enjoy exploring the map, building stuff and trying to find enough food and water to live on while avoiding freezing to death. In fact I didn't buy the game until I discovered that it could be played with cheats. However, I do think that there is a lot of the game that I miss out on because of my hypersensitive nerves. There is also Vegetarian Mode which only disables cannibals by day and Ironforest which prevents destruction of your base by cannibals/players.I like that the mutants have their own culture and lives and one day, I swear, I will find the courage to find out more about them. If there was a cheat where I could infiltrate the cannibals and move amongst them without being attacked unless maybe I attacked them first that would just make my day.In the meantime, the map is quite stunning, visually. However, even with the cannibals themselves disabled, the artifacts that they leave around the island can be quite disturbing so I don't recommend to someone who just wants a pretty map and no crawling skin factor. Survival is challenging even without cannibals trying to eat your face. You need to get set up with shelter, fire, food and water pretty quickly. Saving is only possible on a bed (separate from sleeping). If you want to explore you need to make sure that you find a campsite well before dark as you can't carry enough to make a shelter in one go and trying to build at night while freezing and suddenly realising that you can't find any sticks where you are is not so fun. The map is large, but not massive, so after a while you can get bases set up around the map and things are less challenging in that respect. I have never played the multiplayer, but I imagine that it would be a great game to play cooperatively. There are plenty of resources and it's always less scary to have a friend along when mutants are trying to kill and eat you.Somehow, this is one of the game that I play most often, there is just something about it that keeps drawing me back. So, yes, I do recommend it. I only have 40 odd hours on record, so far, but it's one of the few games on my favourites tab, because I know I'll go back there before long even if it's just to see what the developers added in the latest patch.TL;DR It plays well, it looks great and updates are regular. There are cheats. And cannibals.

content:
Posted: July 29, 2016
Early Access Review
								Summary: Saying that this game is just a 'good early access' game discredits it to a certain extent. This game has so much content that, if released now, would be a very successful game. It's incredibly fun, with the right amount of horror added in. Not only that, but more content is continually being released by the devs and these are some of the most hard working devs I've seen.Pros and Cons:Pros:-Graphics are spectacular; this could be something that people debate, as it's not the graphics of a newer game. however, this game was in fact released in 2014, and it looks crazy good still today. -Animations are very beautiful; trees falling, mutants jumping at you, climbing ropes, all of these feel and look realistic. -Mechanics are nice for the most part. I like the crafting, fishing, and cutting down trees, and the realistic feel they offer. However, I think that the item carrying system could have a little work. You're limited to carrying about 6 rocks at once and 10 sticks, however I think that if they did a weight system, it'd be way easier. -Smart AI. The enemies will know they're losing when you kill 2/3 of their search party, and the third will flee. If you catch a cannibal in a noose trap, their friends can come and release them. if you leave one injured, another will drag them off. They'll send spies to investigate your base, to find weak spots for future attacks. It's really a spectacular thing to witness, expecially in an early access game. Most games I've played have extremely weak/overpoweringly fake AI, but this AI is extremely realistic.-Co-op. This game is incredibly fun with friends.Cons: -Frustrating building setup; this one is probably the number one issue I've experienced. Floors don't snap together, so they just overlay the other floors or get jagged edges. I'd ask the devs to look at ARK: Survival Evolved's building and sorta make it like that.-Small immersion-breaking bugs. Nothing game breaking, as I haven't had my game crash once, but just small things, like chopping down a tree and having a log fly up in the air. Small things like that.-No world consistency (that I've seen); When you get off the game and get back on later, suitcases fill up again, and trees respawn. I don't know if they will add consistency in the future and what that'll do to game optimization, but it's not all that distracting.TL;DR: Fantastic game for an extremely good price, enjoyable with friends, trustable developers.9/10. Dismembering cannibals never sounded better.

Early Access Review
								A fun thrilling game that I would recommend. The cannibals and mutations really give off a eerie feeling when you encounter them which gives off a strong sense of survival and danger and most importantly vulnerability. You usually cannot just attack a group of enemies without facing dire consequences you have to make the right decisions to stay prepared with items and bring stability to your base.There are some story elements to the game which are not fully completed but the devlopers are updating pretty steadily and so you may eventually have some sort of goal within the game if survival is not enough for you.The building is also fun. You can fairly large structures if you have the resources for it (takes a long time to gather wood and stone) although there is no grid feature to keep buildings and structures aligned and even so you will have to use your eye or some carefull aligning to build something accurately.Overall I recommend the game as there are features yet to come and it is an enjoyable experience werether with friends or alone.
