content:
Posted: March 22
Early Access Review
(22.03.2017)This game is great. It has a clear ending and is worth a playthrough right now, though I can see it becoming a lot better in the future. A must play in my opinion, if only to rush through it and get the pay off of the creepy ending chapter. The game is very moody, and I would suggest playing it with a friend.PROS:Very intuitive crafting system that will keep you entertained for hours if you are into that.Stamina, health, thirst and hunger system pretty good. It keeps you in need of being stocked up and actually foraging, but it doesn't limit you too much.Very satisfying and free movement of the character.The fights are fun and can have a strategic element.The story sort of slowly boils a bit in the background until it culminates rather explosively.The atmosphere makes the game very immersive, and a few key moments along the way are really suspenseful and extraordinary. Brings back the same feelings I had initially watching Lost as a teenager.The cave exploration is really cool. There are cool powerups that unlock other areas.Regular updates.The world feels rich and alive.CONS:Bossbattles are few and far between. Easy to avoid more challenging mobs, and the bosses that are there are too easy to kite and take down slowly.The game is overall too easy on the hardest difficulty setting.Needs more content of course, both for crafting and story. The narrative is very mood based, which is good, but the story itself is bland and clichè. Lots of untapped potential there.OVERALL 7,5/10INPUT:Enable fast toggling of markers. The markers were super handy IMO but it really cluttered the UI after a while.Add more wearable gear items like the rabbit shoes.Character customization. Individual story elements for co-op characters.More variation in enemies.More aggressive enemies. Too easy to kite or lead into a body of water.Final boss is a cakewalk.Add a few lines of dialogue scattered inbetween. The idea of suddenly meeting someone who said something intrigued me, but it never happened. There really are no mysterious supporting characters until the very end.Make us have to go after the second plane! This is probably your plan anyways though.Plug all the holes where you can fall through or see through world.Make it easier to remove old human body parts from campfires. They clogged up whenever I tried to make bones.Make building bases more rewarding.Make building defenses a necessity.

Early Access Review
								I used to have a pet turdle named Bob. Bob was my best friend.We ate lizards together, killed cannibals together and survived together.One day my hunger bar got low, and i was outta food.I ate Bob.RiP Real Review I have decided to edit this review one more time, to help you guys to decide on buying this game. Presentation You play as some random man whose plane crashes into some random island which just so happens to be infested with mutant cannibals. The point of this game is to just survive as long as you can in the enviornment around you. Looks really nice for a project like this, plus it was made in Unity.  Gameplay Like I kinda stated above, the point of this game is to survive. In order for you to survive, you must craft shelters, weapons and other stuff to make it easier to live. The current amount of craftable objects may not seem like much, but they will add more over time. You will be constantly hunting for other valuable resources like food and water. You will also be defending yourself from those mutant cannibals that roam around the island. The game ends once you die. The game is still a bit glitchy but still seems pretty good. Other Not much else to say for this one; the sound is fine, the game has a good amount of settings. The last thing you should know about this game is that its in Early Access, the game still gets updated constantly but it may be some time until its done. I can garentee you this game will be done since the consoles have teased this game and every game that is in Early Access (that I know of) that was teased on consoles have been released at some point.  Conclusion A very nice survival game, it may not have a lot of content at the moment but it does look very promising. Updates are released constantly but it will be just a bit more time before this game can be considered offically released.

content:
Posted: June 4, 2014
Early Access Review
								Survival games have become the hottest genre as of late. It does not matter if you are trying to survive alone against the wilderness, zombies, or other players. Survival will often make you do things you might not. This game is no exception. You are sitting next to a window on an airplane with a little boy holding your arm. You are given little clue as to who you are or who he is before the front of the airplane is ripped off and you are falling fast to the Earth below. Upon landing, you see a native (given the number of body parts on the island, I would say cannibal) take the little boy and leave. As you get up, you have little time to gather what you can scavenge around you before others are sure to come. And come they will.Starting off with only rocks and sticks, I grab a huge rock and began to bust open luggage, managing to find some rations and supplies. As I wandered, I could find other make shift camps but no one around, at least no one I wanted to bother with...yet. After starting a fire to cook a rabbit (seagulls, turtles, and other animals can be killed), nightfall began to set in. I had began to make a shelter but lacked logs to complete it. Then came flashlights waving around in the dark. I was not ready for a confrontation yet so I ran and began to explore. The island I landed on had caves to explore, water all around, another another island nearby with snowcapped mountains. Upon realizing I lacked any means to get logs for my shelter, I doubled back to where the flashlights had been to find my hunters were still near by. Armed with a makeshift spear, I began to attack them, killing two before the lights out.I awoke to a macabre horror. I was trapped in a dark cave, half filled with water, with bodies hanging from the ceiling all around me. With a lighter that constantly had to get lit (water will do that to it), I found a lot more supplies along with an axe, and a few other weapons. I found this helped my struggle quite a bit as I was able to escape underground after awhile, surfacing at last the claustrophobic tunnels.Fresh air and daylight, my new day began with heading back towards my shelter I was trying to build. I had started it on top of a cliff with a giant tree nearby, making it easy for me to find when needed. I learned my new found weapon doubled as a means to chop down trees to help me finish my shelter. Before I could finish, another group of cannibals found me. This time, I did not wake up in a cave. This time, it was the end.With this being an alpha build, it is easy to pass off graphical glitches (water in the game often looks off and broken when in it). I once had a turtle I could not smash with my rock and when viewing my inventory, the turtles image never left my screen, covering up what it was I was trying to see. The game sounded authentic once on the ground but I had hoped for more of a build up leading to the crash (the front of the airplane disappeared without a sound and I never once heard the boy next to me utter a sound). The natives are incredibly quiet and I had expected to be able to hear them once they got close, but this was not the case. Not even when I was attacking them did I hear them utter a grunt. I had one guy I beat on repeatedly and he eventually ran away despite the number of times I impaled him with my spear but the next guy went down with just a few thrusts.The game is very intuitive in that it was easy to learn how to use what was around me very quickly. On screen prompts when seeing berries to eat, supplies to scavenge, or and how to duck were very helpful. Despite not being very good at survival games, I found what I discovered in this game to very enjoyable, even at this early of release. I definitely look forward to seeing what the developers have in store and the game has a handy count down on the main menu to let you know when to expect the next update. And expect I shall. I look forward to my next trip to The Forest as I learn from my mistakes and work on my survival skills(Tip: don't build your shelter too far away from logs you will need to cut down, if you can find an axe that is).

Review after patch 0.34v  Category Rating   Graphics  8.5/10   Multiplayer 7.5/10   Singleplayer 8/10   Crafting 9.5/10   Open World 10/10   Enemy's 10/10   Developers 11/10 • Graphics are beautiful but they need to work with grass,underwater and trees.• Multiplayer is kinda 50/50, some jerk can join anytime (exept if you are playing in invite-only session) and destroy your all hard work. (if you want to avoid it, I recommend to save after every 15minutes and if somebody destorys your base, you can always leave immediately and host server again) But if you meet nice people you can have a lot of fun.• Singleplayer is pretty much same as multiplayer, exept you play it alone(NO $HIT Sherlock) and you don't have to worry about toxic or salty people. There isn't really a story, ok there is BUT basically you have to find Timmy but you can't find Timmy...wierd, isn't it? It's unknown that is he alive or not, all what we know is that:1. In the v0.02 changelog posted on June 15, 2014, the developers mentioned the child's name: Timmy.2. In a list of passengers, found in the game files, there is a passenger called "Timmy." sitting next to another called "James.". It's assumed these passengers are Timmy and James.3. In the same list his passport number is D2B56224. New entry in the 'To do list' -finding timmy- More about Timmy HERE[theforest.gamepedia.com]• Crafting- You can almost craft everything to survive. Things you can craft.[theforestmap.com] from medicine to waterskin and more.• Open World- MAP IS HUGE, LIKE REALLY HUGE from caves to snowy mountains, discovering entire map takes a lot of time and map is full of details. Full map.[theforestmap.com]• Enemies- All about enemies aka cannibals.HERE[theforest.gamepedia.com]• Developers-Endnight Games aka best company ever. They listen and care about community and they update The Forest after EVERY two weeks, also they fix most common bugs and glitches after every update.  Easy and simple, what else could you ask from them..........NOTHING.

content:
Posted: November 24, 2014
Early Access Review
								Not much time in game yet, still trying to work out some kinks myself especially with saving/loading. But somehow, this game designed by a small team, runs smoother and has greater gameplay then some of the damn major company releases that are failing miserably (Ubisoft AC:UNITY comes to mind...).That being said, if you plan to purchase the game: IT IS ALPHA. This isnt the final product, so keep that in mind. You are basically paying so you can test the game and aid the dev team.System Specs:AMD FX6300 3.5ghz8gb DDR3GeForce 770 OC 2gb1TB WD Black Sata HDDOne thing I will say, is the way the AI works for enemies. Now there are still a few bugs; Cannibals getting stuck on a rock here and there, or blatantly ignoring you until you slap em. But the AI is actually pretty entertaining. Scouting parties will roam around with a flashlight in the dark and actually appear from a distance like survivors. They will roam and look for you if they see a fire. They sometimes leave a person behind that will remain in the area to keep scouting while they move on. And they are F*ckin Vicious lol. If you want to break away from the mindless, boring zombie apocalypse survival games that just launch slow moving easily killed zombies, check this one out.I haven't gotten to build much, but I like that the game provides a mini-survival book with some essentials and guidelines - but also provides the blueprints to enable self-made homes and barriers instead of jus "Your shack must look like this". Oh and don't run over your firepit... bad things happen.Graphically, for how intense and detailed the game is, it runs very smooth on high for me. As well as looking MUCH nicer than most of the newer games I played. There is still some glitching with water and such, lightning as well, where it wont exactly sit directly where it should. But it is alpha, I can overlook a tiny part of a lake floating a little above the land... I can't overlook a graphical failure that causes FPS below 10 on a well-built gaming rig.Combat is kinda interesting. The cannibals hurt... so get ready for it if you plan to beat on one... Made the mistake of thinking these would be just like the zombies. Not so much. If you do get beaten by one, enjoy what happens next ;). There isn't much else to say here - Youre not a battle god dual wielding thors hammer, so don't think you can just simply walk around all day/night without worry. The encounters are random, the scouting parties patrol to find you and your camp, and yes - if you keep fires burning... they will start bringing more enemies to take care of you.I like that I cant just punch a tree down, or build huge houses in a matter of moments after punching down said trees. The game will entice you. There isnt a moment you actually feel safe, even after you get into the shelter. Even with a molotov cocktail in your inventory. Since the second I loaded it up, till early this morning when I started again... I always felt out-manned and out-gunned lol.

content:
Posted: July 23, 2016
Early Access Review
Kill a cannibal, chop off his arm, and ♥♥♥♥♥slap his friends all the way to their campsite.I have tried many early access games in my time, and only a few of them are actually worth buying in this stage. The Forest is one of them. It's bizarre, dark, twisted, gory, and haunting. Once you realise the deep trouble you are in, you will not have a moment's chance to relax and take it easy.After a plane crash, your son is abducted by cannibals and you are left nearly dead on the crash site. Your objective is to survive and explore the island to discover where your son is kept and its backstory. That is until you realise you are not alone at all...The game looks beautiful. The island you are in, has forests, lakes, caves and beaches for you to explore. Seems like heaven. Everything is detailed nicely and you can even observe little birds coming to sit on your hand at times. *DISNEY PRINCESS MODE ENGAGED* You will hear waves crashing on rocks, animals rattling leaves, the song of the birds, and many more sounds appropriate for the landscape. It makes you feel immersed like few games.The survival part is a bit classic, but the crafting system is reimagined in an interesting way. You can carry only a small number of resources, while heavy items like wood logs are better transported to your campsite with sleds. You can craft storage areas for rocks, branches etc that will come in handy later. As for the shelters, you got a plethora of huts and cottages to construct in order to escape from rain (you can even make a treehouse!. Then you got traps, walls, etc. Since there's no minimap (or map in general), an icon pops up in your screen indicating where your unfinished constructions are, so you can always find them. However, it could use some extra freedom with building. But I'm willing to look past that.The enemies are interesting to deal with. At first, they will not hunt you down, they will merely observe you from the shadows and the bushes. Then, they will try to investigate you and your constructions, and then they just might hunt you down by attacking your weakest spots in your defences. If one of them escapes, he will rush back to their camp and call for help to your last known spot. They may scout your base for supplies, organise surprise attacks during the day and set up effigies to warn you to stay away. If you manage to handle them properly though, they will respect you and bow before you, thinking you are some kind of god. They operate in a sophisticated scale which is a refreshing feature in survival games. On the downside, due to the game being a bit unfinished, they act goofy at times, like cramping up in places and not be able to move anywhere or running around without purpose. The real way to play this game, however, is coop. Get a friend and join forces to conquer The Forest. There's a built-in voice chat feature which makes things easier when you are not in the same room. And that's some really good thinking. Aside some weird bugs, the game is in a really good playable state and the price is ok, but i still suggest to grab it in a sale. It's worth your time, especially if you are a hardened survival veteran.RATING:Gameplay: 8/10Presentation: 8.5/10Story: 7/10Unique Factor: Enemy AI: 8.5/10OVERALL: 8/10

content:
Posted: October 1, 2015
Early Access Review
								Pros:+Breathtaking Graphics+Great Sounds+Great Survival Roots+Interesting Enemies (They themselves are an interesting group)+Interesting Enemy AI (Don't expect full hostility. The tribe doesn't just want to take you down... Not at first anyways)+Natural Fear as Opposed to Forced+Co-Op (Haven't tried it yet, but that's the next step)+A Constant Sense of Urgency+A Clock of When the Next Update isCons that are possibly related to it being in Early Access:-Extreme Lack of Content at this point (There is no story besides the intro cutscene. Currently the only thing to do is to.. survive and explore. I'm hoping for the different optional paths in the story. Such as saving the kid who is probably your son, escaping the island, joining one of the tribes, eliminating the mutants or sealing off the caves and other such things)-Bugs (Nothing gamebreaking for me so far. Some floating rocks, the ability to walk through dead trees and drying racks, but nothing big)-Would greatly benefit from random events! The enemys are great, but as of right now there is no motive to put yourself in the action... I think I stayed up only one night and nothing happened. Would be interesting for a Bermuda Triangle type deal! Electronics stop working in the area, resulting in many plane and boat disappearances... which you can explore and rescue survivors and they become companions(yes/no?) The point is there isn't a whole lot of action yet... (I'm sure they will add content of some sort)-Not many weapons (There are axes, clubs, bows, spears and one katana. You can only craft axes, bows and clubs. The other stuff you have to find. The bow doesn't do anything to mutants, so that leaves axes and clubs, which the club for me is too slow, so really my only option is an axe.)-Death isn't anything to worry about, making the game... not as scary. When you die, the mutants drag you to a cave and conveniently leave you with all your stuff and right by the entrance of the cave. Not only that, but the cave and village above the cave are full of powerful loot (Dynamite and Modern Axes). I've died 3 or 4 times and everytime there were no monsters anywhere so I just grabbed loot and went back home. It is almost rewarding to die. The only way to fully die that I've seen is to die and be taken to the cave and then die again inside the cave... so the creatures don't scare me anymore. (Maybe they haven't finished the death sequence?)-Creatures become much less eerie after getting a pattern. At first it feels like you can't even kill one monster, but really if you set them on fire or knock them to the ground and pound on their head it's pretty simple. Especially since their AI isn't very unique during fights. All they do is stay a small distance and circle you and then when confident they come in and attack. When they attack they do more flailing then anything strategic. Would be nice to see the packs surround you and take you out. One man shouldn't be able to take on two, let alone 3-5. It would be nice if they were dangerous enough to make me want to hide. (Could be fixed with additions to AI)-No destruction of enemy bases (I don't think they are going to add this, but... it would be nice to be able to disable the tribes foothold.Cons?:-I'm kind of on the fence about this one... there are the normal tribesmen and they are beautifully done (except the linear combat), but there are also "mutants" that are part of the tribes... they are basically big tanks and me personally... I think it kind of kills the scare factor. It doesn't scare me that a slow, giant made of multiple arms and legs is swinging in my direction. It's kind of creepy that I have to throw three sticks of dynamite to kill him, but other than that... not really. I want enemies that are smarter and faster than I am. The normal tribesmen aren't scary because of their looks or strength. They are scary because there are hundreds of them, they not only want to harm you, but they stalk you... you are their prey. They are hunting you... and they are... well they are supposed to be good at it. I think I'd prefer just the tribe, but the big mutants also have their pros. For instance, in the trailer I saw one break down a whole wall to let the rest of the tribe in... I would've **** my pants... but I haven't seen anything like that happen so.-I'm just being knit-picky here, but seriously what are the chances that not only your plane crashes and you survive, but you land on an island filled with cannibal mutants and find a convenient survival guide and hatchet?-I can't really think of much for cons that aren't just because it's in early access... There is no toggle crouch button!Summary: Great game that is only $15! Right now, I got 8 hours of singleplayer gameplay just from the survival aspects. It is my opinion that when the full game is released, it will be AAA quality. I bet by full release, you will be able to get 10 (If you only do the story, some exploring and basic survival) to 30 hours of gameplay on one playthrough, but this is the type of game that you can be able to play again and each time have a unique experience. (Especially if they add procedural generation)... There is one guy in the reviews who has 400+ hours of gameplay as of now... I think that is a little excessive, but you get the point.

content:
Posted: March 21, 2016
Early Access Review
								The Forest is a game where you are a plane crash survivor, seeing your son get taken away by a mysterious figure. You exit the plane after you wake up fully and see a beautiful forest, light shafts peering through the leaves. You have a survival book, some soda, some protein bars, and an axe you found lodged in the head of an innocent flight attendant in the plane. You need to survive, if you don't you die. (No♥♥♥♥♥♥ Now that i'm done with the summary, let me just say, this game is amazing. Yes, it used to be buggy, but it really has come a long way. I, as well as many of the other backers/buyers of early access are VERY proud of the developers for getting this far in development. They are still actively developing this great game, and I am satisfied.Graphics: 8.9/10 (Very beautiful graphics)UI: 7.5/10 (Pretty solid)Animations: 8/10 (Great)Multiplayer/Co-Op: 6/10 (Good, just wish there were better implemented systems and more character models!)Singleplayer: 10/10 (TERRIFYING)Crafting: 9/10 (Very unique)Enemies/Cannibals: 10/10 (Creepy, Insane, VERY well done)Content Amount: 7.8/10 (Not an insane amount, wish there was a bit more)Map Design/Size: 8/10 (Pretty big and nicely done)Community: 6/10 (Small, quiet, friendly)Overall Rating: 8.4/10 (Very well done, but not finished yet. It's not a triple AAA title by any means, but it is a great game, and deserves this rating and recoginition.Reason I gave this rating is because I generally like this game. I am no fan boy by any means, but have been following the development since the 3rd Quarter of 2014, and I can say the game has come very far! I, as many others do look forward to the further development of this game.How many hours will you get out of this game no matter who you are? Between 30-160 (You won't get very much replayability out of the game as of now)Thank you for reading my review. If you would like to see more of my reviews, check out my profile.

Early Access Review
								You are the sole surivor of an airplane crash on a remote island.  Your fellow passangers, who by judging from the contents of their suitcases were tennis players that were hopped up on prescription drugs.  You obviously were not one of them given how you whine and complain about being cold and wet hungry and thirsty and tired all the time.  It's ironic that you were the one who survived.  The island itself is beautiful and you can choose to live in the snow capped mountains or a tropical beach and it's not without its cast of colorful characters- mainly cannibales in various stages of mutation.  Would I recommend this game absolutley!!! I have almost 200 hours logged in playing.  Given that it's an alpha build you have to be patient with the devlopers its not without its glitches and bugs but unlike other games I have played, the developers are always working on it to fix problems and add new content.  If you like survival games where you have to build cabins, tree houses hunt and fish or explore caves then this is the game for you.  One of the BEST features that is included are the cheat modes- put in by the developers.  If you just want to play as a survivor with no mutants you can.  If you want to play with them just coming out at night you can.  I thought the game was worth the money especially given that is is always evolving

Early Access Review
								Your plane crashes. You wake up to see a mutant stealing your child. You decide that you must survive, but how does one survive? You follow your first instincts and kill those mutants and dismember their bodies. Sorting the limbs, heads, and torsos into separate piles and creating a ritual of sacraficing the torsos to the cliff gods. The remaining body parts are put on stakes and burned to show the other tribal islanders who's boss. You're not sure if these effigies frighten the tribals or turn them more aggresive, but you disreguard this thought and continue building your glorious meat statues. Some time passes, either hours or years, your sense of time has completely faded because your days consist of only murder, dismemberment, and cutting down trees. One day while you're speaking to yourself about how little you actually know about these mutants and hacking away at one of their necks with your axe you finally cut through it's vertebrae and the head separates from the body and somehow rockets you into the air and off a cliff, killing you instantly.11/10Would turn into a satanic mutant sacraficing maniac again.

content:
Posted: January 20, 2016
Early Access Review
								This game...this ♥♥♥♥ing game...You've recovered from the plane crash, and begun gathering supplies.It's getting dark. You've finished gathering enough sticks to keep your fire lit for the night, and you're on your way back to your piecemeal camp, where you lay your head til dawn.......and then you spot him.There's a man, quite clearly insane and probably a cannibal, creeping around outside your camp.Do you attempt to sneak up on him and take him out silently, or simply abandon all of the work you've done so far, taking your chances further afield somewhere within The Forest?A blow to the back of the head makes the decision for you, and you awaken upside-down in a dark cave.Between you and your only chance of life on the surface are a myriad of unknown horrors, dangers, and darkness.You probably won't make it out alive... but if you do, your life will never be the same again, as you wage a one-man guerilla war on an entire tribe of the most devious creatures known to mankind.--------------One of the best developed, most atmospheric and incredibly satisfying survival experiences you'll ever have.The developers add new, somewhat unexpected amounts of additional content every month, as well as constantly addressing performance issues. This is a prima facia case of Early Access being used to it's finest extent.It's tense, it's rewarding, the systems are fantastic and the concepts are brilliant.The graphics are STUNNING, and the survival mechanics are the best available in the genre to date.I can't WAIT to see the finished product, but it's worth twice the price it sells for already!

content:
Posted: February 4, 2015
Early Access Review
 Let's do an assessment of each mode:  Single Player: Whilst you play the game alone, you start to have much more nervous tendancies, this encourages The Forest's type of gameplay. Everytime you try to collect materials, try to explore, or even try to gather food, your nerves are stretched and stressed. This is mostly knowing that there could just be that large group of cannibals nearby, who are more than willing to gnaw on your ankles. I highly reccomend doing the single player before going into the multiplayer, as it has a much more survivalist horror feel to it, a feel that almost every other Early Access Game i've played attempted but in the end failed to achieve. Multiplayer The Multiplayer is fantastic, although that is mostly due to how much you need to expose yourself in order to gather the most basic of items, players can fully take advantage of this, and become much more of a threat than any cannibals could achieve. Although if you are working together with other players on the multiplayer, you will likely power through the game, something which is a huge issue right now with a lack of content for the 'endgame'. Don't be disheartened however, as so far the game even in multiplayer can keep it's horror-survivalist tones. Additional Thoughts Although this is in early access, we need a lot more content, this game has the current capabilities to become a very great game, however, that does not gaurantee it will become that.  Same as with every other Early Access. I do really hope the Devs work hard on this game, giving us more content, hopefully even allowing the game to be modded. Such content introducing things as this will create a very good game.Graphics - The current graphics of the game are very beautiful, the skybox and rain effects are much better than i've seen in most 'AAA Titles'. Although there is some unecesary blurred textures in some areas this is an Early Access so these hopefully will be fixed. Sound and Ambient - The sound and ambience within this game will not help to calm you, surroundings will react to you being nearby, animals will run over sticks and through bushes when your gathering, making you worried of what may be around. This adds to the theme of the game greatly.TLDR:Single player is gud but need some sort of endgame Multiplayer is gud but needs more of a challenge for multiple playersNeeds Mod support!The more content that is released, the more I will enjoy this game, and I currently highly reccomend it.

Multi Player where your have a friend on the boat and if they go into the inventory they glitch off and can slide off the boat.3. I know it's still in Beta [ or whatever it is before Alpha release] but the game is quite amazing, So far I've traveled to the colder region where the snow is. My friends and I are setting up a camp and diving more into the world, it's great and a large area to explore. The enemies can become quite over whelming when they swarm you in a group of 5/7 but if you have a decent set of people your good but its a great game for survival, building and fighting off cannibals.

The whole time, even during the day, your ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ is clenched so hard you could cut through steel. Eventually after two hours of playing it becomes so exhausted you aren't able to hold your♥♥♥♥♥♥in anymore and then you start ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ yourself. Then somehow it gets worse at night because you can't see anything past your campfire. You will want to punch a baby right in the face from all the anxiety it gives you.Also the deer can become submarines and go underwater so that's pretty cool.Overall, 9/10, would get♥♥♥♥♥♥♥by mutant cannibals again.

content:
Posted: April 14
Early Access Review
								#HonestReviews - For "The Forest (2014)". [NO SPOILERS]Overall Rating: 8.6 Excellent!Graphics: 9/10Gameplay: 9/10Audio: 9/10Content: 7/10Multiplayer: 8/10Price: 10/10---------------------------GRAPHICS - 9/10:---------------------------The graphics for this game in my opinion is outstanding for the genre and game type it's specifically refering to. In everygame, there is always room for improvement, but for my understanding I think the graphics on this game are just fantastic. Everything works togethwer well.----------------------------------------------------------GAMEPLAY & PERFORMANCE - 9/10:----------------------------------------------------------The gameplay in this game works really well, it's smooth and fairly optimized, however, I am running 2 GTX 1080s Superclocked, so other's performance may vary. But overall, the performace is fine. The overall gameplay is amazing and has a lot to offer.-------------------AUDIO- 9/10:-------------------The audio in this game likie most games are good. It's just what you'd expect it to be, realistic, and just pure amazingness!--------------------------CONTENT - 7/10:--------------------------For the content of this game I am not as happy with as everything else. The game at this current stage is in Alpha and I expect to see more content released in the near future, however, the game has been in Alpha for quite a while which is disappointing - Like some games that have Alpha for over 4-5 years and release small fixes and patches every few months. This game however as far as I have seen release patches every 2 weeks.The story of this game and end game looks to be unfinished and has been improving since it's early release of the game. I hope to see improvement here too. In my opinion, at this stage it felt a bit 'rushed' to me when I completed the game.It seems that after you've played a few hours of the game that there is not much else to do after building a base and completing the game. Playing Solo can be a bit boring and repetitive as you constantly knock down trees for hours to get the required materials you need in order to complete the things you make.The building in the game is amazing though, simple and easy to use, but you are limited to what you can build as in my opinion again, the lack of items is annoying; it seems like there is not much to build other than a house, walls around it and some light source, of course; you have your decorations etc, but I feel this is a BIG area that needs to be improved.---------------------------------MULTIPLAYER - 9/10:---------------------------------The multiplayer on this game works really well, however, you may experience some bugs and glitches. In addition, there are mods for the game that people can easily abuse and use to ruin games and the fun that people have. The multiplayer works really well and smooth compared to other games like this, I think this game has a great multiplayer setup.The devs have worked hard in fixes loads of issues with multiplayer and single player. But I've ntoiced the differences and I can tell you the game is just getting better and better.Note: At the time of this Review... The devs are currently working on getting dedicated servers for the game which I think will be even better although it's amazing as it is. ---------------------PRICE- 10/10:---------------------All I can say is the price is good for what the game has to offer. This may change in the future though.---------------------Overall, you should buy this game if you like Survival Horror Building games. The game seems to be improving rapidly, so expect more fun!Thanks for reading,#HonestReview by Lewis2014.Notes: If you woul like more detailed honest reviews on this or any other games I have, please contact me.---------------------

content:
Posted: December 28, 2014
Early Access Review
								To Long; Wont Read: This game is an 8.5/10 from me, with a great potential of one day being a solid 10/10. IT feels like a survival game that you actually have to work to survive.  Would recomend to a freind. This is my second review ever on a video game (Rust Legacy), I have been using Steam for multiple years. With that being said, a game has to be bloody amazing for me to take the time to sit down and right a review. I had my doubts about purchasing this game, after having watched multiple youtube video's it seemed like the game was not has hard or "scary" as a few videos had made it out to be. The graphics looked nice, but it looked like a.. as a previous review called it: "Lumberjack Simulator"After recieving some Christmas money, I deceided to take the plunge and get it. No Regrets.I described this game to a buddy last night, and I think my description was pretty accurate:"Imagine being on an island with a bunch of cannibals that have never seen technology before, have their own system of rules, and outnumber you severely. That's what playing this "Game" is. The AI in this game acts exactly as I would expect a civilization within those parameters (right word for that I believe) to act... And some of the most beautiful scenery/graphical detail that I have seen in a video game in a long time."It should be important to note here, that I dont do Alpha games often, this is only the third I have ever done, and the first that I have enjoyed that FELT like an Alpha. There are some clear bugs in this game, none that are what I would call game breaking - that I have encountered - but some clear bugs none the less. Co-Op is a bit wonky, but its fairly new to the game, and should be hashed out within the next few patches.What I enjoyed most about this game is that it actually FEELS like survival. Rust was (is (Legacy Rust)) great but it didnt FEEL like a survival game, once you get a small base established, there really wasnt much that could threaten you save for other players, getting a base established wasnt that hard, and although occasionaly things went wrong, they never really felt like a struggle. In The Forest, from the moment you step off the plane it FEELS like you really have your work cut out for you. The scenery is beautifal in that Tropical Rainforest kind of way, the wild life feels a bit.. how to describe this.. not out of place, but automated, but it doesnt really detract from the greatness of the situation. And then you encounter the first Native. Its an odd moment, and one that I have never had the same outcome to. How you act, greatly sets the pace of the game, I wont ruin the reactions to you, but will give you something to think about. Actions have consequences that you will feel the vibrations from for your entire playthrough. From what I understand the developer seems to play their cards close to their chest, but has been reliable thusfar in patching the game and providing new content updates. It seems like (from what I have heard) that they dont always get the job done 100% the first time, but they DO follow through and correct any wrongs. In my opinion thats a great sign, no one expects a small team to deliver an A+ on every patch, but when faults are discovered, they deserve to be (and are) corrected. I mentioned previously in the review that a few video's on youtube have made this out to be an incredibly scary game, but I dont believe the viewer really gets an understanding of that without being in the game themselves. The game is not scary, and I dont think it intends to be. With that being said, the game DOES have a large amount of.. ( I sat here for a few minutes trying to put a word to the feeling you - I - get when playing this game, because I am unable to do so, I will describe the time when I get this feeling) The feeling is the same one you get when your watching a horror movie that ISNT scarry, but is full of jump scares. The feeling when you know that something is getting ready to leap out at you, there is no suprise about it coming, you just dont know when its going to happen. That feeling is present in a large portion of this game, and it does it very well. EDIT: Suspenseful.. that would have been a good word for this (lol)I compared this title to the only other title in the same or similar genre that I have played and enjoyed (Rust) even though their are vasts differences between the two. With that being said, I expect to spend just as many hours having fun with this game as I have had with Rust Legacy. (800 hours at the time of writing)Just in case you were wondering about performance- My Specs: Playing with everything maxed out I never noticed a drop in framerates or any other visual performance issue (although the terrain sometimes has issues with Boulders/Cliffs from what I can tell, Animals sometimes have no collision with them)GTX 7602- 120GB SSD (which this game is installed on)1 TB HDD 2x4 GB Ram 1600hzMSI 970A-G46 MoboPro's:Survival game that feels like its a survival gameAmazing AINo set strategy, different outcomes based on different actionsLarge amount of craftable items that have clear benefits/purposeJust enough in game support (like the crafting manual) where you arent totally lost, but can still experement with things yourself.Con's:No ability to draw or create a map (from what I have found so far) so getting the layout has been doable, but difficult.No hostile animals (from what I have found) other than sharksHas enough bugs that you remain aware that the game still needs work, nothing that makes it unplayable (imo) but enough that immersion is sometimes broken.Things I would like to see in the future: Better Rafts/Houseboats3rd Person (Im torn on this one, I think 3rd person would be awesome, but it might break the Fear Factor)Better Bow (the Bow is really strong, but wildly inaccurate, would rather it be a tool to use where the hitting factor is determined by Skill, not RNG. (or maybe it is and I am just really bad with it)Better realisim on wildlife

								The Forest is a great survival/horror Game!This Game is about you and your journey to find your son, who got kidnappedfrom a Tribe of really mad natives. Also Cannibals are on your Butt and try to eat your legs!The Building-System is pretty good eventough there are bugs here and there,but thats not a Problem because the Game is constantly getting updated.The Developers even did the feature to show the exact time when the Update is coming out.This can be seen on the bottom left corner of the menu ingame.The Game is still in early acces so if bugs or glitches happen, the developers will fix it soon!So all in all this is a Great Survival game and is worth a try.In my opinion its one of my favourite survivalgame, because it's a survival game we have not seen yet.If you take DayZ, H1Z1, Rust or any other survival game then you will see its not that hard, but in this game it's different! You are constantly focused and ready to react quick, because the natives are on you and watch you!The Co-op mode is a lot of Fun!But you should play it with friends and not play on an online server, the other players can annoy some times.In multiplayer there are some bugs, but those are not critical.The Story isn't really there yet. It's still in development.Everyone who is interested in a good survival game has to try! :D

number of helpful: 42 of 57 people (74%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 30, 2014
Early Access Review
								From having only played an hour so far, I would say that this game has a lot of potential. Many features in the game are quite simplistic, such as the crafting menu and your player's inventory. There's almost no hassle when using them, and you won't get confused. The only bad thing about the crafting is that once you place a blueprint down, you can't remove it to build somewhere else (at least I haven't found a way to yet).The atmospheric tone of the game is excellent. It's very dark and creepy, especially if you venture into the cave systems. The lighting is well done, both inside the caves and outside, and the sounds are simply brilliant. The mutants/tribesmen--whatever they actually are--add a more ominous element to the game, and they work surprisingly well early on in the game's stage.If you're a fan of survival games, The Forest is definitely for you. You can get a spear and use it to go fishing, or just run around with it attacking things like a madman. Aside from fish, I've only seen lizards and rabbits so far as a food source, as well as energy bars. There are quite a few bugs that I've noticed while playing, but that is to be expected in alpha. Certain objects, namely some rocks and containers, have no mass and you can walk straight through them. Some tools, such as the second axe you find in the game, can be replicated repeatedly. I had amassed a large stack of them at my camp by accident while switching to other tools. I wouldn't worry too much about the bugs right now. The development team of this game seems very promising, and I have the utmost faith that they will fix them to the best of their abilities.Overall, I would definitely recommend this game to any survival or horror fanatic.

number of helpful: 25 of 28 people (89%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 14, 2014
Early Access Review
								 My thoughts on "The Forest"After making a few videos on it and Clocking some Hours And spending what I had left on it I have a few things to say.Yes you should buy it, you don't need to buy it, but you should. It is perfect for survival junkies and slates the special Itch I've been having for these types of games. The gameplay, though a bit clunky when you encounter a glitch, is still very responsive, and evey swing with your weapon has a very real weight to it. Every encounter with the mutants are usually jarring especially when they sneak up on you, Props to the developers that made it so chopping down a tree can be a tense click session so you can get the supplies and get the hell outa there. The AI is a bit clunky and it gets a bit weird, But when it works it's a good scare when the Tribals come to eat your lovely manflesh.After a Few recordings I truly see how beautiful this game can get and graphically it is lovely, but you might need a beefy Graphics card and processor to run it at max.The blood feature is also a good nod to show that you also need to keep good hygene and keep from getting mucked up with blood can get a wound infected, and the gathering of food is rather nice, Spearing fish and skinning rabbits and lizard to get armor and keeping yourself well fed. The Stealth is rather responsive, hiding behind trees and ducking behind rocks to keep your location unknown you your visitors is good, and I find it interesting that the tribals Will actively watch over their territory, sending patrols out that can locate your camp, and will at times wait in the trees for you to return.The Forest it's self is a enemy to you, you can easily get lost and end up stumbling upon Hungry Tribals, or just loosing your barrings in General. But of course there are some hiccups, at times you can pick up items but they end up deleting out of your inventory, The inventory system could also use a fix so I'm not panicing trying wo switch to my axe when ambushed at the pond.What I want, Coop, and some better tools and weapons, and a Gilly suit would do nice for the stealth.Those and some more building options like Tree houses or Hidden homesBut besides that the game is worth your time, and 15 bucks is a good asking price for this Rather lovely game.So give it a chance and let yourself get lost in this True Survival Horror.

Early Access Review
								Horror Lumberjack Simulator 2015Try 1 -I spawn, i go to break open some luggage, gollum kills me. I wake up in the caves. I spend around an hour finding the exit. I finally climb out of the caves on a rope ladder and come out into this shed looking thing. I walk around, stretching my legs from the cramped caves. I fall back into the hole, only to die.Try 2 -I spawn again, only this time, Im on the beach. I decide to take a different approach. I quickly build a hunting shelter. I spend the night in the shelter huddling by my fire that got eventually put out by the rain. The next day, I directly go to build a small raft. I finally build it only to find out that it lacks a sail. After a really quick search, I realize that it hasnt been implemented yet. I decide to push the raft along and find a more suitable beach for life. I dock my raft in a little pond of invisible water right by the shore. I immediately place a large house. It requires 82 logs. I slave away until night time lumberjacking my hands off. After I put the last log I had into the house, I still had 12 logs left to collect. Then it dawned on me. I had no shelter made. I hastily put together a ramshackle standing fire and huddled by it as the natives gathered closer. Eventually the fire died as did I. By now, I was just so done. I just ran out of the caves and got killed by a native right as I came out. I turned off my computer. I just sat there, looking at a black, empty screen.10/10 would die again

content:
Posted: January 21, 2015
Early Access Review
								in this show, you're set in alternate universe of "Home Improvement", where Tim Allen and Richard Karn (in co-op) crash land on a forest island during a vacation between seasons of "Tool Time". The primary goal of the game is to quickly ignore your kidnapped child and set about building tree houses and gazebos. to build your gazebos and cabin mansions, you need to deforest roughly 2/3rds of the forest to acquire enough logs. This is proven easy, however, since the plane crash has rendered both Tim and Richard the ability to chop down trees and run with logs at record speeds.As well as extremely inefficient carpentary, Tim and Richard have taken cues from Martha Stewart, and you're given the ability to decorate your weapons with teeth, or make festive human effigies that spruce up the now tree-devoid camp site. you can also decorate yourself in raw lizard skin and deer hides.your main adversary in the game are the birds. songbirds will swarm you like angry bees, and seagulls will fly out of your mouth from time to time. a proven method to deal with the birds is to surround yourself with a fire, which will burst the offending birds into flames, or simply standing next to a fire will suffice. Birds do not sleep.all in all a good game.

number of helpful: 26 of 31 people (84%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 11
Early Access Review
								Such a great game! Sure it has its bugs because well it is an alpha after all, but it is sooo much fun to play! Its hard to write about the pros and cons for this game as it is only alpha. The Forest features its own unique style of building and crafting as well a horde of enemies. Enemies are passive until provoked or become too curious per say... You can leave 'em alone, kill 'em, or chop 'em up and eat them! I appreciate that the game has a co-op feature as an alpha build and in my time playing with friends it has been a delightful experience of horror survival fun. The game looks good and runs well with the exception of fps drops that sometimes happen when entering caves and getting launched because of the bugginess of the log carts & logs. Not sure what solo survival is like, but I can say co-op with friends is really fun. The story is rather interesting and I would like to see what the devs do to expand upon the story and its elements, and yeah this game is beatable with its own ending. Beat the game in normal mode and unlock the game's experimental hardmode with tougher enemies. All in all, I would definitely recommend buying (even in its early access state), and playing this game.10/10

content:
Posted: August 9, 2016
Early Access Review
								Day 1: I awaken from my inflight nap to find this creepy looking kid clinging to my arm.. I knew I should of paid extra for busniess class. I look around the otherwise empty plane. Where the ♥♥♥♥ is my inflight meal and booze? there's a little turbulance and next thing we are minus half a plane and going down. Lol that kid isn't wearing his safety belt. He's screwed. We crash and I black out.I awaken once again, to a near naked oiled up man-thing scooping up the unconsious child, this upsets me somewhat because now I have no one to offer as a peace sacrifice to the natives. After he runs off into the bushes with the kid I yell "SHOULD OF WORN YOUR SAFETY BELT YOU LITTLE ♥♥♥♥" I help myself to numerous trays of inflight meals and booze glorious booze that due to some miracle survived the plane crash and are still sitting neatly on seats and shelves. I pick up random pill bottles and devour the contents and collect a pedometer from a foot, how ironic. Lucky for me, I am a paranoid survival enthusiast and was wearing my outdoor back pack complete with survival guide in preparation for this very event. Exiting the half a plane, grabbing a conviently placed fire axe fitted snuggly in that slack flight attendants chest, I raid a few luggage cases of the non existant passengers, mmm sexy panties. Wandering the beach at sunset, alchohol lines the beaches, natures natural drink cooler and notice a group of nudists. ♥♥♥♥ yes. This island is awesome. I run up to them waving my drink in greeting. The god of ♥♥♥♥ and wine has blessed this place!! They stare at me like I am some kind of freak, probably because I'm wearing clothes and this has obviously offended thier religon because the nearest native attempts to claw my eyejellies out, shocked I hi 5 him in the face with my axe and the natives flee, shiny butts bouncing in the sunlight. I keep moving, being the survivalist I am I slaughter a few fluffy bunnies and a lizard, skin them and find a nice spot to set up for the night. I start a fire with my trusty everlasting lighter. Thank goodness they kindly let me bring my lighter aboard the plane! I build a small shelter out of sticks and cook myself a lizard, you can just taste the intestinal parasites! Day 2-4:Not only am I a paranoid survival enthusiast. But I'm also an architect and master of construction! I have found a nice spot to start my new life here on this island, no point trying the planes radio, salvaging and rebuilding the yatch or boats I spotted on the beach or any of that ♥♥♥♥.I have lashed together some sticks to form a sturdy log sled! I have about 6 logs stacked ontop of the tiny twigs and another 2 logs carried by myself, with one arm. I push the sled along with the mere power of my pinky toe thankful for my Russian hertiage. I build myself a snazzy tree house because daddy issues meant I never had one as a child. I stash my porn in it along with the panties I salvaged from the wreck. I've got 4 walls, a drying rack, a fire, storage facilaties for my supplies, a freaking gazebo and a bunch of death traps surrounding my walls for those pesky natives, who despite the abundance of wildlife and edible plants, have opted for human flesh instead... Gotta hand it to them though, they have some really inspiring art peices, the man shoved through his own tennis rackets and every orifice crammed with tennis balls is my favourite, brings me to tears every time I see it. If I was going to make any effort whatsoever to return to human civilization, I'd totally steal some of thier work and sell it for millions. I've been working on my own style using the cannibals body parts, my centrepeice being 'head on a stick' I just can't seem to capture the same passions though.Day 5:Walls seem to be a weakness to the cannibals, they are in awe of them as they repeatedly ram thier faces into it, and growl at it. Small minded barbarians hahah.It's not so funny when they walk through my wall... the sole source of my security.. but it's funny again when they walk into my campfire and burn to death. My emotional roller coaster of fun and fear may have something to do with my wandering through the forest earlier eating shrooms.on my return to camp I accidentally walked into a fire, and caught fire to myself. In the rain. Adeles song has so much more meaning to me now.

content:
Posted: May 30, 2014
Early Access Review
								For those of you who don't want to read a load of text, then here is my short snippet of me playing this game.


YouTube™ Video:  

			Views: 0		



For those who want what i think of the game then keep reading!I started off in the forest crashing in the plane, my son next to me. This ended up after the crash with one of the cannibals appearing infront of me with my child.He runs away and you are alone, other than a few rabbits.So i pick up my axe and get ready to chop some tree's, i chop away and the whole tree come tumbling down, showering the floor with logs. I then check out my survival guide and am told to build a shlelter, i select it and get ready place it, to which i get attacked from behind and dragged into a cave.I open my eyes to see nothing but dead people and heads on sticks, it's dark, i'm lost and creeped out!The forest is so far a wonderfully creepy game, i wouldn't say a horror game in the sense you will be scared (at least for me).However you will constantly be on your toes, wondering what each and every noise is. You will be building your house and see people suddenly around you climbing the trees.The atmosphere is superb.The graphics are very nice too, considering this is an indie game in alpha i am VERY impressed. The sounds are a little bat at times, when the plane crashes it doesn't feel like there was much going on. The child is just sitting there not making a noise and so was i. Although this is most likely and alpha thing and there will be more when the game is more complete.Overall i would say even now in an alpha state this game is very muhc worth it's price as it captures what it is trying to do so well. Not to mention it will only get better and better, to which i assure you all this game will be extremely good when complete.If you like to be scared, if you like to survive then pick this up!

content:
Posted: May 24, 2016
Early Access Review
								My friend and I load into game. We spend 10 minutes throwing tennis balls at eachother. It's getting late, let's get serious. We set down the foundation for a cabin and start collecting logs. We complete it the next morning after making a poorly made tent to sleep the night away. We're both starving. I suggest hunting Bambi. The land is rich with wildlife. The first deer I approach runs off at around 50 mph straight off a cliff, leading into the ocean... The second runs in circles, taunting me, it knows how exausted I am. It's confident in it's abilities, but I however am not. We spend the rest of the day hunting, but to no avail. I suggest a new approach. I have one bottle of liquor. I make a molotov. Things get intense. We approach a deer, we're in a bit of a rush, "this is murder" I said.  My friend replied saying it was what we had to do to survive. I feel my throat getting dry. I grip the molotov, I take a breath... I throw it at the deer. The bottle crashes against the deer, hitting it in the head. The deer stops, dazed, and runs away. My friend and I stare at eachother in silence. I forgot to light the molotov.Thus ends our first play of Forest.

Early Access Review
								This game is pure innovative genius! It sucks you in from the start with a realistic plane crash, a mysterious island, and some weird naked dude who likes to sneak up on me while I'm chopping down trees. I decided to kill him...not the best idea I've ever had, as later that night while  I was snuggled up by my campfire, his buddies decided to show up. Now I understand this game is in alpha, but holy hell it's fantastic. The bad guys are fast moving, calculative creeps who won't give up. You can interact fully with the environment around you, and pretty much build an epic survival compound. Sure, there are bugs, but not many that I've seen. The worst of it is there's a bloody table that seems to haunt my camp. It has a life of its own as it floats around and crashes into my house. No problem! everything else so far seems to be working fine. So Jump in, immerse yourself and see how long you can survive. I think I've made it to about day 10 right now, and my fortress in impenetrable. I hope...

content:
Posted: May 17, 2016
Early Access Review
								This is one of the few early access games that I have faith in.The Forest is more than just a game for me, after visiting Yellowstone National Park in upstate Wyoming, I could really compare the seemingly cold-ish forest environment to The Forest because the devs in my opinion have changed so much since v0.01 to make it FEEL like you're in the forest. They work with graphics and just amazing sound. The environment feels so natural that I don't want to even be interupted when playing this game, because it's THAT GOOD!Starting from the beginning plane crash, the 1 minute-or-so intro is better than my 48 hours on DayZ, and is more interesting. On top of that the devs nailed the in-flight ambience, me just recently flying on a two hour plane to Chicago it was something to truly compare. When the plane splits into thirds the sounds of seperation deeply add to the immersion, I'm already wrapped into the game before even playing this thriller. On the surface, the atmosphere and environment is very well-done. I especially like stepping out for heavy winds blowing through the forest. At night the sound of cannibals screaming in the distance can also put one to a shiver. Cave environments are even more scary. The devs did so by adding fantastic ambience sounds and lots, and lots, of props that I won't spoil here. Also, the reason that this is the only early-access game I have faith in, is because the devs, number one, let you know when the next update is, and they have a suggestion thread which they RESPOND to! This way, you can look forward to the next update and really see what the devs are doing, and how the work well. I actually think my grandkids would be able to play a sequel to a sequel, to a sequel, etc. Because the development rate and consistency is so good. The devs have a LOT OF POTENTIAL HERE! DON'T RUIN IT!You may not like this, but the amount of content in this game, the amount of fun I've had in my -so far- 21 hours, is worthy of at least a 30$ game if not 40$. By realease, if the devs don't screw up you could be looking at a 50$ game. This game could be like Alien: Isolation, I say this because they've gotten a base for sound, environment, and horror. They just need to do more.I rate this game, as of this state, an 11/10, especially for being a trusty early-access. WITH CO-OP! Another pro!Truly a fantastic experience and I expect myself to continue to play it for a long time.

content:
Posted: January 5
Early Access Review
								I'm impressed by the stunning visuals and depth of crafting, the sound blows me away and the overall feel of the game is superb. Even in early access this game performs better than most AAA games for more than half the price. Pair this with the fact the development team continues to update this product with new features, fix issues and keep the community up to date every step of the way it really just goes to show how we've barely seen this game scratch the surface of what it can deliver. About the gameThe game sees you as the main protagonist that was on a flight that crash-landed on a mysterious island occupied by cannibals. You have to scavenge supplies in order to survive, you then have to make basic shelter in order to start your journey of surviving in this hostile environment. Once you have constructed your initial camp you can then start gathering supplies to create more complex traps and equipment, this is a must if you want to find the rest of the plane passengers and most important of all, your son. The combination of eerie music, stunning visuals, great crafting system and the fact you have terrifying groups of cannibals hunting you down makes this game a real adrenaline ride.

Posted: February 24
Early Access Review
								The survival/crafting genre has been milked to hell and back the past couple of years, with the quality of such games being more inconsistant than Robbaz's uploading schedule. This game however... PHWOAR!The graphics are glorious, utilising lighting and particle effects to compensate for the slightly subpar textures, yet it runs like a dream. There's not much else to say, it's so damn gorgeous. The gameplay? Surprisingly polished! Everything works just about perfectly, nothing is too stiff or dysfunctional. I may have uh, ricoched into the air a couple of times, but none resulted in my slow and PAINFUL demise. I did fall through the floor at one point, and these clipping issues are something I'm sure the devs will iron out over time. It's difficult to remember the game's in alpha.Everything is fun to do, and it's difficult to become tired of the tens of buildables within the survival book. Playing with my friends in this game was the greatest experience I've had in a long time. Add this to the fact that the devs are adding and tweaking content regularly, The Forest is simply a glorious buy. 9/10, would accidently step on fire again. (Oh and stock up on cloth)

content:
Posted: June 1, 2014
Early Access Review
								The Forest is a survival horror game that actually does survival horror right, from the sound to how everything looks, Thats why I instantly fell in love with The Forest, the immersion. If you have ever played the Silent Hill series, you would know of how good a job it makes you feel like you're alone, but not ALONE. And that is what seperates The Forest from the rest of the "zombie" survival "horror" games, it gets rid of the generic zombie foe that you don't mind putting a couple rounds into and gives you a native cannibalistic tribe that may make you think before taking them out incase one of them gets away and alerts the rest of the tribe.This game is legitimately scary, from your first sighting of the tribe searching the plane wreck to the first time you get knocked out and dragged to their cave. It's purely atmospheric horror and It doesn't just rely on cheap scare tactics like jump-scares and loud noises like other survival horror games.Now on to the survival aspect of The Forest, I personally think this part was really well done, it actually makes you adapt and survive! From not being able to eat raw meat and actually having to put it onto the fire and wait for it to cook so you don't burn it, to simply how the tree cutting animations are and finding berries that are not poisonous to eat.At the moment it's pretty buggy. But what do you expect from a pre-alpha? I'm really looking forward to seeing what Endnight games can do with The Forest in the future. This game would easily be Game Of The Year for me, normally I wouldn't even fathom choosing a game like this for GOTY, but The Forest is just perfect to me, and can definitely see this being one of my all time favorites.

								A friend of mine bought this on Early Access. I, myself, was a bit skeptical of buying games that are still in development, but after watching my friend, I was sold on the game. This game is brimming with potential and it's only in pre-Alpha. I cannot even imagine what the finished product will look like.This game is sure to pull you in with the atmosphere it creates, the gameplay, graphics and sound effects it presents. With this game, you'll end up spending hours constructing your perfect fort, hunting animals and killing cannibals. And the fact, that it gets updated with new features, about every month, is sure to maintain your confidence in this project, if not bolster it. More than worth the money I paid.

content:
Posted: May 31, 2015
Early Access Review
								The Forest gives you some starter survival help in the form of ever-replenishing suitcases filled with snacks, but besides that, leaves you bloodied and alone to live or die, by your own will and cunning.Before you perfect the art of surviving this world, or even learn how to chop a tree down properly,  night and mutants arrive to test your defenses and your nerves. You get hungry and thirsty in painfully realistic intervals. "Oh I'm famished again, let me just pick this delicious looking mushroom..." Game Over, you made it 1 days!Once you get the hang of it though, the stark, real-yet-unreal presence  of The Forest itself begins to take over as the main character, for which you are at best a temporary witness. Perhaps it's a kind of pergatory, or another dimension, but whatever this land is, it is also unquestionably beautiful.Build a ringfort, or the ultimate tree-house, or some other way of staying warm and safe from the ever-curious and ever-hungry mutants (they really like the airplane snacks, and you happen to have eaten nothing but said airplane snacks for a week).No matter what you build, or where you go, or what you kill or call into being, the most compelling piece of this game is that you remain alone, in a fetchingly hostile place, which drives you toward answers that are as yet unknowable. Whatever the metaphoric weight of all this might mean, simply taken as a work of art, it doesn't get more lovingly rendered than this game, which makes one believe that this small team is capable of even greater things.9/10

content:
Posted: June 24, 2015
Early Access Review
								Well, I've officially played enough of this game that I feel like I can give a solid reveiw (and a TL;DR version). I played this game a lot on a friend's computer, and logged in over sixty hours before I bought it myself. So, with over 100 total hours of play between single and multiplayer, I have to say -  I love this game, and I cannot play it enough.TL;DR,Pros >Get to survive a plane crash>Fight hordes of savages with some of the best AI I've come across>Option to stay peaceful and coexist with said savages>Cannibalism>Sick crafting action>Mad raft drifts>Frequent updates with countdown to next update >Dope Spelunking>Horror is 11/10 levels of Nope>You can lumberjack down the whole The Forest like it's Pioneer Simulator 2015 Elite Edition>Looks better than Crysis 2>Mad survival simulation; you have to keep warm, dry, clean, hydrated and well fed. Good luck.>Close enough to reality that you'll never want to go to Vancouver Island (the island looks like its in BC, to clarify)Cons>Occasionally an update will be bumped back a day or two>Official wiki is poorly maintained>Game loses it's sheeit when you're hosting a large game>Can't viciously murder Canadian Geese>...This game is fraking amazing - I really love survival horror games, and this game was the first game to give a great balance for both. I have never been truly unsettled by a vidya as much as I have The Forest. No spoilers, but there is a great and unexpected amount of body horror and truly unsettling caves. the crafting and building in this game are great, and as of version 0.18b they have both been incredibly fluid. There are frequent updates that add great new content, and every new update has cemented my love of the game. Oh, and it's fraking gorgeous. Like, for real dood - it looks better than Skyrim and a big chunk of other AAA games.And the freedom dood - you can completely avoid conflict (a new breed of stealth) or hunt down every single other person on the island and murder (and cannibalize) them. Wanna live on a lake? Make a houseboat. Wanna live in the woods? Make a log cabin, or a treehouse. Explore the mountains and caves, looks for signs of other survivors... or just chill out and farm. The fact that there is such a small dev team that are so involved and hard at work is impressive, and as a Canadian I am astounded that they're based in British Columbia (it's great to see Canadian Content that isn't amateur as frak).I can't recommend this game enough - it's like an HD First person version of Don't Starve,but way more indepth and a lot more realistic.11/10, the greatest video game to come out of Canada (including GTA III and Mass Effect, yes).
