number of helpful: 8 of 9 people (89%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 20, 2016
Product received for free
Early Access Review
Note: I'd like to give a special thanks to the developers at Endnight Games for providing me with a key.I've been following The Forest for a while now, and it was the most wanted game on my wish list.  I first found TF through a Youtuber (Vintagebeef) who frequently plays it.  TF is very interesting in that it's not your typical survival/open world game.  Instead, you crash land on an island, and the entire game is simply trying to build yourself a home/base and survive.  The cannibals, which are your primary threat, are human-shaped creatures that will try to kill you.  I don't actually know if they are considered zombies or if they are still alive, but I assume they are dead.  When you're not fighting them, you're cutting down trees, gathering sticks and various other ingredients for crafting.Speaking of, the crafting is really helpful and well done.  In TF, you have an instruction booklet that shows you all the things you can make, your tasks that you need to do for survival, and various other little things.  When you select an item to make, you're given an outline to place down somewhere.  Once this is placed, you'll see a task list that shows how much of something you need for whatever you want to make.  This is a very nice feature, as we don't have to keep going back into the book to read.  You can also rotate the items before you place them, a detail that is greatly needed in most games.TF somewhat has a story.  When you start a new profile, it opens with you being on a plane with your son, and the plane crashes.  When you awake, one of the cannibals comes in and takes your son, leaving you alive.  After this the gameplay begins.  If you die, the cannibals drag you back to their cave, and that is where the story ends (for now).  I don't believe there is a fully developed story yet for TF, just those two scenes.  I could be wrong.  My complaint with the story is that it's inconsistent.  During the gameplay, these cannibals always charge and attack us even if we ignore them.  Yet, after this plane crash, one shows up and takes my child and leaves me alive?  That doesn't make sense to me.  One of the best things about TF is that it never ends unless you die.  As long as you manage to live, you can keep playing over and over again.  There are different things for you to do in game, but there's a severe lack of variety.  You can make a town if you want (RIP trees....seriously, log cabins take SO MUCH WOOD!), you can make a nice little base, and/or you can make a boat house.  You can do whatever you please!The developers were paying close attention to detail.  If you eat certain kind of berries, you get hurt.  If you kill a cannibal and get blood all over you, it has to be washed off or you get an infection.  If you drink booze, you get drunk.  Those are just some of the many thorough details that the developers added.  In a lot of games we see lately, there may be little detail, or none at all.  To see Endnight Games putting this much work and detail into TF warms my heart.On the topic of detail, the graphics are stunning!  There are times I've just stood there staring out at the sky, or staring at the trees.  When the wind blows, the leaves blow, and when you watch them, you can see every detail of the tree blowing with the wind.  This is amazing!  You really get that realism experience, especially at night when it's pitch black and you can't see.  Talk about scary!  My very first night I huddled by my fire and kept doing 360s to watch all my angles.  I admit, that first night I was scared.  Every little sound made me turn and look to see if it was a cannibal.  I've never had this experience in a game before.TF has been in alpha for a long time now. I'm very glad that they are taking their time and giving us updates, but it feels like it may be in alpha forever.  It's not really hurting TF to be in alpha given the gameplay and everything is there, but it is concerning how long it has been in alpha.  My worry is that they may drag out the alpha for as long as humanely possible.   As fun as TF is, it will get to a point where it's getting stale, and there needs to be fresh content, maybe a map expansion.  You can only do the same exact thing so many things before you just say "I'm done."If you're ever too frightened by the cannibals, get a buddy and hop in multiplayer!  Yep, TF has multiplayer, which makes it so much more fun.  From what I played, the multiplayer is pretty stable, and there was hardly any lag.  If that doesn't help your fear, go back into single player and turn off the creatures!Overall, The Forest is an extremely fun game that has potential to be one of the best of its genre.As a final note, I didn't want to list this as a positive or a negative, but as mentioned, the opening story doesn't make much sense right now.  Given this is still in alpha, I won't hold this against the developers, as I'm sure eventually it will be explained.Positives: Beautiful graphics Attention to detail Endless playability Great job of instilling fear and panic of the cannibals, especially at night Active, friendly developers Ability to turn off cannibals and make it purely about surviving the wilderness Decent options to craft/build Active wildlife, some of whom may attack you More adult oriented due to nudity and gore Open worldNegatives: Alpha that has lasted longer than most early access titles After so many hours, TF can get boring due to the lack of contentFor more recommendations and reviews on our favourite up and coming quality games follow Lot's O Giveaway's, and check out our Curations.

content:
Posted: June 2, 2014
Early Access Review
								Alpha v0.01 review.Good:-Great graphics.-Interesting plot.-Unique crafting.-Potential for engaging survival environment and gameplayNeutral:-The A.I has potential, but behaves inconsistently. I’ve had cannibals walk right up to me and just hang out, maybe they are    just misunderstood? Bad:-Game performance degrades over time. -Missing collision on some objects (various trees)-Unlimited ammo glitch-Pick up a single tennis ball, throw 3?-Dead cannibal bodies explode into perfectly sliced pieces when attacked and sometimes launch you into space-Monsters despawn, and vanish entirely-Fire pits 'eat' fish-Fire pits stop working entirely-Other A.I Issues, Walking underwater, clippingPersonal Issues:-Objects that you can interact with in a survival game shouldn't glow bright white from 100m away (logs, etc.)-Beautiful map environment, but small compared to other survival games on the marketPersonal verdict:-If you have extra cash and want to support the developers, buy it-If you want a game to play and enjoy, you need to wait, don't buy this yet, it will likely spoil the game for future enjoyment.I’m aware it’s pre-alpha, I paid $15.00 for it, and I’m still rating it as followsGreat start, lots of potential, however, “The Forest” has plenty to finish before the general public will accept it. 2/10.

								EARLY ACCESS REVIEW: Read All below for fun time. :)To start with, I thought this would be one of those ♥♥♥♥♥♥ survival games which forever stuck in early access *cough cough Dayz" yeah, I shouldn't compare that♥♥♥♥♥♥to this one hell of a game.Key points:Graphics "such wow" can run it on high easily (not on MP)The overall idea of it is pretty simple, and makes sense.The User Interface for Health, Stamina and Hunger are simple and easy to use and understand.Crafting in your inventory, wow just wow, amazing, "the possibilities are endless".Aswell as the simple and easy to use Survival Guide, with instructions on survivng and building with 3D Blueprints.Storage of all the things you need in life is possible, dried meat, stored food, drinks, meds, logs, sticks and stones and weapons.Key items and crafting items spawn in the same spot every time, the OP Katana and then grinding the respawning animals for food and the suitcases oh god the suitcases. Oh wait the collectables my favourite, more on that later.Singleplayer:With the sole survivor of the plane crash "that you know of" you black out after you see one of the "natives, pick up and take away your son, your mission if you chose to accept it, is to Survive and Thrive? Explore get more equipment and crafting materials.While its dark it is spooky in some sense due to the dark "no♥♥♥♥♥♥quot; and the whooping and screaming of the natives, there is a silly cheaty way though, you can sleep through the night and reload saves since there are no autosaves. While the "Natives"-Cannibal Mutant ♥♥♥♥ers-are around in the daylight it is not as troubling since you can see them and most likely in the day time you most likely got the equipment to hold off.Multiplayer:Well while still in Alpha this game copes, only problem is the occasional "every 30 mins" save and re log on a server hosted with 8/8 of us running around, etc etc V-SYNC FML.Anyway it is much more fun with friends since you can screw around and still get stuff done, since there is two of you(or more) its great. I've done like 5 hours straight (apart from V-Syncing).Some iffy points its always the same tactic, build an alpine treehouse near the Spawn point (plane crash) then a defensive wall, some stick'n'stone spiky protector and then traps, GG you win you are safe., have fun exploring. Caves though or even the just out in the dark together is great together, Gotta Go Deeper to find the Joke nevermind, goign cave diving miles underground with a party of you never alone, pls no. While spooky you have banter and explore and find new things, if theres 5 of you easy tactic two with katanas out, two with torches to light the way and the other well bomb carry for the well you got to see them to believe it.Its just great, I don't really know what to say.PLOT/Spoilers maybe?: Ta da with only having 20 hours under my belt so far, pun intended (John Cena is ma name while typing this).You Crash on this Island but "Forest" first off no idea why the plane would explode, then you pass out, wake up theres a red dude maybe covered in blood who picks up your son walks off, then you pass out.These are "Natives" I would say uncontacted, but then you explore, you find Film Crew and Camping tents, were you the only survivor or not? With the only evidence of carcasses, effigys or did they become the "natives" Collectables of images and cassette players, some images dating "82" so is this set on real life, I doubt.Okay okay, the "natives" lets call them "mutant cannibals" cave dwellers, naked people who run around and have no genitals. There are different types I'd say normal, but no, its not normal, you got super fast ones who run on all fours, brutes, giant ♥♥♥♥er multiarmed weird♥♥♥♥♥things, crawling mutant babies and a spider ♥♥♥♥♥, I don't even know if thats all of them.Anywho why they only attack with there arms adn the occasional "club"(ain't seen any use one) they neglect ranged attacks, rocks or bow, please what sort of Civilisation is this?Also Giant "♥♥♥♥♥Hole" in middle of map, just go look at it seriously, its not human made I hope, so its something to do with the background/story/plot.I don't know why I even typed this review I wasted like half an hour I could of used to play this game, it keeps me up at night, due to the fact I think I'm addicted and that it sometimes horrifies  me.Alright thats enough, I'm off Please Rate review etc. :)

content:
Posted: October 23, 2016
Early Access Review
								The ForestUPDATE 21.1.2017This game has get pretty big updates since I last played this. Now that the main story is almost complete and more and more features have been added, all I can say is that this game is really, really good. So much to do etc. now. I can still recommend this to every one who likes to build things and explore.As the (lone) survivor of a passenger jet crash, you find yourself in a mysterious forest battling to stay alive against a society of cannibalistic mutants. Build, explore, survive in this terrifying first person survival horror simulator.You are in airplane with random passengers and your son. Plane crashes and creepy cannibal covered in red paint steals your son. Then you start to collect all kinds of things to help you survive. You find some drawings that your son drew. Then you will have to find some tools etc. You can go explore cavesetc. At some point you can go to big cave where your son may be, but this will come in future updates.Game itself:The game has all kind of things to offer. It's pretty easy to learn too. It took like 20 minutes for me to learn all the basic things, but you will learn more and more new things when they add new things to this game in the future.  You have a survival book that has all the basic crafting recepies. Other crafting recepies like bow are easy to learn. You can find all kind of tools and "guns" too. You have to gather resouces like chop trees down and collect rocks etc. and then build your own village or almost anything you want. Hunting down animals with weapons is also a thing here. You can find weapons in caves and by crafting them by yourself. You have to eat and drink to stay alive. And like in real life you cant eat rotten meat or poisoned water, so you have to be carefull with those too. There is animals like deers, sharks, tortoises and rabbits. You can also craft armor with things you can get by killing animals and cannibals. There are different kind of cannibals like "super mutants" and "baby mutants" as I like to call them and they really are scary. Normal cannibals are also pretty scary but not as scary as other mutants. Mutants are also pretty hard to kill. You can get different drops from them when they are killed.Like in real life you have to eat, rest and drink. This game has a bar for health and energy. This also has "bar" for hunger and thirstily, so you have to eat and drink to get energy for survival. This also has bar for armor that can be crafted.Playing the game yourself in single player is really scary at first when you have nothing but your basic axe that can be found in the start of the game. You have to start looking for stuff as fast as possible after the crash so you will have enough time to make a shelter for first night of survival. The game will make the cannibals harder night after night for you when you proceed in the game, at least thats how I have seen my single player so far. When playing in single player you will have things to do for a long time. Exploring the caves alone is really scary thing and bit hard at first, but you will spend a lot of time in them trying to find all the special weapons and tools.Playing with friends is really fun. Doing the things this game has to offer with friends is much more fun and more effective. You can make bases and so on so much faster with friends. It's also less scrary when playing with many people. The gameplay works great when playing single player, no lag for me at all. Sometimes when playing multiplayer and if the host has bad internet you can see some lag and missing stuff. I have not seen other problems while playing this. Ofc when this is early access game you will see some little bugs and so on but it's not that bad to be honest.Well to summarise my review this is simple and easy game to play. You can spend hours playing this and you will allways have something to do, at least thats how I see this game. It's not bad at all to spend 15 euros for this. If you like playing sandbox games that include surviving and building things, this is a game for you. My grade for this game is 9/10

Posted: December 3, 2015
Early Access Review
								I'm an extremely large fan of survival games and by far this game has taken the cake for one of the best I've ever played. The game is visually stunning and is one of a couple games that has good looking water. You start playing and take in all the beautiful scenery and then start your fight for survival agains canibalistic mutants. I laughed when the first thing I saw was a settlement with canibals who didn't look to happy to see me.For those who want some other ways to play the game, here are some code you can enter in the main menu of the game:(1) vegetarianmode (Canibals only come out at night)(2) theironforest (Makes all buildings indestructable)(3) veganmode (Disables canibal spawning entirely)This game has a great gameplay experience for all players new or experienced. Also, for a safer way to play, build a treehouse. It's much safer then building on the ground.Overall a bloody awesome game.10/10 would make a very big effigy of body parts again.

Early Access Review
								I bought this game a long time ago, it was suggested to me by a friend.I played a couple of hours and kind of put it away in a coset, thinking it was never going to be very good.Last week I downloaded it again this week and I am agonized due to the Halt in the story they suddenly threw in here.the story makes it so much moe than just a sandbox horror survival because that got old very quickly. adding a story has given you a reason to move instead of just setting up somewhere and making yourself invincible in a little fort that they cant touch.The progress is slow and it's,,, difficult to know what to do without some sort of guide but its worth it and i can't wait for the next update!solid 8.5/10the map is goreous, the threat is real, the gameplay is simple and clear the story is concerning to say the least.it only loses points for me because its a little hardware heavy for my computer and the inventory is a bit of a mess, its a little hard to see things around the edges. the inventory could do with an overhaul tbh but other than that, it's an awesome game!

content:
Posted: June 3, 2014
Early Access Review
								To start of I'd like to say It's got a recommendation because of the potential this game has.With that I would Like to add that if you are short on cash and looking for a game to play, I would pick up another game. Why? Simply because The Forest is In it's Alpha state, and with thathas a ton of bugs and flaws. It's barely playable in this state. so I would suggest you to buy it in a later state.As for the game itself, not including the bugs,The Forest is a game with lots of potential, and I'm sure the developers will build towards the expectations.The Graphics are great, especially for an indie game. The enemies excist of cannibals, Mutants and wildlife.Crafting in The Forest has been kept simple, and for that I hope there will be improvements, more crafting options and more crafting materials, wich on that part I'm sure will come.What I love about the game is that there are patrols roaming around the island, giving you the feeling your never safe, and always watched. this mechanic is really well done. The cannibals also climb in trees, so you have to be constantly on your toes if you want to survive in this horror survival.The story:The Game starts you off in a plane with your son. unfortunately the plane crashes and you and your son are one of the few survivors of the crash. when you come to your sences you see a man walking up to your son, taking him with him. leaving you falling back to black out again. when you wake up later, wounded and dehydrated in the plane wreck, you start off with some handy supplies such as your backpack, Lighter and a axe found in a stewardesses body. you find out that you have little time to look around the plane wreck and you'll have to start gathering resources and build a shelter to save and rest in, and a fire to stay warm at and cook food.Tips and Tricks:Always be careful picking a location for your shelter since the cannibals patrol the island. If you 'Die' in the game the first time you will be taken to one of the cannibals caves, with them probably assuming you were dead. but beware, if you Die a second time you will really be dead, and you WILL have to start all over again.You are a really buff man, and you can carry 2 logs at a time!There are suitcases lying around the plane wreck and some boat wrecks. they can be opened by hitting them with your axe.Press 'I' to open your inventory, and press 'B' to open up your survival guide.Do NOT let the cannibals flank you. if you encounter a group of cannibals, I would advise you to run and hide. if fighting is inevitable, keep an eye out for all the enemies. they WILL charge at you from behind. If they find your camp and they are attacking you, try to mak them run in the campfire, this way they will be weak enough to take out.BEWARE: some cannibal corpses are known to explode when you hit them.This was my review of The Forest. I would rate it a solid 8/10 when the bugs are fixed, and if they add more features to the game I will reconsider this.

Kill few lizards.Find a camp, which I thought was abandoned.Build a fire. 2 dudes come to (now) my camp and stare at me for a while. Then they attack. Kill them both, put the head of the other one on a stick. Find out the second dude didn't actually die. He's barely alive though.Teabag him for a while. Proceed to finish him off by hitting him in the genitals.*WHAM*The dude stands up.K.Kill him with a strike to the neck.Night comes.A new dude shows up. He runs past me to the cannibal-shack I'm taking shelter from the rain from. Hits it few times with his club.K.He's now my pal.Fire's going out, put some more there.THE♥♥♥♥WASTHAT!?Some naked Gollum is looking at me from the shadows.It seems to stay away from the fire.Seek protection from my half-naked pal who has a vendetta against the camp-shaft.He's just standing there scared. Seeks shelter in me.We both back to the end of the shack.There's more Gollums now.About 10.One of them charges at me, and then the rest come.I try to fend them off.No avail.I pass out.I open my eyes to see two halfnaked dudes carry me.HOORAH! MY PAL HAS SAVED ME FROM THOSE NAKED GOLLUMS!They throw me in some cave to give me better shelter.Find rocks and money there.I'm done.Climb up.No one in the camp.Go out of the camp, axe some wood.Carry 2 logs.Find a small "island" in a river.My plane's cockpit is there.I'M GONNA BUILD MY SHELTER THERE!THESE ENEMIES CAN'T SEEM TO BE ABLE TO SWIM!Start building shelter.2 gollums show up.HAHAA! 								One of the things I truly love about this game is the atmosphere, you will see the cannibals walking around and hunting and minding their own business constantly, and it always puts me on edge. crafting takes some creativity and survival is realistic to a point I have never seen in any game (and that is coming from someone who goes camping with nothing but a knife and tent). If I can give a couple pieces of advice, craft the bow as quickly as possible, makes hunting and fighting way easier (you will still die). have no less than 3 fires and 3 effigies surrounding your camp at all times. if you encounter cannibals and you are not yet rambo, run away and hide in your cabin. if you do all of this you may survive for 3 days.ps. I've seen aerosol cans in some of the luggage, hoping future updates allow me to pick these up and turn them into grenades, or flamethrowers.

content:
Posted: January 23, 2015
Early Access Review
								The Forest is definetly one of my favourite games despite it only being 0.12 Alpha as I'm currently writing this review. The gameplay feels fluid and not clunky to me. The video settings I feel are ample for the game and I can only imagine the options getting more in depth. I feel like there is a huge amount of potential within this game and I can see it being a big contender when finally finished and polished up.Moving more into the game itself, you will see a lot of bugs because it'a an alpha although there are a few which will require you to reload the save but fortunately I haven't had that happen enough to me that I have complained. The A.I in the game suprise me each time I load back into singleplayer or even multiplayer, although the atmosphere completely changes on multiplayer as the isolation factor of being stuck in a forest/island alone with no idea of what could be hiding in the tree trunks above you or following you at a respectable distance. After the initial "settling in" you might find yourself running out of things after establishing a defendable base and eco-system within it. Saying that there is a nice cave system with a definetly fear element (Atleast to me, personally) once you go deep down into them, regardless if on multiplayer or singleplayer, you will find yourself letting out a noise or two or possibly some bodily fluids. After doing the exploration of The Forest/Island you sort of run out of things to do really.Wrapping up my review, The graphics on the game are stunning even on the lowest settings, The gameplay feels fluid and fun although turning bland near the end of the initial setup, could do with more things to do which I'm anticipating.

content:
Posted: September 18, 2015
Early Access Review
								Since its release to alpha it was made aparent this game and the people behind it are somthing rare and special. The forest is a sp/coop survival game placed in a remote enviornment. A survivor of a plane crash you must come to your senses, no guns no gimiks just you a crafted axe and a forest filled with canabals er mutants as they like to be called. A lil more realistic than rust this is no 7 days to die game. The lighting and gfx are moving in an exciting direction. As is the dev of the game.   Endnight games has blown the bar right off the hangers here. Consistant updates (literally, i mean these guys put the counter on thier game menu) and meet the timeline without fail or immeadiate communication. The steam community is being managed in a manor that should become codex for ea games. The game itsself is a awesome example of care and skill. A great base with wip that not only is fun to use but allows for player input. The work being done here is beyond my highest expectations of this nature and after a long time of consistant performance this games quality and ability cannot be contested by even the big names out there..... in fact all big names out there are hard pressed to keep up with the level of skill being displayed here.Anyways. as I usally do i warn : if you dont know how to deal with beta games please wait. If your a gamer like me i recomend this one and actually ask you to come help us with this one. It has great potensional and the devs really desurve the help and effort.

								Pretty graphics. The sounds are very intense too and, at times, very realistic.  To the point where my cats are looking around the room for things that are not actually there. content:
Posted: February 10, 2015
Early Access Review
								GREAT AWSOME GAME. STILL A LITTLE BUGGY BUT the saving works fine, you can build whatever you want,whenever you want, wherever you want. Maybe I would like it to have more things to craft. You can only craft a few things like an axe, molotov, bomb, headbomb, stealth armor, bow and arrow, paintings(only three of them). The main point of the game is to find your son. I do believe that's where they're heading. I found a little boys toy that seems like a key object which I can use for crafting. PROs:-great great graphics. Lightning effects are EXTREME.-Open World.-Survival horror-multiplayer!-Up to 8 players.-You can build as many houses as you want.-Savings are not lost upon 2 death.-EFFIGIEES!!! ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ AWSOME. GO AWAY SATAN! GO AWAY!CONs: -Since an update... everytime you find the  plane survivors deadbodies it doesn't counts them anymore. It seems they took that out.That was very helpful because since you don't know what the hell you are supposed to do, that feature somehow hint me that I must find all the bodies to find my son/kid that was beside me on the airplane. The one THEY took.-Traps don't work. THEY step into them and it doesn't kills them or do something to them.-BOW and ARROW. you cannot aim. What I mean is that there isn't any sight for the cross or any aimpoint or something to help you aim.-Since they make it harder "the bird on the hand" thing its kinda difficult to get some feathers for the arrows. Suggestions:-Body counter-Objectives besides surviving... Don't know, once you find some camp, spy them and follow them.-Aimsight for the arrow.-Fast Travel between safe houses.(Only the cabin, so it won't be THAT easy to travel to "important" places within the game so fast.)-More animal traps.-More animal variety in general-Complete the crafting guide already.-Gun/Flaregun crafting. If you are able to craft a bomb why not a gun? a wood gun maybe? :D-When killing the rabbit, make some trasition effects not the rabbit meat on the floor without doing anything.-stealth armor or  mud are not effective at all for hiding. Only hiding behind trees or bushes.-Include LADDERS so you can build tall houses or another tall building.-Which leads to more building crafting. Not only shelters.-Some kind of Delta Wing, mini plane, car to move within the woods.-Tree hiding/ Climbing-Tree houses-Stone Cabins-Shovel and sand to make glassBesides the suggestions and stuff(Its all because I survived over a 100 days or so in the game and Im bored waiting for something new to build/craft/kill XD) I totally recommend this one NOW. Since it has tons of fun and you won't be scared until you hear/see your first one. THEY are fast. You'll see

number of helpful: 8 of 10 people (80%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 16, 2014
Early Access Review
								First off, I have to admit something very important: this game scares the absolute♥♥♥♥♥♥out of me. This has been the first game in a long time that actually made me scare quit in sheer panic, and I will provide some scenarios later.If you like survival + needs management, crafting/building, horror, exploration, and death, then give this game a try - I think you will really enjoy it; or even really enjoy hating it for scaring/killing you so much, but also making you come back for more.As an early access game, this has easily been one of the most impressive alphas I have ever played. The aesthetics are fantastic, and, if you can run it, you will be in for a very nice treat the first time you gaze out on the ocean from within a forest of dense trees and foliage. The music and sounds are very subtle, and a very faint scary-movie-like-noise will warn you when enemies are nearby (crazy story later on).The controls are easy to familiarize yourself with - there are many button prompts as seen in the Dead Island games (ex: key bind "e" hovering over lootable items). At times, however, the controls may not be as responsive, and you may often find yourself repeatedly trying to pick up items on the ground (the key is to make sure you can see the button prompt; try walking around it and panning the mouse around until you get it). The learning curve is moderate to difficult if you aren't used to open-world survival games - you really have to balance securing your shelter/food and watching out for the enemy. You WILL die many times during your initial playthroughs - do not be alarmed, just take a deep breath and learn from each experience.As the sole survivor of a brutal airplane crash on an island inhabited by cannibals, your first task will be to immediately loot the inside of the airplane and the immediate surroundings (you can use your axe to break open luggages). Be quick, as the crash site is randomized and so are enemy patrols - you could have several minutes to just one or two. A good thing to do is to loot the inside, run to the nearest collection of bushes, and hide. Wait until you see the cannibals (they will most likely come to investigate). When they leave, loot the outside, then find a place to establish your base.You have to manage your needs, primarily hunger and energy. To do this, you can eat some of the candy bars you looted from the airplane wreck to satisfy your hunger. You can drink some cans of sodapop to regain energy, or go to sleep. Note that sleeping in any form of shelter is currently the only way to save.The inventory management is really cool - you can see all your items laid out on a blanket when you go to your inventory. From here, information on each item is given, and you have the option of crafting items. One such item (very useful against enemy mobs, especially in the beginning when you are weak) is a molotov cocktail, made by combining one bottle of alcohol with one piece of cloth. Another thing I really like about this game is the fluidity of gameplay - when you are looking at your inventory or have pressed ESC, the game is actually still progressing - so you could close your inventory only to see group of cannibals ruunning toward you.Combat can get very difficult, but the latest patch allowing you to block with the fire axe (starting weapon) has made this element less of a suicide. I have been one-hit killed a number of times, thrown forcefully into a tree, and I am unsure whether this is part of the game or a glitch. The AI is amazing! The personalities and tendencies of each cannibal can vary - some will cry over the death of their allies, others will bow before you, and many will pull and drag a downed ally away from you. Females seem to be the most aggressive, however, almost all cannibals will become extra aggressive during the night. Enemies will do different things when they encounter you - some will just watch you curiously, others will wait for reinforcements, and others might even run away.The developers are very active, with times given right in the menu of how long before the next build is released. There is a peaceful game mode, with no cannibals to worry about - this can be useful for helping you get your bearings on the game mechanics.Story time!So there I was, using my axe to open the luggages littered a good distance from the airplane crash. I had scouted and waited for enemy patrols, but saw no one. Since I was trying to open the luggages as quickly as possible, I had been looking down the entire time. I heard the faintest noise, but thought nothing of it. A few minutes later, I hear it again, so I look up (see nothing) and turn around. No sudden music, just a group of 3 cannibals staring at me curiously. I shouted "OH♥♥♥♥♥♥" in the psychology lab of my school. I rarely shout during horror games.Rage quit story!It was the dead of night.I had been a short distance from my camp chopping down some wood to build my cabin, when I noticed a group of 4 cannibals (one holding a torch) walking toward my camp. I immediately backpedal further into the forest to hide, almost running to a separate duo, one of which had a flashlight fixed to a pole attached to his back (like a lantern banner). I panic and backpedal some more before they spot me, but the lantern-man's ally sees me and rushes to engage.We trade attacks and I am seeing red. I risk a glance to my left and spot the lantern-man rushing toward me. The fighting had caught the attention of the foursome at my camp, and I see them begin walking toward me. It is at this point where my assailant decided to climb up the closest tree.I nope'd right out of there. If you are a survival, horror, open-world, and/or crafting junkie, then get this game and give it a try.Recommend, and be prepared to die and get scared!

number of helpful: 8 of 10 people (80%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 29, 2014
Early Access Review
								Day 1: I realise my plane has crashed, my son is gone, but ♥♥♥♥ him. It's time for an adventure. Later: I start building shelter, for the cannibals, so they can't find me.Day 2: Had a good night, only one cannibal patrol, so I'm good. Made a better axe, using a stick and a rock. It's faster slightly. Later: Killed a couple of attacking Cannibals in self defence. Day 3/4/5/6: I made a better base on the beach, with a head thingy to scare away some cannibals. It's kind of working. I hopeLater: Saw multiple patrols. One ran towards me and I wiped them out. BIGGER SCARING AWAY THINGY.Day 7/8: I'm heading for a cannibal camp. I remember seeing it in the woods. I'm making a small shelter for the night. Later: No one in sight. Day 9: I attacked a camp, killing almost everyone, took some stuff, then got attacked and knocked out by a female cannibal on a tree. I find my self in a cave. WAIT. DON'T KILL ME!! ---Extract Ends Here--- For the real review, that was my gameplay experiance, it was FUN, trust me. The game is suspenseful and requires you to use the most of your equipment and strategies to survive the says and nights, from dying of either natural or being eaten by a crazed foreign cannibal. The graphics are beautiful, especially for an indie game. I haven't got much more to say really. Pros + Beautiful Graphics + Suspenseful Gameplay+ Fun combat + Easy to use Backpack+ Doesn't leave anything unused. Cons - Can be buggy, but I won't let this affect the score since it's EA - A bit of a clunky AI. - Could be more easier to use Crafting system, and it should be able to show you recipes. Overall: This game mixes Survival and Action into a hasteful battle between life and death. As you scour from the beaches to the forest, you are never safe. Be careful, out there, since I think this game is a MUST-BUY 9/10

number of helpful: 8 of 10 people (80%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 18, 2015
Early Access Review
								Only 5 hours in and I think I can give a pretty good review for this.First of... Immersion.I think the gaming experience in this is amazing!The Hunger! The Thirst! How eating doesn't heal you (That much)!I find this to be an amazing experience so far.At first I thought "man, I'm weak as heck, I died in like one hit". And then I forgot to save after quitting later.Then I came back and I was like, "Oh, I can block", which totally made fighting easier.And also, upgradable tools. Now even though it kind of sounds ridiculous, I like it. Feathers make your axe faster, and teeth make it more damaging. Also, those items can be applied to your weapons using tree sap! Pretty good.Secondly... Horror.Now I'm not sure if anyone would consider this horror, but I really like the whole "Dark and Alone" atmosphere. Real spooky guys. Its totally dark.. No flashlight? Well then you're screwed :DIts near pitch black at night and you can't really see much. And that's really cool, personally, I like the dark atmoshere in games. Totally dark and then out of nowhere.. HEY LOOK A PERSON.Its pretty logical that cannibals like that would come out at night for hunting. The only hard part is staying alive without a fire to drive them off. You better light it before you sleep!Also you get the occasional day scouts..And Finally... Survival.Now I'm not going to go into detail because it would be nice for people to try for themselves.But the components of the survival consist of Thirst, Hunger, Cleanliness, and Health.Which each seem equally balanced at the time. Totally legitimate.Anyways, the devs did a great job, and I love this great game.If anyone is in for some good survival, get this, you won't regret it.But hey, don't take it from me, try it for yourself!

content:
Posted: June 5, 2014
Early Access Review
								7/10This review takes into account that the game is still in alpha, and subsequently it is pretty buggy including some bugs which may deter people to begin with, for example after saving the game and then leaving the game, and then re-launching i am no longer able to load the game (a copy of the save is non existent), and a few rendering bugs but nothing to get worried about, the only real problem ive had with the game itself so far was the game being more of a choir than an actual enjoyable experience, the enemies are unrealistically hard to kill, you can die from falling a meter or two and the animations are a tad buggy. But this can be forgiven, the graphics are pretty sweet, and the game runs fairly smoothly, considering the forest is only in alpha, the prospects of the game are very promising, i have no doubt that these improvements/tweaks will be made in the forseeable future and the game will develop into an enjoyable and fun experience.

Early Access Review
								I can't recommend this game enough. If you're a fan of survival games such as Unturned and Minecraft, the chances are you'll really enjoy this game. I've so far only managed to set up a small campfire, a rabbit trap and a place to sleep and save my game. Wandering off generally leads to me being assaulted by mutants and dragged off to a cave. The Forest also features frequent updates which have a countdown in the main menu of the game, which seems to be a minimum of an update every 2 weeks. There's also talk of adding co-op to the game which I'm extremely excited for.While I think the game is great, I really can't recommend buying it unless you've got a great gaming PC as it's not very optimized at this stage in development.

content:
Posted: February 2, 2015
Early Access Review
 This review is for The Forest v0.12. Game Grade:  AShorthand Review:  Survival is not easily achieved.  The Forest will put your survival skills to the test in a frist person experience you will never forget.Detailed Review:I personally recommend this game to anyone who is looking for a realistic survival based game.  The developers of The Forest really show true dedication to the game by their consistent efforts in updating and taking suggestions.  The Forest has different modes you can play which increase the replay value significantly.  With high graphic quality, you are really put into the action at every moment of the game.  For an in Alpha build game, the game play is shockingly smooth and highly entertaining.To start off, I think anyone who has played around with a few early access games has been greatly disappointed with developers who just don't keep up with the game.  With The Forest, there is a very active community with truly dedicated developers.  Updates are released quite frequently ranging from once a week to once every three weeks.  In the updates, you can expect fixes to bugs and new content.  This new content always adds a whole new level of entertainment to the game.  If you feel that you are getting bored with The Forest, then just wait a week or two and you will have a blast with the newly added materials.  The developers truly lure you back into the game each update which allows you to get the most out of your money.Anyone who has played survival games knows that the game is only as good as its replay value.  With The Forest, the replay value is very high.  One reason goes back to what I had said earlier.  The developers are always adding more content.  Not only that but you can play in two different game modes.  The first game mode involves fighting the classic and merciless cannibals which are always trying to take a bite out of you.  Messed up right?  Not as messed as their effigies but I'll keep to my word and keep specific aspects of the game a mystery (unless you have watched it on youtube).  Another way you can play is without the cannibals.  This adds more realism to the game but be aware that playing this mode may get boring after a while.  This mode can be enabled by typing veganmode in the main menu screen (there is no text box to type it in).  I would like to add that The Forest has made a multiplayer aspect to the game which can handle 8 people (recommended max).  With this said, I hope replay value won't be on your mind when you buy the game.The last point I'm going to make about the game are the graphics.  The graphics in The Forest are outstanding.  This truly throws you into full survival mode with this addition to realism.  Don't worry however, the graphics can be lowered sufficiently to meet the needs of slower and older computers.  Laptops are even given a recommended mode so your graphics shouldn't be an issue.   Visual effects may be glitched at times, and as said before, bugs are to be expected.  The bugs will not take away from the game play and are normally fixed in the next update.Overall, I highly recommend The Forest to anyone who enjoys survival based games.  Check out my profile for screenshots of the game.  I hope that you found this review helpful.  If you didn't, I am truly sorry that you spent your time read this.  However, I'm sure this will give you some idea of what you will see in the game.  Feedback is always wanted so if you want to know anything else or think anything should be added, just post a comment.  Again, I hope this has helped you with your decision on buying the game.

content:
Posted: June 2, 2014
Early Access Review
								The Forest is one of those rare gems, a survival game that actually makes you fight to survive. From the moment you leave the plane crash you are being hunted, yet you do not know it yet. As you leave the plane you have a sense of calm, that you are a lone surviver of a massive crash that should have killed you. Congrats, yet now you have crazed mutant cannibals after you and they do not hold back. What is that you just heard in the trees? Probably a bunch of mutants that want to eat your skin for lunch. There are quite a few things to do so far even though the game is in 0.01 Alpha. You can craft shelter, make fire pits, craft traps to protect yourself, and even make an effigy to ward off they mutants after killing them and harvesting their limbs. Only fair right? Also the game is graphically stunning, with tons of animal life to feast on and tons of trees to chop down. Also the caves are stunning and beautiful yet terrifying to go through with just your lighter.Yet at the same time since it is in Alpha there are quite a few bugs. As of this review you cannot save, so make sure you have a full play through and not invest too much time getting a large camp ready. Also there is a dupe bug that will sometimes cause you to spawn a ton of items around you that you have in your hand. Also sometimes the mutants will not stop coming, and have had up to 50 of them attacking me, which was nuts and fun at the same time. My MOTO score:Graphics: 9/10Gameplay 7/10Story: 8/10 (Story is what you make it to be, so please do not fight me on this score. You are a survivor of a plane crash, the rest is up to you.)

content:
Posted: June 2, 2014
Early Access Review
								Loving this game so far, can't wait to see more from this developer. Here's my lets play and full impressions of the game. 


YouTube™ Video: The Forest - Lets Play / Impressions! 

			Views: 222		

			In this Let's Play we pick up a game that was green lit on steam a long time ago and has finally been released in alpha!		

The Forest offers a visually immersive survival experience, with the addition of co-op it would become a staple for survival horrors. The AI are incredibly intelligent and frightening at the same time. There is great attention to detail within the game instead of just a large landscape without any character. Majestic mountains and secret oasis's can be found around the island. There are so many things to find in this game that it makes it worth getting simply for the exploration. This is the first game that I have found in open alpha that hasn't disappointed me, with the exception of contagion. The game is obviously not finished, but it is poised to become an absolutely great game if the little bugs can be fixed. The game is ENTIRELY playable at this point however, I highly recommend purchasing it before the price goes up.

content:
Posted: April 17, 2015
Early Access Review
								So with the recent update... I've had a bit of fun.Explored around the map looking at the new stuff. Found a gigantic hole in the ground, built a house near it.Sadly, you couldn't jump or see into the whole without having to run and jump off a cliff to get the slightest look at it.Personally, this hole has potential. You could spark up a controversy or it could have some crazy theories behind it. Add some stuff to this massive crater. So far this is my theory...Theory time with /10.So far I've noticed on the plane (when I started a new game on release of the new update) the son had a new drawing. You may ask, what drawing /10? It was a drawing of aliens. As I started exploring I come across this gigantic, hole/crater/volcano, who knows? I looked around and what not but the hole was odly shaped, in a perfect circle. I later on died in my own fire as I got dragged into one of the new caves. I found a drawing that I could pick up. I equipped it and lit my lighter as I looked at the drawing. Looked like a UFO or some sort of spaceship. As soon as I looked at for a few seconds a group of mutants started yelling, I turn to see multiple mutants come around the corner and attack me. Could there be aliens..?

Posted: June 4, 2014
Early Access Review
								The game is aboslutely stunning, the surroundings around you are so beautiful.Nearly everything in the map of the game is interactive, such as realistic cutting simulations, etc; cutting a tree down will require you to move around the tree, and have you swing your axe at it at a mostly realistic times for the tree to be able to be successfully cut.The game also gives you a feature to not die insantly, instead, get kidnapped to the cannibals cave, we're you can find more items, and weaponary, giving you a better chance of surviving on the island.There are bugs, but that's not a suprise, as this is a public alpha, there are some bugs, such as the constructed tents not able to save the game, the game may sometimes crash, and interacting with other things throughout the map. In the future, this will likely to become fixed, but as for now, it's a really good game that can be enjoyed for the older groups.

content:
Posted: September 13, 2014
Early Access Review
								The Forest… It just has a menacing undertone to it. It seems anything you apply the noun of the location it seems to give it a type of pristineness, whether admerason or melevilance. The Forest lands on the latter.    The game experience is rather well put together in its current state (pre alpha). But where to start..    The graphics are are ok, to me the shadows will be the focus when in the woods trying to gather resources. The shadows are done well so far, the shadows move with the sun, diminish in the morning and thicken at sun set. I am sure these shadows will be your worst enemy out there in the future updates since this is where those crazy man eaters are hiding, so keep an eye out.Some of the graphics will seem dated in its current form but they do not take away from the horror/suspense.     The sound effects are quality so far, some need improvement. Right now there is a warning song played when an enemy sees you and changes when they enter attack mode. I wish they made more noise when walking and make sounds themselves. I think the music is a good way to know something is watching you but I would prefer to be able to hear them walking, breathing or talking in order to spot these guys but not yet (this kind of takes away the immersion effect). The rest of the sound effects work for the game, from chopping trees down, swimming, walking and jumping, The atmosphere also benefit from the sound design from rainfall to bird songs all give a good level of immersion to the game.     The Animations and models are basic right now. Swing hatchet at randomly chosen native trying to kill you (one of only 4 I see) , repeat. Now there are stronger enemies but they too also only share a few different models. With that said these models (or lack of) do not take away from the game play at all, the models are terrifying in any situation. The firee light and animations are also done well and the light from the fire does get blocked from an object and creates their own shadows. But don't get too close to your fire pit/fire pole or you will be burned. But these also burn the enemies and wildlife too. So place some fires around camp and they help fend off those bad guys.    Overall the game is quite fun so far, tho a bit repetitive on building and crafting (as of now) there are only a few diff buildings you can make and walls to help protect you more will come I am sure, but after a few hours of play you will have built all buildings/traps that you have. So the main question is do you wait for the actual release or is it good enough to play and buy now?? I say buy it!! You will not disapointed in this survival horror game. With updates coming out almost once a month the content coming will keep you interested in the game. Each new start also creates a new starting location or new map (not sure on this part) but each start is a new place so far. Buy it be safe and get to chopping trees!! Its your only hope to survive; BUILD!~n00bz~  rating scale:Graphics (pre alpha) 6/10 Sound/music: 7/10Gameplay: 9/10Replay value: 8/10Glitchiness (not factored in overall): 5/10 (just weird stuff happens at random times)Creep Factor: 7/10Overall pre-alpha:  7.4      Passover or Buy: Buy

number of helpful: 6 of 7 people (86%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 31, 2014
Early Access Review
								My recommendation comes with a degree of trepidation, as I will explain over the course of my review. I am hoping to give a good and fair critique of the game, in its current state, not what it will be or its potential. As this review is meant to tell buyers about my experience and what they are buying now, as that is very important. Warning there might be some spoilers or what people might consider them in the play throughs so read with care. If you want to just see my break down just skip past them. With that little intro done let me get down to business:First Impression/play through [30~40mins]: OMG it is beautiful, I will say that at first glance when I opened it up I was impressed by the level of detail in everything. The characters were well done, the vibe the forest gives off is perfect, and there is just enough little details that it really makes you feel like you could be in this place. When I had watched the videos of it, I was a bit skeptical of it saying actual play graphics as I have seen that claim in AAA and indies titles with then graphics that are no where near what they said, but this was.At this point I had watched a few videos so I knew the basics of how soon the mutants started to show up after you grab the axe so I took a moment to look around. Though I didn't know that the map was always the same, that only the spawn point and time of day changed, found that out in my second play through. So I quickly gathered the supplies and ran off towards the beach and found the boat, not before I had to hide from a pack of the mutants that were near by. This is was a heart pounding little experience as one mutant looked at me as I hide, before the leader kept going and he was forced to follow along. It was a great little moment, and was one of the best in my first play throughs.After raiding the boat for supplies and finding the spear near by I traveled along the coast looking for a place to call home. About this time I ran across a village and a path to the mountain area, which seems like it will be added later, and avoid another patrol as night began to set in. I quickly made a shelter on a hill and hide/turned off the fire when a group came by. Unfortunately this is about the time in my first play through I ran into the bugs, which broke my great experience with the game.I hid on the hill only to step to far back and begin a glitched slide down the hill, slowly I might add, where I could press "S" to slowly stop and walk in place on the hill. After night came and went on this hill I began my slow slide down again and hit the ground slowly, where upon I died and was captured. Which to say the least was a bit upsetting, but I know it is an alpha and bugs are to be expected like this. I then wake up in the cave, a bit freaked out and go to leave, yet alas I fell through the world. Here ends the tale of my first play through.Second Play Through [70~80mins]:After the first play through I decided to give it another go right a way, since I had so much fun and now a bit of experience. This time I started near the start of the day on a very tall hill and immediately went down it, after collect supplies, to see if I should make a base here. Where upon I see the cockpit of the plane right near by, I had a lucky spawn, and managed to pick up the flare gun about 3~4mins after leaving the plane. About this time I also found the surface village of the mutants, with the creepy music, dead people, and lots of tennis balls... They must have a thing for them or something is all I got to say on that.I then feeling full of myself with the flare gun decided to wait and beat these fools at their own game, after raiding the suitcases and making 10 molis as well. I waited for an entire day just kinda of sitting there, running around, and even waited at night and only 3 guys came by, who were easily killed with the infinite glitching flare gun. A small let down to say the least, yet I decided to move on to greener pastures and actually make a home of my own.Moving a distance from their base I found a high cliff boarding the water and knew this is where my home had to be. The view was great, I had a night big tree, and half of my was protected by the environment. So I make my house and the bigger fire for protection as night falls again and I see small lights over a small bump in the land ahead. Luckily I hadn't started the fire and ducked behind a rock as two mutants walked by. This would mark the last time I ever saw them in this play through at about 15~20mins in.After this point I went about setting up traps, learning more about how the game worked, which I don't get farms and took me forever to figure out cooking. It took me so long to get cooking, despite catching rabbits and putting them on the long fire I almost starved. My poor guy in a fit of hunger decided he was going to eat the mutants and thus ran to their base, after eating some mushrooms, and burst into it flares a blazing only to find... no one, again. Though the utter disappointment of this and his hunger finally taught him how to cook as on his return he built a small fire, placed a rabbit, and lit it for 10 secs and the rabbit was done!This is also the point were the game became unplayable as the birds never despawned and what had started as one or two had become a legion of 30 birds hovering around my camp. How I wasn't seen from the birds alone remained a mystery either way he knew it was no longer safe and was time to hunt them down again! He hunted down their cave, despite of the massive lag, popping trees, and motion blur becoming so bad the game turned into green mush, yet still he found it. After beating down the door, navigating the cave that spawned objects 5 feet in front of him, he died in a rock that spawned on him.----The Breakdown----Gameplay [6.5/10]:I am giving it a 6.5 compared to finished games I have played. Compared to other alphas I would say it is a solid 9, far exceeding many of the ones I have played. Graphics [9/10] start -> [0/10] after 80 mins:Okay so the graphics start out great, but then due to a memory leak, them being unoptimized, or some other issue they degrade to a zero, as the game becomes utterly unplayable.Audio [8.5/10]:The sound is perfect and the ambient noises are beautifully chilling and suspenseful. The music for the most part starts fluidly and ends fluidly, aside from the one at the main base which starts nice, but ends abruptly after a certain distance.Ambiance/Immersion [7.5]:The game is great at drawing you in with the audio and graphics, it really makes the forest come alive. I thoroughly enjoyed it, only the bugs and other minor issues really served to break it, which hopefully will be fixed.Controls [6.5/10]:It would also be nice to have some dialog explain it as opposed to me just pushing every button on my keyboard the first time to figure it all out. Maybe have it in the guide after you learn it. So the guide can be used to store actions and things we know?Map [6/10]:Currently I would give the map a 6 out of 10 as I learned it fairly quickly and due to its size. It isn't too big which is nice, but due to the fact that everything is the same learning where to go in the first 10 mins becomes easy.AI [7.5/10]:The AI is amazingly well done, they are smart, stare at you, and have their own little behaviors which you can study and learn. It is a great feeling to dodge them, watch them try to find you if they think they saw you, and generally outwit them. Summery:Overall again I would recommend this game, if you want to help make it better, and enjoy it for what it is. On a personal note I do have problems with the whole early access thing. As you can never be quite sure what you are getting, if it will be finished, or the fact that most are over priced. To me this game was worth my $15.00 and I am glad to support and can't wait to see where it leads!

content:
Posted: January 25, 2016
Early Access Review
								I have never had so many mini heart attacks in a game before! When I first bought this game I did not expect to enjoy it so freaking much. It was all safe and good at first, just collecting a bunch of food and medicine etc., and me being so focused to hit the luggage right, I hear a creepy laugh and footsteps right behind me and I turn around fast and i jumped when I saw this creepy cannibal staring at me (felt like a staring contest for a minute there xD).At first I thought that they weren't so bad during the day, but boy I was wrong. If you're alone and alot of them surround you, RUN FOR YOUR LIFE! xD It's hillarious playing with your friends though. We love throwing tennis balls at eachother and poking eachother with sticks XD. Had alot of fun trying to kill this spider/octopus like creature. Dying, being revived, friend dying too, both dead, wake up in the plane, run for our stuff, run around more and scream, the creature kills us again, waking up, burning that motherforker to death finally! xDOverall, it's a really great game! You will have alot of spots to explore, creatures that will make you scream, the map is huge so you'll never get bored. I recommend it to everyone, cause it comes with the whole package: survival, scary, alot of fun. 10/10 ♥P.S.: If you don't want to get motion sickness, make sure your motion blur is deactivated and lower your mouse sensitivity!

number of helpful: 6 of 7 people (86%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 4, 2015
Early Access Review
								THE BEST HORROR SURVIVAL GAME I HAVE EVER PLAYED!!! 10/10I will break my review down into pros and cons.. starting with cons which is nothingCons: Why is this game in Alpha? It literally seems perfect to me as far as optimization and content, Pros:Music- not much music, but the menu theme and when cannibals are close really sets the moodGraphics- very nice graphics, simple yet appealing, 60+ frames all the time. i'm running a GTX 770 with VSync enabled. Without Vysnc I literally run 200+ FPS, but I prefer my GPU to be stable and not overwork itself which is why I leave VSync on.Gameplay- Outstanding, The crafting system is perfect compared to other survival games. This game doesnt require a billion materials to make anything. you can make anything you want at your fingertips pretty much. Also suprisingly to me the story is good.. just a plane crash on a deserted island with cannibal/skinwalkers on it. The cannibals can be a pain in the♥♥♥♥♥at times and they can be very ♥♥♥♥ing scary.. like holy♥♥♥♥♥♥.. I've played Outlast and other horror games.. but the cannibals in this game can be very terrifying (mainly in their numbers and how they appear so randomly).**NOTE TO NEW PLAYERS**When you first start playing this game.. get away from the plane crash ASAP. The faster you get away from the plane and toward the beach the better, So far I have started a new game 5 times to test some things and i found that the beach is the best spot and the quicker you get away from the plane crash, the more time you have to build your base up.

content:
Posted: March 15, 2015
Early Access Review
								Even though this game has many bugs, it is still a very playable and enjoyable game. I'm really excited for the new patch that is coming out, I cannot wait to see what fixes they do and what they add.Here are a few things to know about the game before you purchase it:-This game is in Alpha, which means that it is not even remotely close to being finished.-There are many bugs, especially in co-op mode. It is still playable, especially if you're patient enough.-You can only have ONE save right now. If you start a new game and save and you had a game going previously, you will lose your other save.-There are terrain bugs that will make it hard to do certain things (ie trees that are growing out of large rocks can be impossible to chop down)-The sunlight is obnoxiously bright at times and will make it a lot harder to see anything because it darkens anything around it if you're facing it (I'm hoping they fix this eventually because it can be a real pain)-This game is totally worth buying. It has nothing but potential to be an amazing game.

Unlike a ton of other alpha games, this game is almost ready to be fully released. WAY better of a game to than Stranded Deep.  11/10 Recommended

content:
Posted: July 3, 2014
Early Access Review
								Do you like chopping down trees and collecting leaves from bushes? Do you like carrying up to five rocks at any given time? Do you often wish you could chop a monitor lizard with an axe and wear its shimmering hide? Do you want to be surrounded by groups of native mutant tribesman that stare at you threateningly before rushing you with makeshift weapons and ultimately drag your unconscious body away? Do you wish you could wake up in a dark cave surrounded by the corpses of fellow non-natives with only a Bic lighter to light your way out of an intricate system of tunnels with deadly drops hidden in the dark? Do you like mutant tribesman climbing trees to spy on you after you've escaped their cave, all while you grill rabbit in a rainstorm near a hastily made leaf leanto? Do you often dream of taking revenge on previously mentioned mutant-tribesman-kidnap-voyeurs and ripping them limb from limb with your monitor lizard axe before posting their severed heads, arms, and legs on pikes to decorate your campsite in a show of glorious bloodlust victory? If you answered yes to these questions, you should play the Forest, because you can do all of those things. You can also stab fish with spears: the way a real man goes fishing.

number of helpful: 7 of 9 people (78%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 20, 2015
Early Access Review
								The Forest is gorgeous for being in alpha stage. It is one of the things that initially attracted me to this game besides a promising storyline for single player. Lately, the community is demanding a lot with co-op gameplay so it seems like each time the devs release an update the majority of it is dealing with co-op. I'm not complaining, I like playing with others but I would also like to see some major things being done with single player and building and crafting. Right now there is a limited amount of things to do as far as crafting and building and exploring and once you've done everything there's nothing really left to do but get creative and build a bigger, more elaborate base. I hope to see them open the map, add more things to craft and build, basically add more things to do, objectives, storyline, creepier caves, more monsters, etc. I'm really looking forward to the finished product. I've never gotten excited about a game like I am about this one.

number of helpful: 7 of 9 people (78%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 22, 2015
Early Access Review
								One of the best games I have ever played. Constantly being upgraded and evolving. Beautiful graphics. Overall this game is on another level from all other survival games. The greatest thing about this game is it's use of the dark. When it's dark it is really dark. You can't see your hand infront of your face. This is usually followed by a scream in the distance as they come for you.I cannot over-sell it. This game is truly beautiful and terrifying.I found that the game started to stagnate for a short while, but then I realized it was because I was too afraid to explore. This game can be so terrifying you don't want to leave you base. You just want to stay alive. You won't. Once you get better you will for some solid stretches of time, but eventually they find you. Save often. Once you get over your fear of venturing out into the world, and grow a pair enough to start going down into the caves the game really comes to life...and the real terror begins. This game is amazing.Sadly my game has somehow glitched this time not allowing me to pick up the rebreather. I can find it and pick it up, but it will not enter my inventory. I have survived nearly 80 days and built multipe large encampments. This rebreather issue limits where I can go so I will likely have to start over.Here is the thing...this game is so good I don't really mind. As you learn in the game and explore your working knowledge improves so much your survival skills increase. You build smarter. You farm resources more efficiently. You become a better killer. No mutants will stop me. I will rule this island. This game is worth every penny.

content:
Posted: February 13, 2016
Early Access Review
								The forest...I waited for this game to play for a while, because on release it was a little buggy and the game has come a very long way since then. So on that note, let's get this done quickly!Graphics: The graphics are very very good, push it to the max and enjoy some very nice detailing and meshing with a great atmosphere. It also plays super smooth. Audio: The audio is very well presented offering some real in depth feeling from the forest or the crazy people's. Controls: Super easy to get ahold and master, seriously no complaint at all, pickup and go. Game: You crash land on the nicest plane crash ever, seriously watch it and it feels and looks so relaxing just a little bumpy... There is a few crazy people who are dangerous and thankfully the game has coop so you can play with friends and save it, so you both can return another time which is cool. Sadly you can build a fort super quick and survive, but the game does not have much things to actually build though it seems. My friend and I built a big fort in under an hour and ran out of things to do because we built it all... Can be done very fast with two, so we set off on the hunt for the locals to kill, they are crazy and some are hard to defeat. DO NOT VENTURE IN CAVES ALONE, some advice because creates lurk and are hard as hell Devils. There is other things to do, go hunting, exploring (then getting lost easy so set a base marker is best way) and doing a few other bits and bobs but otherwise building is limited to barely any. I love survival games, so added the great details, coop and beautiful surrounds and nice feature then this game is a win. Would I recommend? Yes in seconds.

content:
Posted: June 4, 2014
Early Access Review
								Journal Entry 1 After the plane crash happened, I awoke to see a weird tribal man while bearly conscious. After awakening again I decided to put my serious cap on. I quickly looted everything from the plane. I jumped out of the plane and started gathering all the resources I could. After a few minutes I went straight into the forest.Journal Entry 2 I found a large rock wall face, "perfect!" I exclaimed to myself. I logged some trees down and made a small hut to sleep in. After I had finished I had something catch the corner of my eye and pretty far off I saw three sprinting bodys quickly vaninshing through the trees. I quickly hatched a plan. Journal Entry 3  I went off closer to where they were and made a small fire. I ate some rabbit tasted very good. I made note to myself there was a small pond I could maybe gather fish from later. I had gathered some rabbits and lizard skin preparing for the worst. I quickly ran back to my small hut which could still see the fire and after a few minutes of watching my plan had succeeded.Journal Entry 4 They had all gathered around the fire. I took this chance to go around and on top of the rock wall to get a better look at them. After getting to the top and walking for a little. I realized I was to high up and the trees were blocking my ability to see them. I thought maybe I could get closer and see them looking down the hill. Journal Entry 5 It's dark I thought to myself, and maybe I should go back. But then I saw what looked like to be a flashlight aiming up towards me blocked by a couple trees. I panicked and ran down the hill away from the light source, towards the fire I had made recently. I heard multiple screeches right behind me along with the light aiming at me. Journal Entry 6 I had just made it to the fire, I got behind it. They were screaming and hollering at me a few meters away, scared of fire are we? I started getting extremely confident and started getting closer to the three of them. They started trying to make me run by running at me then stopping. I wasn't falling for it, they surrounded me, I didn't care I stared at the middle one which I assume was the chieftain.Journal Entry 7 I watched him lunge toward me, keeping my clam, I sidestepped and smashed my axe across his face blood splattering all over my arms. I retreated behind the fire and laughed as the Chief full of rage, full on sprinted towards me and stepped in the fire and caught on fire. He started hollering, with his allies just watching me. Journal Entry 8The Chieftan collaspsed presumably dead. I had inadvertently gained more confindence and charged at the other male and swung my axe into him. Making him stagger backwards at the same time the female lunged at me but missed, I took this chance to run back behind the fire. I got behind the fire just in time to see him running at me with rage. Journal Entry 9He stumbled into the fire and caught fire, after he dropped to the ground. The female made a loud screech and sprinted away from me. I saw a flashlight beam in the opposite direction of where the female went. With my newfound technique of killing them, I boldly went towards the light beam with my bloody axe.Journal Entry 10I had easily gotten their attention and started sprinting back towards the fire. Only to see the female who had ran off brought back friends. I could feel my confidence depleteing. I got to the fire and was surrounded by three groups of three and maybe that female that ran off, I could not tell when there is nine of them surrounding me. Journal Entry 11In my mind I was smashing the panic button repeatedly, but was able to calm myself a little by forcing myself to breath slower and deeper. I was running around the fire to "try" avoiding them to hit me in the back, which was sort of working but also making myself dizzy. Journal Entry 12They all started getting bold and started to close down on me, as the adrealine flowed through me, all the sound drowned out and I started lashing out randomly with my axe while running around the fire in circles not touching it once astoundingly. I was smashing faces left and right while getting hit a few times. A couple of them fell in the fire, I think I had killed a few with my axe. Journal Entry 13I think there was only a couple left, I still felt great. But all of a sudden I got hit and blacked out.I awoke in a cave with my head hurting, I luckily still had my lighter for light and gathered everything down here. I had ate some snacks and rested a little bit. I started up the cave and took a turn and found some weird books and candles. Journal Entry 14I kept going down the cave and found a mutant monstrosity that was absoutly revolting with mutilated bodys put together.It seemed to not notice my presence and I got right next to it. I was stricken with curosity and went in front of it. I'm not sure if it ever made a noise, but that was the last of my vison.10/10Al

content:
Posted: June 1, 2014
Early Access Review
								Almost two hours in the game and I absolutely love it. You start off on a crashed jet plane filled with sodas, rags and food. As you proceed towards the exit of the plane you pick up a hatchet that was stabbed in a flight attendent's chest. While you are outside there's luggages that are locked but you can break them open with your hatchet and there's also rabbits and lizards which can be used as a food source later on. But make your decisions quick and get the hell out of there because the mutants will ambush you and scare the hell out of you and kidnap you (what they did to me). Assuming that you got out of the area alive, you have to find a place you find fit for shelter (I prefer the coast because you can see your surroundings better). Your survival book is a HUGE help, look through it in order to build fires to cook your food and keep you warm. But be careful cause they're watching! Only cons are the bugs, the bugs are noticeable as soon as you start playing. I'm not going into specifics cause there are too many bugs to name one by one. But then again it is a Pre-Alpha Build so you can't quite judge it yet.Overall, this game is an amazing survival/horror game. It's definitely worth the price. I see lots of potential and I expect this game to be huge once it's finished. Completely recommend to anyone who loves a good survival game!

content:
Posted: March 11, 2015
Early Access Review
								An alpha game that is already worth the money it costs, with excellent features, devs that regularly update the game (one update every 15 to 25 days) and who listen to the players and teh community.The bugs at this version 0.14 are not too many or too gamebreaking, and quite tolerable, plus they usually get fixed in one or two updates time, while a larger gamebreaking bug IF one occurs (rarely) gets fixed with a hotfix in 2-3 days.The gameplay is awesome, with the only thing thats puts you off (just a little bit) is the many trees you have to chop down, but only if you are the creative huge base - building player. The enemies are pretty smart, give you a natural feeling with the way they act (travelling at packs, checking out noises they hear, women freak out if a patrol/family member dies etc.)Caves provide extra horror, with stronger mutant enemies that can kill in one blow, while offering prety good loot to gather (cassetes, booze even a flare gun), making the player to go cautiously tempted by the loot inside but fearing for his life on the other hand.The structures and the building are pretty diverse, with new things added almost every update, the crafting is also very nice.Overall a very enjoyable game, very much worth the money it costs, definitely worth getting.
