content:
Posted: December 27, 2016
Early Access Review
								The Forest is a great sandbox survival horror although it is still very much a work in progress. I have reviewed this for it's current state of play, regardless of being an early access/alpha title.Survival - Starting with nothing but an axe you have to explore the island in order to scavenge materials, forage for food and medicine, hunt for food and animal skins and find a means of collecting clean drinking water. But beware, this island is inhabited by very aggressive mutant cannibals who pray to the natures of the forest and become very hostile as you ravage it. Right now it is very easy to survive the island with food and water being abundant and easy to acquire but the developers are slowly increasing this difficulty for the recently added hard mode.Crafting - You can build a selection of structures and contraptions to help you create a base camp, including water collectors, sleds for easy transport of construction materials, wall defenses, traps, rafts, houseboats and more. You can craft a variety of primative weapons like spears, a club, stone axe and bow as well as armors made from animal skins or even your enemies bones. There are also make shift weapons that you can create out of more modern technology that you scavenge across the island like molotov cocktails, bombs and sticky bombs. Every crafting recipie is instantly accessible to you and materials are easily found, so you will quickly craft most of the things you need throughout the game.Building - Housing is completely customisable with custom foundations, walls and roofing although there is the option to place pre-built blueprints for smaller cabins, tree houses, temporary shelters, tall platforms, gazebos and more which can be used in creative ways to modify your base. Custom housing materials consist only of wooden logs though stick, stone and bone walls and fences can also be used to customise buildings a little further. Although there isn't any real purpose to creating large bases, it is there as an option for people to satisfy thier creativity.Caves - Caves are visually stunning yet dark and suspenseful areas to explore, you will find story related objectives here as well as useful weapons and survival items that can only found within the caves. Some caves must be explored before others in order to acquire the items needed to progress. Caves are not very threatening in the current state of the game though and only 2 items found in the cave are really necessary for survival purposes.Combat - The enemies in the game are mutant cannibals and some distorted horrors like a mutant with multiple sets of arms or a spider like female. Combat is very basic in the current stage of development but is balanced enough to create a good threat on hard mode to the single player. The game lacks any appropriate difficulty adjustments for multiple players though, so games with 3+ players may find the combat difficulty becomes quite easy. Enemies don't progressively get harder and harder throughout the entire game, so once you reach a certain point the game difficulty will stop increasing.Sieges - There really isn't any variety to defending your base against enemy attacks. Enemies are not unique in the way they assault your base and simply bash against your walls or gates as you pluck them off with arrows or lead them out into the open and fight them away from your walls as once distorted enemies are in your walls your base can quickly lose important foundations which can cause an entire base to collapse losing many hours of work and leaving no way of accurately restoring the fallen sections. Most destroyed sections must be rebuilt from scratch, leaving no blueprint behind for easy and accurate reconstruction.Diet and exercise - The game has an interesting way of increasing your characters stats through weight, diet and exercise. It is quite complicated and not very well explained in the game but I have written a guide on the way it all works and how to get the most gain from it. I strongly suggest reading up on this before your stats go too far negative and it becomes very hard to recover them.Things I enjoy about this game:Beautiful graphics and very atmospheric through sound.Primitive survival combining only items that you can scavenge.Attempts to take a realistic approach, where fun permits.A very tense and suspenseful experience at first due to the horror elements.Hard mode is being worked on right now (Thankfully because normal mode is extremely easy).Things I dislike about this game:Surviving is far too easy. Food and water is abundant and only raw and cooked meats will actually spoil.Health recovery items are instant, which promotes 'chugging' during combat to instantly fill your health.Only 2 spawned loot items are actually needed for optimal survival and construction across the island. The items are both unguarded and always spawn in the same location which makes them too easy to acquire leaving nothing worth searching for.No interesting base siege mechanics. Enemies simply bash on your walls and gates until they get inside.All distorted horror enemies essientially act like the same type of enemy, with minimal difference in attacks.No appropriate difficulty adjustments for multiple players.AI pathfinding and inability to traverse water leaves enemies generally unable to get to the player if the player chooses, removing any threat from the game.Hunting is easy and as simple as running up to the animals and giving them 1 accurate poke with your spear. Rabbits, lizards, raccoons and animals of similar size can be killed by throwing a stone at them (which comes with an aiming reticle, unlike throwing the spear which is supposedly meant for hunting). Animals don't get spooked by sound and only flee once the player has ran right up to them.Caves are not utilized much apart from for story. They are mostly bare of enemies, lacking the enemy spawns and patrols that you get outside of caves.Cannibal villages exist but are empty, lacking any cannibal life or activity. They only increase patrol spawns in the area.No dedicated servers.No anti-cheat to stop people entering your game with cheat mods.If you intend on buying this for the gaming experience without the intent of helping the development progress and/or bug reporting, I would suggest avoiding the title until it reaches beta stage. If you want more on the survival, combat and progression side of the game as opposed to just being able to construct creative bases, wait it out also.It's a fun game, I do like it, but too many features are missing right now to recommend it.

content:

Early Access Review
								I don't buy early access games often but in case of The Forest I've made an exception. The idea behind the game is truly great and it's partially (since it's still in alpha stage) well executed. I should also mention the development team which provides patches with bug fixes and upgrades restless every month.But despite their effort, the game is still under heavy construction which leads often to crashes, FPS drops and countless WTF moments. I'm sure that in the further development, the creators would be able to bring more sophisticated game experience, but in the current stage I can recommend it only to people willing to participate in an alpha test on their own risk.P.S. - The latest patch 0.06 completely removed presence of the first cannibals so I spent few days fighting the tribe of naked women. Please balance this.Also, the thing that pisses me off most is the endless count of tennis balls in the game. WHY? I'm spending hours trying to get rid of them, cause they're absolutely useless. Please, development team, reduce the number of them!

content:
Posted: January 31, 2015
Early Access Review
								My plane went down and it appears as if I'm the only survivor... I had a child. Forget his name already. He may still be alive. Some naked guy took him. Not my problem. I've rummaged through all of the luggage and managed to find this pen and paper. I guess I'll keep a journal. Day 1 - Some more crazy naked people scared the living jesus out of me, I started to build a shelter in a nice little spot, but had to abandon it. I heard terrifying sounds and bolted. Did not look back. I ran until I couldn't run anymore. I've come to a beach with a few cargo containers kicking around. Looks like a good spot. Tonnes of stuff to loot, including what looks like an old campsite... but the tents are still up. Nobody else is around. Half built my crappy little shelter, got a fire going and put some delicious lizard on it to cook up. Going to go grab some logs before the sun comes up. Day 2 - I was out of camp a little longer than expected... I had my two logs up on my shoulder and was nearing my camp when something caught my eye, some shadows moving IN my campsite. I dropped my logs and got out my axe, and started running towards it. The two shadows left as quickly as they had come. Those ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s took my cooked lizard. (Or I left it on the fire too long) either way. I was not a happy camper. I finally managed to build my hunting shelter though. I see a log cabin in the book... going for that next because why not. Day 3 - I was out cutting down trees when I heard a terrible sound behind me. Two naked guys were there staring at me. Judging me. Hating me. I ran. Screw the logs. I did find a sweet skull on the ground while running though. Grabbed it. Got back and made a skull club. They didn't follow me. That day. Tonight they came up on my camp again. I SWEAR it is the same two stalking me this whole time. I've named them. One is♥♥♥♥♥♥ the other is Jimmy. Jimmy got too close... I didn't mean to I swear... but I had to bash his skull in. Jimmy ran off... Day 4 - Dear god. There is definitely more than two this time... Six? Maybe seven.... They're all out there around my camp. Running around all crazy like.... It's time to make a stand. (The journal seems to stop there) 11/10   Such a fun game! And in early access? Definitely worth the 20ish$

content:
Posted: March 16, 2015
Early Access Review
								I have played many of hours of The Forest so its about time I did a review for the game. The Forest is a Alpha game at this current time I have been playing and following since Alpha 0.01. The games updates are always so fun to see, its almost like playing a new game every update I love that about it.The game has a different style of building compared to most games making it innovative. the AI of the cannibals can be so funny and scary at times making for a good mix. Being a Alpha game it will have bugs but the Developers always fix as many as possible each and every update. Probably the best part about the game is the ability to just jump in and PLAY no inventory sorting or thing that slow down the gameplay like that.This was the first "real" PC game I played (I use to be only a console gamer) and I had no problem figuring out the controls and such was very easy to learn and play. Reminds me of my childhood playing in the woods building forts and exploring the unknown I will always hold this game close to my heart for these reasons.10/10 For the Alpha have and would recommend

content:
Posted: June 6, 2014
Early Access Review



YouTube™ Video: The Forest: Early Impressions 

			Views: 421		

			The Forest: Early Impressions Recorded on V0.01 We take a look at "The Forest" the latest in survival horror available on steam's Early Access.		

Above is my video impressions of the gameThe forest is an early access that is full of promise. The game looks great for such an early stage, with realistic visuals, and a large open world. Though it's enjoyable even at this point of the development cycle, it still has some rough edges to smooth over. The game's survival is really about exploring than any thing else at the moment. If you expect a fully complete and polished game, you might want to wait for future updates. But if you're willing to buy into potential, the Forest is full of that (and hungry hungry cannibals.Pros:- Great looking graphics- Awesome "wood chopping" effects- Almost all foliage is intractable / destructible- Large open world to discover- Freaky mutated cannibals are freakyCons:- Still feels incomplete- Wood falling effect a bit wonky- Not much Narrative in current version

content:
Posted: August 9, 2014
Early Access Review
								If you are looking for a complete, brutal survival game, you sir, are looking in the wrong place. Dont get me wrong, this is not a horrible game that isn't worth your money. If you're a fan of early access games, and you don't mind waiting for the next update (which comes rather fast with this development team), this is worth the time and money spent. This is a game that is progressing, bit by bit, and will easily shape in to a great, semi-realistic survival experience. This game is totally worth playing, though i only recommend this to people who enjoy watching a game make progress.

content:
Posted: May 31, 2014
Early Access Review
								Innocently went about my business...built a fire, a hunting shelter, ate a few mushrooms. Brief encounters with natives that ended in simple staring contests left me feeling empowered. Started work on a cabin, all was well. But then..... disaster. Hostile natives came at me from all directions, even the trees. As I fended them off with my trusty axe I could feel the strain of combat taking its toll on my body, but I had gone this far and there were only two natives left. I could do this. I could claim this land as my own. They had taken my child and kidnapped me to show me their horrific ways. No more. I would eradicate this evil from my home. I turned to swing my axe. I was met by a club to the arm, I had miscalculated their speed! I staggered back, my armor gone. The native came in for another attack, this time to my chest. I braced for impact. His club hit me with unimaginable power. I felt my chest cave in and my skin burn as I was catapulted at supersonic speeds above the forest in which I had crashed. And then, just as the plane that had brought me here had, I crash landed on the other side of the map.10/10 would be catapulted again.

content:
Posted: June 11, 2015
Early Access Review
								This game is lovely. The crafting system is deep and satisfying. The atmosphere is forboding, and when it choses, The Forest can be legit scary. The devs seem like good eggs - the game receives very regular updates, issues and bugs are quickly addressed, and improvements always exceed expectations. I could details some of the frustrations I have had, over my hours with The Forest, but the vast majority were already addressed by the developers in recent patches. In particular, the recent graphical overhaul is substantial and welcome improvement to presentation. Spearing fish is neat. Chopping down trees is weirdly satisfying. The mutants are hella f'd up.There's really only one problem with The Forest, as I see it - the game is still in Early Access, and will be for the foreseeable future - so I have to avoid putting in too many hours, so that the final build feels somewhat fresh.tl;dr - game is good, devs seem good, you should buy.

content:
Posted: August 5, 2016
Early Access Review
								A very mysterious and immersive game that is very different to other bog-standard survival titles out there. Don't boggle about it being an early access game, which normally have bad reputations.It's an adventure which you can either contest alone, or with some friends.It can be scary when you play alone though. Being alone at night in a forest full of cannibals and monstrosities, while hearing disturbing sounds in the distance still sends chills down my spine.Building is one of the most realistic I've seen in games. It requires realistic amounts of materials, for example a woodhouse constisting of 80 logs, really requires 80 logs to build. The survival aspect, as in eating and drinking, is not annoying nor difficult. It just adds to the immersion of the game.The combat is standard, not too clunky but also not very complex. You run to your enemy and swing your axe at them.The missing crosshair while shooting a bow bothered me in the beginning. But I got used to it and probably find it better now not having it there, adding another difficulty in combat.The AI is the interesting part of this game. The cannibals don't act like usual monsters, just running towards you while attacking. They feel like they have their own personality. When they spot you they stand still, looking confused as who you are. They act passive and run around you until they realize what danger you are (or how good your flesh smells). They help their injured allies and always scavange around the island in groups. Their behaviour makes you realize that they are just inhabitants of the island, holding together to protect their property.If you are looking for an unique experience with beautiful and optimized graphics, I definitely recommend The Forest.

number of helpful: 4 of 4 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 1, 2014
Early Access Review
								Three goes I gave this game, and each and every time I was at least entertained.  On my first attempt, I was struck by ungodly lag. After witnessing a child being taken away, I awoke to find myself on a plane. I chowed down on everything I could find on the plane and set out to find a tree to conquer.Twas then that I stumbled upon a tribe of happy locals, ready and willing to show about the island on a wonderful and exciting running tour, which ended in my falling over a cliff edge. It was in that time that I noticed just how nice the graphics are.The locals must have noted my fall, as they took me to an underground dwelling where they had tied up all of the other passengers on the plane, probably to keep them from getting sick from the water on the cave floor.Soon after I died, as it was too dark to see where I was going. The light I thought was the exit was a friendly local who beat me back to safety.I lasted 2 days.Attempt number 2 went a little better. I found an axe and set out to take down a tree again, but the lords of clipping failed me and I fell over another cliff. See attempt one for details.Attempt number 3;I was wise to the locals by this point. After devouring the plane, taking the axe and heading towards the best looking water I could find, I landed upon a beach. There was a dead local who I put to rest by blowing him apart, a tent with a stick I used to stab things, and plenty of beer.I found a tree to conquer, but the locals must have come back for their friend, as they were waiting for me. I immediately hit legs, hoping they had not noticed me. I was not being chased so I imagined I was fine.I found a boat and thought it would be a great place to hide, as these friendly locals did not seem to have a swimming school set up anywhere.Night fell and all was peaceful, but I was definitely wrong about the swimming lessons. The locals swam out to assist me off the boat, but I refused and ran as fast as possible after exiting the boat.It began raining as I reached safety, and I was told that I needed to start a fire. I had all of the things I needed but leaves, so I promptly froze to death in a small, premade hut that I think belonged to a local.All in all, hard but fun. I enjoyed the tense feeling right the way through and look forward to future editions of the game.

								This game is great, really great. The survival aspects of the game are amazing, having to consider cold, heat, food, water. content:
Posted: June 26, 2015
Early Access Review
								Considering buying this? Well, here's why I think you should.The Forest is an Open World survival game where It's You vs Cannibals & Nature. You must scavenge for food, water, and supplies. Gather as much wood, sticks, rocks, and anything else you can find before night comes. During the night your primary goal is to survive the waves of cannibals, without dying. Pretty simple objectives. You can choose to play online, join forces with your friends (or strangers), and build massive bases and fight off the waves of cannibals. Or you can choose to play solo and face all the challenges alone, which in my eyes, is alot harder & more challenging. Playing with online is an amazing feature because It alows you and your friends to co-op and try to survive together. You guys can discuss base plans and survival tactics, and you can fight along side them, making you a virtually impossible team to stop. It's awesome, I recommend playing with friends HIGHLY. Also, I've met some great friends just by joining random servers, which is also where you can get some great help. Building is completely custom. You can build anything, anywhere. The Graphics are great, the world is absolutely beautiful, and the goal is plain and simple: Survive.With all this being said, the game is only gonna get better, considering that it is still in early alpha. So if you aren't Intrigued yet, then I don't know what else will work.Graphics 9/10Gameplay: 10/10AI: 7/10Online: 9/10OVERALL: 9/10I hope this has helped your decision!

content:
Posted: June 3, 2014
Early Access Review
								Upated as of v0.03    Well the game is coming along, although a bit slow.  Overall, they have addressed a few issues that people ahve had, while adding more stuff.  Obviously they cant't address every issue because this is alpha and they should worry about critical issues, and just adding stuff without breaking anything too badly.   For now, they have made a peaceful mode, which is great for those wanting something a bit tamer.   They are slowly adding more things to build, visuals are tweaked, and new things are added in the game itself.  However, there are still some issues with it that are annoying as hell, but are not THAT important.  The only thing Im worried about, is the length between updates.  I wouldnt mind shorter waits for small updates, while waiting longer for larger ones.   But time will tell.   I still look forward to this, but it will take some time before things are anywhere near completeEDIT:  as of  april 2017, this game has improved on a lot of things while adding a solid amount of things to do in the game.  While it is still a WIP and the updates are slow, they are working at improving the game and are doing a good job at it.  A full story is added as well, and a creative mode is added too.  However, this game is better played together with someone since farming items takes a while and co-op is just, better peroid.    Performance-wise, its still demanding but can be tweaked in a lot of ways.

Early Access Review
								The game graphics are absolutely beautiful, there's no doubt about that! Probably one of the most visually pleasing titles I have seen in a long while. The game conecpt is rather exciting as well, pushing aside your normal zombie/supernatural survival type experiences. Also, one must keep in mind, there are no 12yo KOSer's running around becuase its a single player experience... for now. When they do plan on implementing multiplayer, it will be co-op based. I can also rest assured that the multiplayer will be localaly hosted, so you can pick who you want to play with.Overall, even with the bugs that are present, this is an exciting title. One I have been waiting for, for quite a long while. As the devs continue to push out content and updates and get past the alpha stage, I won't be surprised if this title is entered as a "Game of the Year". 10/10

number of helpful: 5 of 6 people (83%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: January 11, 2016
Early Access Review
								I've not played this game for long, and this is taking into account that the game is in it's early stages but holy moly. It's so much fun, especially with friends. The game is extremely immersive to the point where when you actually get back to your home after exploring, it feels like getting back home after a day out. It builds a huge amount of tension when exploring caves or dark areas and geniune fear when you hear the screams of the enemies. It's been a long time since a game has made me excited to come home and play and The Forest currently fills that role. This being early access this is a sign of a top quality finished product (when it is finished) and a sure sign that the developers are fully invested in creating the best game they can make. You'll never know how much you like The Forest until you actually play it and it is well worth the current asking price (£10.99 in it's current state). The multiplayer although needing some tweaks (plenty of time, early access afterall) is the most fun I've had on a game in years and the in-game voice feature of using a walkie-talkie to communicate with your friends all over the map is a great idea. Don't review games often, this probably makes no sense but damn, The Forest is good and is only going to get better.

content:
Posted: June 17, 2014
Early Access Review
								This game has HUGE potential to become something great.While it is Alpha and has some serious issues and perhaps even experience-breaking problems, it is very polished, the graphics are amazing, and the gameplay is quite stellar. Perhaps even matching the level of DayZ.But not the security of DayZ.You see, you DO have weapons in The Forest. But these weapons are nothing but sticks and stones, which don't break your bones, but are a somewhat usable weapon. But you will never stand a chance against the mutants. You don't have conventional guns that headshot mutants and make you more secure. Nothing like that. Instead, you have to sneak around them to increase survivability to a big extent. Bringing it to the enemy will only cause you more problems than it is necessary.Shelters and evverything are built by scavenging the world, which has lots of variety and interactivity. You can chop down nearly anything, from plants, to big trees, to mutants. It only adds to the fun factor.If you get caught, the game's survival horror genre comes into play. You are kidnapped into a server of caves, which are the mutants' hold-out and home. Your only way out is running around with a horridly-low-on-fuel BIC lighter. If you manage to make it out, good job, you can return to your house and recuperate, but fatality is quite likely in a lot of cases, so good luck.All-in-all, very nice game, but since it is Alpha, it has bugs, and it is not very recommendable unless you are prepared to face with them.9/10

content:
Posted: November 25, 2015
Early Access Review
								 A very nice survival game with horror and extensive crafting/building. Even though it has been in alpha for quite some time, it receives frequent and transparent updates. The developers seem to interact and listen with the community quite well, which is fairly rare for an early access game.  Like all survival games, it has the potential to become tedious after a few hours. I suspect the developers are working to combat this by adding more objectives, like rescuing other survivors. Overall I can recommend this game to anyone who likes the survival-horror genre, building/crafting games, or unique co-op experiences.

number of helpful: 5 of 6 people (83%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 26, 2014
Early Access Review
								This game perfectly encapsulates the horror effects of culture and movies like"Cannibal Holocaust". Only difference is there is no narrative.... Well, not much aside from your plane crashing and your kid getting taken away from you. The encounters are perfect, since it's not the same kind of thing every time. Cannibals vary(ohhhhh boy..), and their reactions to seeing you can differ greatly, too. A lot of this depends on the players actions and activities. For instance: if you kill every cannibal you see, eventually you'll cross paths with some that are better equipped(mentally) to recognize you for the 'one that got away'. I lasted 9 days my first game. Building and setting up was easy. Keeping my wits about me and maintaining high environmental awareness, was not. It was stressful and terrifying at moments. Sighting one feral cannibal is enough to send you skimpering back to your camp for the remainder of the day. "Did he see me? Is he going to get more friends?" Probably....    My one and only tip: Never assume you can predict the behaviour of the tribesmen. They will ♥♥♥♥ you up when you least suspect it.

number of helpful: 5 of 6 people (83%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 27, 2014
Early Access Review
								The Forest is intruiging as soon as you find yourself in what's left of the plane. I like the fact a lot of things, location of the crash and items you find are procedurally generated. Most importantly the environment is lush with forest, plant life, and it feels as though it's living. Once you come in contact with the mutants, everything changes. You become more aware of your surroundings, and even paranoid. Fishing, hunting, crafting, logging, farming, building, exploring, surviving. That's what this game is about. My first play through I got captured, only had my lighter (I had no idea how to use my flashlight at the time) and didn't make it out of the cave. I got spotted and killed. My second play through I became more comfortable with crafting and building the structures. I started on a log cabin which needs 82 logs to complete. About halfway through building I was beaten and taken to another cave. This time I used my flashlight and made my way out of the cave, I came to a wooden wall, beat it down with my axe, and the sun beat on my face and shone in my eyes. I didn't recognize where I was. I was devastated. I was fourty two logs into my eighty two log cabin and had no idea how to get back to it. As I searched for my camp I ran across "previous survivors" camps. Everyone was dead. At last I made it to my camp on the beach, and finished my log cabin and set a fire inside to keep warm and out of the rain. The last thing I did before retiring for the evening was look around for mutant body pieces to make an effigy. As I was returning to my camp I crouched, seeing three mutants off in the distance building their own effigies next to my camp as a warning. ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s.

content:
Posted: June 23, 2014
Early Access Review
								The Forest is well exactly that.   This is not going to be your average stroll through the woods though.   You will have to be quick on your feet as well as be smart about how what and where you build and the locals do not take kindly to imprompt to visitors.  Yes its got a ways to go but the game is coming along nicely and I will really be happy if and when multiplayer is added.  This alpha gets a thumbs up from me.   After many wrong choices trying to out smart the locals I am happy to say I have now survived 30+ days with out using any of the items on the plane or being captured and taken into the cave by force.  I am now slowly exploring the cave and have 2 secure fortifications.   Good luck and enjoy you will be putting some hours into this game.   :)I continue to be impressed with the game as they updates and patches flesh out the game and make it that much more fun especially with multiplayer.   Keep up the great work this game is a keeper so get it if you do not all ready have it.   Sage  o7

content:
Posted: July 21, 2014
Early Access Review
								Unlike many other early access games, this has great detail already in there and a frame rate that is good. However like many other early access games, this is full of glitches. My favourite examples are the exploding body glitch where if you try cut up a dead cannibal body you get flung in the air like you're being rocket propelled and die, the ground disappearing act where you fall through the ground and end up somehow swimming under the ground with the trees sprouting up around you, and the roundhouse kick where the canniballs kick you and you whiz over the entire map and into the sea on the other side of the island.Now you may be thinking, well hang on you're saying bad things about it when you're meant to be reccomending it?This is true, and so I just want you to know that despite the problems, it is a great game which keeps you on edge constantly and really incorporates you into the game. Overall I do recommend this game as it is very detailed and has surprises at every corner keeping you enthralled. And personally I find some of the glitches quite amusing. If however you dont want any glitches, then I highly recommend you wait for all the updates (which do help a lot) to take place, and then it will in my opinion be a perfect game.

number of helpful: 6 of 8 people (75%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: October 3, 2015
Early Access Review
								The  Forest is the best sandbox survivor I've ever played. I wish I had gotten my hands on it sooner. The combat is fluid and responsive. From my experience in most other survivor genre games, the combat animations and mechanics are clunky, lackluster and usually down-right laughable. The Forest pays special attention to polish, making sure that immersion is never sacrificed. Animations and impacts are all very tangible and rewarding. The audio is great too. Lots of variety in this department, and there's a casual increase in the amount of sinister sound effects that you hear throughout The Forest as the nights carry on and you expand your marooned empire. The enemies are tough and will hunt you down until they knock you unconcious and drag you down to the caves below the surface, effectively into the mouth of hell. You must then fight your way back out in the pitch black armed with only your melee weapon and a lighter.It's worth every dollar of the fifteen asked for it during early access.Bought it yesterday and have already spent 12+ hours on it.. i've gotten lost in The Forest

content:
Posted: February 14, 2016
Early Access Review
								The forest its a really interesting first person horror survival with excellent graphics, ambient, theme and mostly environment, it feels so unique and wonderful the place itself, you eventually feel like you are inside of the island1. You start off on a plane with your son, and you crash land on a suspicious island fulled with life and other creppy creatures. The first couple of hours you will be terrified tryng to hide from the cannibals and trying to find a safe spot to bulid camp. 2. Bulding. For an early access game it comes will alot of stuff to bulid with. You want to start buliding a little house and walls to keep yourself safe. Also you can bulid rain collectors to drink and set up traps to kill rabbits lizards.  Pros-The way the open world is-All the types of cannibals from normal looking to down right the creepiest most ugly thing i've seen.-All the bulding and customizable options for your character and your house.-You can buld traps to kill the cannibals and for a source of food.-When you get captured by the cannibals and you have to escape their turf avoiding them being stealthy, it give you that tingling felling in your balls you know.-Each time you start a new game everything can change, the plane doesn't crash in the same spot and the cannibals can attack you right off the start.Cons-The cannibals AI can sometimes be really bad to the point I stop playing for a while.-Also when you make a house I don't know if it's my game but the door laggs and it won't open or I get stuck in it.But those are the only cons I have with the game. So I give this game a 10/10 does a 10 mean it's great no there are bugs that will make you mad. Sould you buy this game? HELL YES buy the game now. It can only get better and better :]

number of helpful: 7 of 10 people (70%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 30, 2014
Early Access Review
								Its an alpha and that currently shows quite prominently thus far. However, disregarding its current development status I was pleasantly surprised to see the game still holds its own. Its fun, really fun for the first few minutes before you're taken by storm from the islands inhabitants. You're gathering firewood, collecting game to roast on an open fire and building a shelter for the night. Well sonny you aint spending the night in that tent if this is the first time you're playing. While I was constructing my necessities I saw in the distant way a patrol of these cannibals I have never encountered, because of watching certain videos on youtube about this game I knew stealth was an option so I crouched down and watched them go by. My heart was racing, my hands were shaking and I was finding myself still crouching as I continued on my merry way. Before long I saw another cannibal, I had already encountered this one as I remembered the destinct construct on its back. I had come to realise this was the tribe leader, as soon as I faced it, he ran away and climbed a tree. Not a few more seconds after that, a female of the tribe steadily approached me uncaring to the axe I was weilding. Mate her♥♥♥♥♥♥were proper nice, voluptuous and shapely and them nipples on her were perfectly placed. I slowly walked to her before she lunged back, thinking back I swear I saw her almost uncovered minge. While taking a second to recover from my sudden shock, she also recovered of her own and took long strides with her long, curvy legs. Jumping at me she prepared her hands for the grab. Time went by slowly as I felt her delicious, mangled mouth comming on to my arm. For a moment we were connected, but she was in me with her long, hard teeth. Then my bloodfilled meat was in her willing, hungry mouth.  After this painful exchange my character feld dizzy and went for a bloody nap like the♥♥♥♥♥♥he is.But yeah the games pretty buggy, expect to fall through the ground or suddenly die for no good reason. 8/8 though.

content:
Posted: June 8, 2014
Early Access Review
								Finally, after getting my hands on The Forest I can say I see promise in this game. This game has alot of bugs! So be warned before you buy this game. While playing this game can be fun it can also be frustrating at times. I have a lot of good moments and WTF moments but the WTF moments which can be fixed with some updates and time. My first day trying to survive was fun, I got off my crashed plane and found a beach where I would make home. During the day I made a fire and hut. Once night hit I decided to sleep. Sleeping is very helpful as it fills your stamina and saves the game for you. Once I woke up I was scared ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ when three tribes people were standing on the beach looking at me. Once I got up and pulled out my little hatchet I was ready to fight only to see them run off into the forest. Now I was scared and didnt know what to do. This was a very cool moment that almost no games offer these days. The next day I upgraded my base adding a wall and traps. When night hit I decided to stay up and see what would happen. As I was sitting there I looked into the forest and saw a light. The more I watched I could see that it was tribes people. They finally reached the beach and wanted to fight. So I went hatchets blazing....lol... my trap was useless as they didn't step on it but still cool I could make one. I fought them and the kicked my♥♥♥♥♥ I feel like they need to balance the damage the tribes people take, as for I didn't kill a single one. When you go up against 3 or more tribes people your prolly gonna die. When I died I thought the game was over well it wasn't. I woke up in a cave covered in blood and could see anything. I pulled out me lighter and looked around and found meds, flaregun and a better hatchet. I had to find my way out of the cave. Once I did that I went back to my base. Luckly they added a base marker so you know where to go or I would have been screwed. On my way back I fell off a mountain and died. Some way to die after that adventure. Lesson learned about running through thick brush. Overall this game is fun I would pick it up for $15. Below Ill post some of the bugs I encountered. I give this game a 7/10!! I hope you enjoy my review of The Forest. Review Done on 6/8/14 Bugs1.Lost my inventory2.Nobody spawned including (animals and tribes people)3.When you make a new camp you cant sleep there ( 1 camp per save) ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥T!!!4.Cant fill wood storage. It only allowed my to put 1 log in it5.Framerate drops and game is unplayable6.Walk though tents and trees

content:
Posted: February 2, 2015
Early Access Review
								Very interesting and different. Fitting to the survival/zombie like genre of the now. I enjoy the crafting most of all. Hunting needs some work. Bow and arrow aiming, speed tectonics, movement over rocks, down trees, very glitchy but hey its the beta so all that should come soon. But over all very exciting! Very hard without a friend no doubt. The A.I. seems tactical, i like! Hard and easy to be backed in the corner, fun. I havent gone Cave dwelling just yet but i have had most of the basic buildings up and its quite the adventure thus far. Keep it coming, stoked to see whats coming!!!!! Ideas: More, bigger land animals, more wrecks and shipswreck material, water involvement, mountain caves and wrecks, radio towers, weather/space station/governement abandoned structure; More weapons, more crafts, blueprints or books like the basic one which was very well put together and instructive, maybe allow for structures created by others to be come blueprints for all, bigger bonfire effects, more traps for sure. Love the basic hard work atmosphere, i wouldnt recommend powered weapons like chainsaws and such the old school keeps it rare in its genre. Awesome and yes i recommend it! Friends play together and 2 ormore will never g wrong. Also, share food! lol.

Early Access Review



YouTube™ Video: The Forest Gameplay + Giveaway - I'm Hunting Rabbits (Early Access 1080p) [Closed] 

			Views: 3,641		

			Hey guys, This is The Forest Early Access Gameplay stay tuned till the end to find out how to get into the Giveaway to win a key to play The Forest! The Forest is an open-world Survival Horror.		

The Forest is an open-world Survival Horror. You start off as a passenger in a plane which crashes on a remote island.The cannibals who inhabit the island have taken your son so it is up to you to find him.You must build a shelter, hunt for food and survive. Building different types of shelter out of wood from trees and traps to defend your base.The in depth AI which hunts you down live in groups above and below ground. In caves where they keep the bodies of passengers the deeper you go the more horrific these mutants become.With an amazing atmosphere The Forest brings an all new experience to the Survival Horror genre.10/10 I love throwing tennis balls!

content:
Posted: May 31, 2014
Early Access Review
								So here i was. Me ansd my lovely son Winifred were taking a trip to see my mother in Albequerque when all of the sudden the front of the plane comes disatached from the rest, thank the Gods no one else was on board. I was suffering from hunger as i got my fat self up off the ground to find that the only other person on the plane had a hatchet buried deep into her chest which i had no problem removing. I picked up more booze that could possibly fit into my designer jeans. As I began to journey about 5 feet into the woods i thought i heard footsteps and the screams of humans being dismantled in the distant. I soon found a beach where i could cook and rest for the night. While i had my nice little hut set up i began to see apperitions of humans in the distance but i thought nothing of it being in such a strange place, when suddenly i was attacked from behind by a group of canibalistic justin beiber fans. I assume they wanted to share my fish and didnt know how to speak my english language. I awoke in a dark cave where i quickly see my shadow cascading along the long floor,i didnt have a head but that didnt seem to affect me one bit. I found a hatchet and a flare gun by somehow picking up and throwing down again i had unlimited ammo for said falre gun. I eventually found my way out of the cave and began to adapt quickly to my surroundings. I built a nice log cabin with walls for protection and even a fire to keep me warm at night. One day as i was chopping down a tree, a log seemed to have glitched through time and space when it counteracts with where i was standing and shoots me HIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIGH into the air.DEADI didnt think anything of because it thought i could reload where i was at in my game when i found that the load bar was unclickable. So all that work, killing innocent justin beiber fans, chopping down trees and the mass extension of the rabit population led me to nothing.I definatly recomend this game because the women are naked16/10

content:
Posted: August 12, 2014
Early Access Review
								Amazing survival horror game!In this game you'll start by flying around in a plane and then boom, you've crashed. When you wake up you'll have to find food, find water and build a shelter and even a fire. Without these you will die for sure. There are people living on this island that you've crashed on and they will attack and I've found that they're very strong. They will kill you with a few punches but hitting them with an axe will do very little. One of the things that makes this game so fun is that it's single player and you don't go around getting killed by a more experienced player. Currently this game has little to no bugs that I've found but there's room for improvement on the animal AI.The graphics on this game are amazing but will require a decent computer to max out, but this game looks beautiful assuming you can max it out. This game feels very beta and not alpha, the animations are very well done and the game has a very high level of detail to lots of things.9/10 I'd recommend this to any friend and have already.Currently loving this game 5 hours still counting

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 9, 2014
Early Access Review
								~The First Encounter~Surviving a plane crash isn't so easy once i woke up what i saw was rows of seats and a few food trays,I decide to get out as soon as i came to I found an axe,The axe was hacked into a persons chest,I decide to grab it and start getting some wood and some food to try to survive,I decide to head north and i found a perfect area a little beach area,I look around and i see a  silhouette staring right at me,The silhouette starts to run at me so i run,I saw a boat in the ocean so i swimmed as fast as i could to the boat,i felt safe for a bit and saw a few other silhouettes they ran,"huh they didn't see me",I thought,So i decide to get off the boat to get some food since i'm starving,To my surprise the thing that chased me was still alive and ran straight towards me and punched me clear to the sky,i blacked out.~Summary~So aside from a few glitches the game is wonderful a true survival horror it gives you the feeling of being scared and hunted by these tribe people,This game is worth every penny and can't wait for it to be finished.

content:
Posted: June 7, 2014
Early Access Review
								NOTE: I've so far have played versions Alpha 0.01 - 0.03.  Despite the many bugs and glitches this game currently faces in these stages, it's one of the best legitimate survival horror games I've ever played.  You can do so many things that I have dreamt of to be in a video game.  Things like : Stabbing fish with sticks and collectig them for food, trapping crazy cannibals in noose traps, chopping trees down... they actually come down... for once... in a damn video game C: .  Anyways, in all honesty, don't get the game YET, the saving is still a bit sketchy so forth with the other bugs.  Apparently they will also be adding a form of coop. hopefully it supports up to around 8 friends, if this happens, then it will be a true horrifying fun experience to have, especially with friends.  This game is what Rust should have been.  As a result, I rate the game in these current Alpha stages 4.5/10 , although when they update and patch it up, I expect that 4.5 to jump to an 11!  -P.S.  If you guys don't add coop, I will burn The Forest to the ground...    Tally Ho! C:

content:
Posted: February 6, 2016
Early Access Review
								I bought the game 2 weeks after went into early access. I had a break from the game for a few months and tried it again and here's my review for the game since then:This game is progressing pretty fast. They have quite large updates every two weeks or so. One of the best developing teams in early access I've seen when it comes down to actual content releases and fixes. You can actually see a timer in-game referring to the next incoming update and they are really accurate.Before I stopped playing for a few months the game felt a little clumsy and not really responsive. The visuals were great but I had the feeling I had lots of framedrops and performance wasn't how it could be. A few months later (Last week) I gave it a try again and I was stunned how much the game had been improved since then. Game-play AND performance have been improved drastically. I have nearly to zero dramedrops now and I can actually play on 50-60 fps with a medium range computer (Nvidia 670gtx, Intel-i7 2600k 2,4ghz overclockeded to 3.4ghz).As for the price, it is really low in my opinion. I know several games out there which are a lot more expensive and have less updates, fixes, less potential and look far worse than this game. The game still has a long way to go but it is very promising as I see it now.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 14, 2015
Early Access Review
								I made a huge mistake.....Barely making it out of a plane crash, got a good sturdy axe and some random items, I run out to find a good spot for a camp, and come close to a cave, with two cannibals standing outside, and my first thought was "Day one, 2 min into the game, I have an axe, they got nothing.... KILL KILL KILL".... And well, I really must compliment the AI in this game, they are alot smarter than the usual game enemy, so here is how it went: I walk up to the first to test its reaction to me, and it screams at me, meanwhile Cannibal 2 runs off, and I think "cowardly little git"... Well, feeling confident, I run towards cannibal one swinging my axe wildly while screaming something about his mothers size, and the bugger runs like hell, but now, cannibal two, who I thought fled, had surrounded me and was hitting me from behind ripping me apart rather quickly... They didnt even bother dragging me back to their cave, just outright killed me.Well, restarted the game and decided that the hide and seek approach was much better, is at day 7 now, and have a small well defended camp with 15+ traps around, and now, let me tell you something more about the enemy AI in this game, I was sure that i could just make enough traps to be safe, but first time I had a cannibal chasing me and ran behind a trap, thinking that he would run into it, I was dissapointed to see that he stopped 2 meters in front of the trap, looked around it a bit, and ran around it instead, I might have yelled at him at that point... Later on one cannibal ran quiclky through my camp, set off 4 traps by kicking them or whatnot, and proceeded to chase me...This game is not for the easily scared, the cannnibals and mutants are creepy like hell and will surprise you again and again, but in the way that you want to play more, want to see how you can fool them, NEED to have some sort of revenge (**COUGH COUGH** molotov coctail **COUGH COUGH**)Most annoying thing early on was actually finding a turtle shell, I just couldnt find a cannibal free beach, but apart from that, staying warm, hydrated and fed will be main issues, as those will affect your performance in a fight (slower axe swing and low stamina for runnung away, and trust me, you will need to run more than once )Still a few ingame bugs, but nothing that prevents you from playing the game, the ones ive discovered are:1) Still some rocks/cliffs that you will fall through.2) Made a treehouse, and the tree animation went away, so now its an airhouse basically.3) At one point I shot a deer with 6 arrows and it ran off, not sure if they are mutants too?? lol.But all in all, awesome game, would recommend!Oh, and piece of advice, save your game alot, you never know when you will be ripped apart next ;)

content:
Posted: December 26, 2016
Early Access Review
								The amount of survival games we've gotten over these past few years is staggering , vast majority of which turned out to be complete utter garbage even after 2 or 3 years of development.The Forest i'd say is one of the few that turned out good over the years and had actually made good meaningful progress, this and the lone dark are probably the  two only survival games of these types I'd recommend checking out.On my first day i pretty much played the game for 11 hours straight with my bf and we couldn't stop, honestly apart from some janky boat/raft physics we experienced, the game almost feels fully finished  yet it still says it's in alpha 0.52, heck the game even has a full on ending now, so it's not just surviving an x amount of days till' yo get bored or die, you do have an objective, one which is rather difficult and will take time to do unless you just  look up youtube guides but  that removes the fun and surprise of exploring the world and its  horrifyingly scary dark a** caves.Probably the bigest reason i'm loving it is because it's a survival game where the enviroment is actually dangerous and f*cking scary as hell to the player, unlike most of these types of games where the enviroment is usually just a minor annoyance while other players are the main thing to fight always, and that's thanks to the game being focused on Co-op/solo play. So yeah no PVP at all, either play solo or co-operate with other players, granted I'd never recommend joining random lobbies, my strong suggestion is to try and get a friend to play it with you but if you can't, rather stick to solo play instead of dealing with strangers online.Visualy the game looks fantastic with some really gorgeous looking lighting effects and foliage that reacts to everything in the world, everytime the wind blows strong and i see and hear the trees leaning and cracking above me it just sends a chill down my spine. It also runs pretty well on my mid-range system that has a now old 760 GTX 2GB, usually sticking around the 40 to 60 fps marks on High visuals quality with pretty much all the bells and whistles [part from SSAO] turned on in a 1080p resolution.One more thing, something i mentioned earlier but want to say it again ; The game is scary as hell during a lot of moments and i love it, this is the first survival game where i genuinly got pi** a** scared due to the excelent atomsphere,sound design and just general unsetling moments it can have as you explore some areas. It pretty much enters full on survival horror and it's bloody fantastick.If you love survival games, you'll love it, if you also love horror, you'll love it even more. This is the 2nd survival game in early acces which I'd say is actually worth your time and money. It's cheaper then vast majority of its competitors that usually cost 20 euros or more and can it drop as low as just 10 euros during sales. This game beats DayZ's,Rust's,Ark's and many others a** in my opinion. I'd also recommend looking into the Long Dark which is the other survival game i mentioned that I'd wholeheartedly recommend checking out.

content:
Posted: June 8, 2014
Early Access Review
								Finally, after getting my hands on The Forest I can say I see promise in this game. This game has alot of bugs! So be warned before you buy this game. While playing this game can be fun it can also be frustrating at times. I have a lot of good moments and WTF moments but the WTF moments which can be fixed with some updates and time. My first day trying to survive was fun, I got off my crashed plane and found a beach where I would make home. During the day I made a fire and hut. Once night hit I decided to sleep. Sleeping is very helpful as it fills your stamina and saves the game for you. Once I woke up I was scared ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ when three tribes people were standing on the beach looking at me. Once I got up and pulled out my little hatchet I was ready to fight only to see them run off into the forest. Now I was scared and didnt know what to do. This was a very cool moment that almost no games offer these days. The next day I upgraded my base adding a wall and traps. When night hit I decided to stay up and see what would happen. As I was sitting there I looked into the forest and saw a light. The more I watched I could see that it was tribes people. They finally reached the beach and wanted to fight. So I went hatchets blazing....lol... my trap was useless as they didn't step on it but still cool I could make one. I fought them and the kicked my♥♥♥♥♥ I feel like they need to balance the damage the tribes people take, as for I didn't kill a single one. When you go up against 3 or more tribes people your prolly gonna die. When I died I thought the game was over well it wasn't. I woke up in a cave covered in blood and could see anything. I pulled out me lighter and looked around and found meds, flaregun and a better hatchet. I had to find my way out of the cave. Once I did that I went back to my base. Luckly they added a base marker so you know where to go or I would have been screwed. On my way back I fell off a mountain and died. Some way to die after that adventure. Lesson learned about running through thick brush. Overall this game is fun I would pick it up for $15. Below Ill post some of the bugs I encountered. I give this game a 7/10!! I hope you enjoy my review of The Forest. Review Done on 6/8/14 Bugs1.Lost my inventory2.Nobody spawned including (animals and tribes people)3.When you make a new camp you cant sleep there ( 1 camp per save) ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥T!!!4.Cant fill wood storage. It only allowed my to put 1 log in it5.Framerate drops and game is unplayable6.Walk though tents and trees

content:
Posted: December 22, 2014
Early Access Review
								Where to start, this games intro lets the player really feel the fear. The survival aspect is really demanding from being tired, hungry, hurt, cold and wet, and being able to construct shelters. The islands inhabitants just really blow your mind on the ai scripting they will stalk you hunt you and re-group when they are hurt. They are by no means lazy they will run climb and come from every which way. graphics the game is smooth and beautiful it is what i would expect from something similar to the cry engine games which power games like far cry and crysis. the detail is beautiful and impressive from the vegitation to the wildlife you can hunt.There is the ability to co-op with your friends which i have not tried due to the fact there is no server search currently but co-op is done by using there ip and yours to create a lobyy(simple and elegant.).There are a few problems at the moment with the game but remember this is an alpha build.  Water is very simply implimented with water layers meaning you can see to the bottom and the edges of water are usually grassy no river system implimented. Sometimes with tree platforms you can build the trees will disapear and leave you just a floating platform. The bow is a nice addition but i would like to see a bigger better bow eventually with more power and maybe an aimer. I would highly recomend this game its only 14.95 with the xmas sale and its better then most xbox one titles i play to date.

Early Access Review
								The Forest is an amazing game with amazing graphics and just an awesome experience, in this survival/horror game you are the father of a son who doesn't give a ♥♥♥♥ when a plane is crashing and frankly, neither do you, but thats beside the point because your son is a ♥♥♥♥ing alien, anyways. You crash land on a cannibalistic island with your brand new unconscious so-- oh okay, yeah, well it seems like you have to go save your son.Now that you're on the island its time for you to save your son, woah, wait! Not yet, I was joking. You need to get ready, prepare and make shelter, weapons and food all the essentials.But the biggest question is, 'Do you reccomend this game, Jordan?', and yes, I highly reccomend this game, get it as soon as possible because it is generously cheap at the moment, the price will most likely be raised when there is more things in-game as it is a seriously early game. That's just an assumption though, so go save up £10.99 or whatever it is now and get it because it is brilliant.

content:
Posted: December 25, 2014
Early Access Review
								This game features some amazing gameplay! The singleplayer is good but could ofcourse improve. As the devs mention in the section "Development roadmap" They will be making the game graphics better aswell as improving the "running" of the game. I like the game and can't stop playing.There are some things that I think should be quite high on the dev priority list though. I am not a software developer but I think that the bugs in multiplayer should be fixed. First and formost the bug where you can play a game with your friend, both of you save in your shelter by pushing the C key and the you exit the server. When you come back in only the host will have kept his/her things like axes and food. The other thing that isn't really a glitch but a feature that would increase the gamplay experience is the ability to destroy or tear apart your buildings after you've started building or finished the build. My friends and I have realized that not being able to demolish your built stuff can be gamebreaking and make the gameplay less fun. Last but not least i would like to ask the developers to make it possible to share items with your friends in multiplayer (cop-op mode). This would make the gameplay more immersive and make the game a lot better. I hope the developers will take notice of these things and add them into the game although that is just my wish and I do understand if the developers want to chose another path for the game.To sum it up. I like the game and would recommend it to anyone who is looking to play a scary game alone or with your friends. There are a few bugs and some features missing (according to me) that i hope the developers will fix/add to the game.I give this game a 8/10 because of the things listed aboveKind regards, Your fellow gamer

content:
Posted: June 15, 2014
Early Access Review
This game has a lot of promise. I can see the direction it can go and hopefully will go.[/b]As for the current product:The game remains unplayable for me. I cannot seem to last more than one night alive. The enemies are too erratic and there is no real way to ward them off. Sometimes they sit there watching you just as if you were a test subject in their fantasy world. Sometimes they see you and freak the hell out that you are in their territory or maybe just because you exist, and begin to bum rush you from every angle. When this happens, just surrender you are going to lose unless it is 1 VS 2. Then, you may have a chance.Pros:Great graphicsVery fun to kill animalsPretty cool constructions, and trapsEasy to just pick up and play with the use of the survival bookCons:Enemies are too erraticItems bug outCertain areas of the map are just scenery and not actual map (eg. falling through hills and mountains into water)Can't pause the gameMotion blur is too intense even with it turned off. It makes me feel sick playing on a 70 inch.The caves are a bit too dark to see even with a lighterThe cave's walls often disappearBottom line:[/b]Great game so farHas serious potentialCurrently has serious bugs (Still in Alpha so understandable)If you can handle having lots of issues and bugs and want to be essentially a play tester and help in the development of the game, play now.If not, wait until some stuff gets ironed out.

Well, feeling confident, I run towards cannibal one swinging my axe wildly while screaming something about his mothers size, and the bugger runs like hell, but now, cannibal two, who I thought fled, had surrounded me and was hitting me from behind ripping me apart rather quickly... They didnt even bother dragging me back to their cave, just outright killed me.Well, restarted the game and decided that the hide and seek approach was much better, is at day 7 now, and have a small well defended camp with 15+ traps around, and now, let me tell you something more about the enemy AI in this game, I was sure that i could just make enough traps to be safe, but first time I had a cannibal chasing me and ran behind a trap, thinking that he would run into it, I was dissapointed to see that he stopped 2 meters in front of the trap, looked around it a bit, and ran around it instead, I might have yelled at him at that point... Later on one cannibal ran quiclky through my camp, set off 4 traps by kicking them or whatnot, and proceeded to chase me...This game is not for the easily scared, the cannnibals and mutants are creepy like hell and will surprise you again and again, but in the way that you want to play more, want to see how you can fool them, NEED to have some sort of revenge (**COUGH COUGH** molotov coctail **COUGH COUGH**)Most annoying thing early on was actually finding a turtle shell, I just couldnt find a cannibal free beach, but apart from that, staying warm, hydrated and fed will be main issues, as those will affect your performance in a fight (slower axe swing and low stamina for runnung away, and trust me, you will need to run more than once )Still a few ingame bugs, but nothing that prevents you from playing the game, the ones ive discovered are:1) Still some rocks/cliffs that you will fall through.2) Made a treehouse, and the tree animation went away, so now its an airhouse basically.3) At one point I shot a deer with 6 arrows and it ran off, not sure if they are mutants too?? lol.But all in all, awesome game, would recommend!Oh, and piece of advice, save your game alot, you never know when you will be ripped apart next ;)

content:
Posted: February 6, 2016
Early Access Review
								I bought the game 2 weeks after went into early access. I had a break from the game for a few months and tried it again and here's my review for the game since then:This game is progressing pretty fast. They have quite large updates every two weeks or so. One of the best developing teams in early access I've seen when it comes down to actual content releases and fixes. You can actually see a timer in-game referring to the next incoming update and they are really accurate.Before I stopped playing for a few months the game felt a little clumsy and not really responsive. The visuals were great but I had the feeling I had lots of framedrops and performance wasn't how it could be. A few months later (Last week) I gave it a try again and I was stunned how much the game had been improved since then. Game-play AND performance have been improved drastically. I have nearly to zero dramedrops now and I can actually play on 50-60 fps with a medium range computer (Nvidia 670gtx, Intel-i7 2600k 2,4ghz overclockeded to 3.4ghz).As for the price, it is really low in my opinion. I know several games out there which are a lot more expensive and have less updates, fixes, less potential and look far worse than this game. The game still has a long way to go but it is very promising as I see it now.

content:
Posted: August 12, 2014
Early Access Review
								Amazing survival horror game!In this game you'll start by flying around in a plane and then boom, you've crashed. When you wake up you'll have to find food, find water and build a shelter and even a fire. Without these you will die for sure. There are people living on this island that you've crashed on and they will attack and I've found that they're very strong. They will kill you with a few punches but hitting them with an axe will do very little. One of the things that makes this game so fun is that it's single player and you don't go around getting killed by a more experienced player. Currently this game has little to no bugs that I've found but there's room for improvement on the animal AI.The graphics on this game are amazing but will require a decent computer to max out, but this game looks beautiful assuming you can max it out. This game feels very beta and not alpha, the animations are very well done and the game has a very high level of detail to lots of things.9/10 I'd recommend this to any friend and have already.Currently loving this game 5 hours still counting

Early Access Review
								~The First Encounter~Surviving a plane crash isn't so easy once i woke up what i saw was rows of seats and a few food trays,I decide to get out as soon as i came to I found an axe,The axe was hacked into a persons chest,I decide to grab it and start getting some wood and some food to try to survive,I decide to head north and i found a perfect area a little beach area,I look around and i see a  silhouette staring right at me,The silhouette starts to run at me so i run,I saw a boat in the ocean so i swimmed as fast as i could to the boat,i felt safe for a bit and saw a few other silhouettes they ran,"huh they didn't see me",I thought,So i decide to get off the boat to get some food since i'm starving,To my surprise the thing that chased me was still alive and ran straight towards me and punched me clear to the sky,i blacked out.~Summary~So aside from a few glitches the game is wonderful a true survival horror it gives you the feeling of being scared and hunted by these tribe people,This game is worth every penny and can't wait for it to be finished.

content:
Posted: May 30, 2014
Early Access Review
								This game IS in ALPHA and i have taken note of that and everything i reference is in light of that fact.Ok so i saw the price was £11 for me, after all the hyp, i thought, you know what, that's good! So i buy the game. When i got to the menu, full of excitement i was a little diss-appointed at the lack of options and maybe the menu could have looked a little nicer, but hey, its alpha! Anyway i jumped right in after disabling the motion blur, personal preference. (you do have to do this every time you die, nothing saves, but more on that in a minuet) ok the opening scene is just how you see in the trailer. I won't give anything away but it's how it is portraid in the trailer as a plane crash. The opening scene isn't very long and your soon in for your first taste of the experience...Now i have jumped out of the plane realising i have been left to fend for myeslf with bare tutorials, just a few notifications telling me im hungry. The first thing that really caught my eye was the stunning scenery! The pure expansion of greenery foliage goes beyond description. I soon realised that you can harvest a good majority of that foliage too!Me being completely logical thought that using the plane crash as shelter is a good idea, only... you can't get back in the plane, i can only assume this is so it can't be abused and it forces you out to fend for yourself and build your own shelter! Which i like. Now something tells me these things are attracted to the lufthansa plane landing in there back garden and soon begin to investigate.... very soon...The HUD is simple and personally i like the inventory, which is simply (i). The layout of the inventory is nice, it is easy to use, the only thing i would say is you can craft items, which there is no clear tutorial for which i have seen. There is very little help on this game. After about 5 minuets or so, i encounter my first jump scare, they are VERY sneaky! i turned around and there was a half naked man in my face. I hit him with my axe a few times... and a few more.... and a few more.... and a few more... yes these people seem to have an immunity to anything with a sharp edge! Eventually you can knock them down and kill them.An issue ive encountered is once they aggro you it is VERY hard to loose them as your stamina will drain fast and they are TOUGH. It's best to try not to get seem AT ALL in the first place. So you WILL die probably sooner rather than later and it is not over there. You get taken to their lair... only to find more shinies! YES there are LOTS of collectables especially in the conveniantly placed suitcases lying around the wreckage... and the whole island. There is only one way in and one way out of the cave!  It is known to be able to fall through the map in the cave, again its just alpha. Once you are out the next time you die WILL be your last! Don't die again.My advice is open the guide it does give you using (b) and build those first few basic items. My furthest so far is 5 days and it was enjoyable, however there are some underlining issues that are BIG in my eyes, these are as follows:- The save feature is broken (atleast for a very vast amount of people such as myself) I REALLY need to be able to save my progress, because if i die i HAVE to watch the cut scene again, do the cave AGAIN.- The log stockpile doesn't seem to work where you store logs for later use. Not sure if it's just me on that one but i can't anyway.- The tribal people are a little bit OP in the fact that they are tough and spot you vey easily. Make sure you always have food, that gives you stamina to run!With that said, this game has a ridiculous amount of potential, im really enjoying it, at night sometimes i don't want to leave the safety of my camp, thats a GOOD thing, the atmosphere is awesome, very tense. I am REALLY looking forward to co-op, which they have put in the future features list!I am a bit unsure as to whether to recmmend thhis game simply because of a few big issues as stated above. BUT i WILL recommend it simply because when they are fixed this will be incredible. My advice is buy it whilst it's £11 or what ever your currency is and thank me later! Buy it now, enjoy it a small amount, enjoy it MORE when its public release!Hope this helps...

content:
Posted: October 26, 2014
Early Access Review
								This game is like they say an alpha build. So don't expect it to be free of bugs or completly feels like a finished product. To the time I write this I only have played around 3h but I still continue to play it.What is positive:-The nice graphic which I personally don't really expect from an Indie-product-The feeling when you move around to look for a place to build or just explore and you didn't look around and you run into a group of nativs-The KI is believable some natives will attack you if they see you, some will flee and other will watch you courious. Also if you build a camp or just cut down a tree the nativs will notice and investigate.What is negativ:-Enemy design: So far all enemie-typs looks alike so you get the feeling there is somewhere a clone fabric.-Glitches: Sometimes you can see and walk through stones-Logical problems: You crashed with a plan (only you and your sons flys with) and wake up but everyone else is dead. I asked myself: What the... how long was I out?I would recommend this game to everyone who don't intent to get a full developed game. Overall it has it's weakness like anyother game. It is an alpha build (to release a alpha build as buyable early access is questionable but still 15€ it is rather cheap) and as such it is rather good. I for my part will watch the game as it change and if the developer do implant everything thay planed on then this game is completlly worthe it's money.

content:
Posted: December 25, 2014
Early Access Review
								This game features some amazing gameplay! The singleplayer is good but could ofcourse improve. As the devs mention in the section "Development roadmap" They will be making the game graphics better aswell as improving the "running" of the game. I like the game and can't stop playing.There are some things that I think should be quite high on the dev priority list though. I am not a software developer but I think that the bugs in multiplayer should be fixed. First and formost the bug where you can play a game with your friend, both of you save in your shelter by pushing the C key and the you exit the server. When you come back in only the host will have kept his/her things like axes and food. The other thing that isn't really a glitch but a feature that would increase the gamplay experience is the ability to destroy or tear apart your buildings after you've started building or finished the build. My friends and I have realized that not being able to demolish your built stuff can be gamebreaking and make the gameplay less fun. Last but not least i would like to ask the developers to make it possible to share items with your friends in multiplayer (cop-op mode). This would make the gameplay more immersive and make the game a lot better. I hope the developers will take notice of these things and add them into the game although that is just my wish and I do understand if the developers want to chose another path for the game.To sum it up. I like the game and would recommend it to anyone who is looking to play a scary game alone or with your friends. There are a few bugs and some features missing (according to me) that i hope the developers will fix/add to the game.I give this game a 8/10 because of the things listed aboveKind regards, Your fellow gamer

content:
Posted: May 31, 2014
Early Access Review



YouTube™ Video: The Forest Gameplay + Giveaway - I'm Hunting Rabbits (Early Access 1080p) [Closed] 

			Views: 3,641		

			Hey guys, This is The Forest Early Access Gameplay stay tuned till the end to find out how to get into the Giveaway to win a key to play The Forest! The Forest is an open-world Survival Horror.		

The Forest is an open-world Survival Horror. You start off as a passenger in a plane which crashes on a remote island.The cannibals who inhabit the island have taken your son so it is up to you to find him.You must build a shelter, hunt for food and survive. Building different types of shelter out of wood from trees and traps to defend your base.The in depth AI which hunts you down live in groups above and below ground. In caves where they keep the bodies of passengers the deeper you go the more horrific these mutants become.With an amazing atmosphere The Forest brings an all new experience to the Survival Horror genre.10/10 I love throwing tennis balls!
