Early Access Review



The Forest 
A Screenshot of The Forest
By: Owen153




I followed the development for a long time leading up to the game release and have owned it since then, but lately I log in on occasion to see what's been added and improved on, and it does not disappoint. There are so many nice features and great gameplay - Visually, these images just expresse the wonderment wandering around the island. 


The Forest 
A Screenshot of The Forest
By: Owen153




If you want a realistic, raw, survival game with great imagery, I definitely recommend this game. I can't talk much about the AI as I tend to play 'Vegan' mode more often then not just so I can experience the exploration, hunting, foraging and building aspects, which are unsurpassed by other games of a similar genre.

number of helpful: 42 of 79 people (53%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 30, 2014
Early Access Review
								Let's get started! So upon opening the game I really wanted to see what the game really had to offer (as did most people) and as soon as I got in game the bad quality sounds put me off a bit... However with the graphics are simply just amazing.I have been super impressed with the crafting system throughout the game. It gives you a building template for anything you want to craft which tells you what you need for the constuction. I give the crafting 8/10 still needs fixing however still lives up to a great crafting system which most games would need.The graphics were over powering as 4 people made this game! It brings a huge amount of immersion and realism into the game and improves the overall feel of the game itself. The art was very well done! 7/10 for the art!The sounds are something that can bring a huge point of immersion as well and to start off with there really isn't that great quality sounds. There isn't any bass in the sounds and it sounds like something off a nintendo 64. The sounds (however) get better after that starting scene and really bring you into the game. I will rest with 6/10 for the sounds until they fix the starting scene.The A.I isn't always the smartest however for an alpha game they have really made some really good A.I. If you get too close the enemy's as they approach you they will back off and the other ones will try and circle around you! 8/10 for the A.IMy overall score is:Average score given: 7.2/10My personal total score: 8/10The planned features interest me very much, The co-op would be a really nice addition and I am look forward to that when it comes out!

content:
Posted: June 25, 2015
Early Access Review
								Day 1: I did what any sane person would do when crashing in a forest; Ran around and punched suitcases to steal from the dead. They didnt need it, I did. After I had my arms around 4 sticks and 2 stones, I found a convenient survival guide in my back pocket. It stated that a fire was good for morale, and I've seen Bear Gryllz, so I could confirm it. But, to aimlessly build a shelter out in the open is a bad idea. So I took a moment to gather my bearings, and placed a campfire behind a hill, near a bottleneck formation of rocks. This place was perfect. Fire was up, I caught a lizard (It was petrified from my manlyness) and cooked it. What a boost to my morale. I had heard these forests were dangerous, so I took no time to doubt, and hurried to build defensive walls around my rock formation, to keep me safe. I lost sunlight fast, and decided to call it a night. Something in the dark, deep forest was screaming, I dont know what.Day 2: The screams from last night kept me up. I've gotten close to no sleep, my water is running out and I am low on food. I must think of something fast if I'm to survive in this unforgiving habitat. Then I remembered a technique known to noone at all. Slaughter a threatned species to use its shields to gather rainwater in. Now I had water. A human can survive for three weeks with water, and barely one without it. I made an axe out of what you would expect. Stone, some bindings and a stick.  Now I had a weapon, I was ready. I awaited the twilight, built traps and stocked up on all my most vital resources; it was going to be a long night.After a battle in the darkness I was defeated, I dont know what I fought, but it was tough. And it dragged me to a cave. Luckily, my time in the Elite Gamer's League taught me a thing or two about survival in caves. DONT EVER USE A LIGHTER or a FLASHLIGHT; Use a torch, they are reliable. So I did. I finally saw some distant light in the cave; civilization. I was saved. I had found human beings. Here my adventure en-.. Wait, why are they naked? Hello? Why are you growling at me? That's a nice club you got the- Excuse me? I'm in time for dinner? AAGH!♥♥♥♥♥♥ 11/10 - Bear Grylls would♥♥♥♥♥♥his pants again.

content:
Posted: May 31, 2014
Early Access Review
								Okay, I like this game. The developers have obviously put a lot of work and effort into it. Its not the horror game they promised. I havent been truly scared yet BUT! Thats not a bad thing. I once got into a battle with six mutants, put the song Light Up The Night by The Protomen on, and had one of the best melee combat experiences in any game ive ever played. I like this combat better than Skyrim's, Assassin Creed's and some of Chivalry's. The graphics are the BEST ive ever seen in any indie game. The lighting is superb and the flora and fauna rival a tripple-A game's quality.Now, I must say I am extremely disappointed by the fact that there is no save option yet, so i'm mainly looking for cannibals to fight, rather than building a base. The sound design could be better. I think having war cries in battle of mindless chattering sounds coming from dormant cannibals would make the game  much more immersive. I probably wont play this game until a save option is implemented. But know this, Endnight Games, you have achieved great things with this game. Do not buy if you dont want to deal with bugs or having no save features. Wait for the full release of beta.8/10

Early Access Review
								My first run was terrifying. Got out of the plane, grabbed supplies, and noticed a group of cannibals walking away from the crash site.I decide to investigate.BAD idea.A group of them rush me from out of the bushes and I'm forced to run as far away as I can.Eventually I lose them, and I find the other half of the plane, with the pilot and co-pilot both dead. I decide to make camp here for the night. Gathering materials isn't too difficult, but once night hit, I was in for some fun from a group of 6 patrol-cannibals, ready to destroy me on sight. This was all in my first couple hours of playing by the way.Just get this game. There's too much potential here. It's really a fun nervewracking time.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 5, 2014
Early Access Review
								I loaded up The Forest for the first time, finding myself wandering away from the crashed plane - meandering around with an axe, cutting open locked suitcases and stealing the contents. All the while, in the distance, figures darted away through the treelines; spooking me out something nasty.Eventually I decided it would be a good idea to make a shelter, so with the help of a chocolate bar and an axe - I quickly assembled a shelter on a plateau just downhill from the crash site.Figuring it would be enough for today, I went to sleep.I woke up in the early morning to decide to wander down to a nearby beach and swim out to a yacht, only to find a group of figures wandering around the beach. The moment I stepped onto the beach, they screeched and legged it into the nearby forest.A little bit spooked - I swam out to the nearby abandoned yacht to salvage a few painkillers, soda cans and rags - deciding to return to my shelter for the night (it was now the middle of the day).Upon sleeping, I was woken up with the message that I should build a fire to not die of cold - so I wandered around in the forest for a few minutes, chopping up bushes and finding sticks to build a necessary fire. However, I happened to notice that this time, there were a few fires in the distance. And between the thin light those fires gave out - there were outlines of people, figures watching me: A good 7-13 of them.A little bit spooked, I sat by my fire and cooked some raw lizard I had killed the previous day.The figures still stood in the distance, but after eating my food and drying off - I went to sleep.I was woken up what seemed an hour later, still in the middle of the night.The fires were closer.Much closer.And the figures were walking towards me.I hit by some nearby rocks, fear pulsing through me like a shark in a Burger King.As one approached my shelter, I ran forwards, swinging my axe like a mad man and hitting him square in the neck. However, before I could properly turn to meet his companions - a swift kick to my right side knocked me to the ground and everything went black.I woke up in what appeared to be a cavern, but it was too dark to tell exactly where I was - pale light from a distant fire in a tunnel dimly lighting up the roof.Pooping my undergarments, I got out my lighter and lit it - the orange luminescence immediately reflecting off claret in front of me.Five bodies, dismembered and hung all around me.Holy ♥♥♥♥ing♥♥♥♥♥♥TL;DR - spooky 10/10

content:
Posted: December 2, 2014
Early Access Review
								"EAT FLARE!" I exclaimed to myself, face to face with hissing, cannibalistic mutants, with flare gun pointed directly towards them. I fired away, watching in bewilderment as the flare rocketed harmlessly through the chest of my opponent and proceeded to travel through the nearest cave wall without so much as a pop. I was soon thereafter, beaten to death; my punishment for entrusting the game's description of the flare gun's use as a weapon with my life. This is through and through, a game in its Alpha. Its incomplete, and nobody is hiding that fact from you when you purchase it, or play it for that matter. However, dealing with the fact first hand can be tedious. Right now, this game seems nothing more than a massive playground, of which your only goal is to stay alive. That goal will be continuously hindered by the game's lack of fairness as an incomplete piece. Your biggest enemy, at this point, are not the mutants you face, but the bugs you'll encounter in trying to deal with them. Hiding away in your treehouse means little when enemies can see you plainly right through its walls. Traps you carefully laid for them fail to go off. One moment you'll be squaring off with a mutant, swinging your axe, only to have the axe unequip mid-swing, left defenseless to their onslaught. Its very easy to forget this game is Early Access when you're in the throes of it because its such a damn good title. Its too much fun for its own good. It's a gorgeous game with  solid mechanics when they do work, and addictive replayability. It makes you want to endure the struggle of survival so very much, that when its early programming flaws rear their head, it is just that much more frustrating to deal with.So I do give The Forest my recommendation. I want people to play this game. I just see too many condemning it for its bugginess, as if they didn't know what they were signing up for. As long as you go into this project with reasonable expectations for how it will function, you won't be disappointed.

content:
Posted: May 2, 2015
Early Access Review
								Hi everyone, I played the forest from day one and loved the idea as it was fresh and gave something different. This survival horror slash/hack em up will make you love it and hate it (but hate it in a good way). When i first had the forest it was glitchy as hell, there was no save function. It was really good fun but temporary fun, it went downhill pretty quickly. I had several hours worth of fun until glitches and saving ability wasnt added into the game.Anyway ive come back to the game after many months, even upgraded my pc and i have fell in love with it :Dits scary and beautiful at the same time!In a nut shell, i followed a group of turtles making their way into the water at the edge of the beach. The moonlight shined on their shiny shells, i was taken in by the max quality/graphics (rub it in) and smooth game play.A group of four shuffled their big homes along the beach and 2 had gently breached the shallow water and i had a message pop up in the bottom of my screen saying "you are thirsty find some clean water to drink", i looked up the inventory screen and saw a recipe that made my day.All of a sudden lightning and heavy rain followed immeadiately after i closed the crafting book. I remembered the water storage recipe and looked at the last of the 4 turtles... the one little straddler... who nearly entered the shallows....he made a good meal.I felt really guilty killing the little guy just so i could have a water storage stand using his home to help me.In a turtle shell Donatello, Michaelangelo and leonardo will swim and swim freely, raphael is my ♥♥♥♥♥..,......Teenage mutant ninja trio11/10

content:
Posted: June 12, 2014
Early Access Review
								12/06/2014 - If you haven't already heard, The Forest is a must have for anyone looking to settle for nothing less than amazing. From the begining this game is very easy to get into providing exactly what you would expect a Triple A title to deliver, but always fail to do so. Endnight Games has taken the best of many open world and horror games and mashed it into The Forest. Making it the perfect past time for soo many gamers. 9/10 ***THIS IS A PRE-ALPHA. The game does have little bugs and glitches but that is expected, 5 more days until the next update.Example of typical day in The Forest - Wake up from whatever shelter you have built, scavenge the creepy woods for an animal to satisfy your hunger and raise your energy levels. If your lucky you will encounter some cannibals face to face rather than being jumped from behind when you least expect it. Realize you should have some fun with the Island's inhabitants by setting up traps, catch a cannibal and use his arms or legs for combat or to warn other cannibals of your abilities. Go back to your base in progress and keep a sharp eye out for anyone trying to take your life at night.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 14
Early Access Review
								Well, I just had to take the time to leave a review for this game which i would class as one of my absolute favourites dispite being early access and which i will continue following and playing. I am a scaredy cat... I couldn't bring myself to play this alone without freaking out at the pitter patter of a deer in the distance about to run past me or an unseen rabbit lurking in the bushes rustling. So i played with a couple of friends. Still scared but feeling a little more confident we ventured. Built a base on the island crafting whatever we could to help us survive. The cannibles are quite frankly horrifying at first. The noises when you are caught out at night are enough to curdle your blood at times. Especially when you can tell they are coming from a mountain somewhere probably spying down on you, stalking ready to strike some time.The caves are where the early access shows. Don't get me wrong they are unnerving and so fun to go through but lacking in enemys in some places. Never the less you want to search the entire thing to find clues to what has happened. All in the aim to get to that dramatic sinkhole you come across at some point while adventuring. The story had a turn i didn't really see coming and is open ended which makes it quite exciting to think of whats going to be added from now to the time of full release. In short terms. I have had an absolutely amazing time with this game already. Have completed it twice. The building and gathering has that addictive feel. The story is great for an alpha. I cannot make this game sound as great as it is so buy it and put in the time to find out!

content:

								I am completely amazed that this game was made by a group of only 4 people.  There are some issues here and it is an alpha; however the forthcoming patch is going to fix issues such as not being able to save the game.  The enviroment is beautiful, immersive and absolutely terrifying depending on where you are.  I am very much looking forward to seeing how this game develops. I personally think the price of this game will go up significantly once it is out of early access and I think the current price is fair for something quite so remarkable.  If you like games like Rust, DayZ, Project Zomboid definately check out the forest because I think you will love it.

content:
Posted: November 23, 2016
Early Access Review
								The Forest is incredible! BUT I recommend you wait for full release. This is because the game is constantly improving and can only get better with each update. I think patience would be a true virtue in this case. To wait for a complete, finished product that would be unlike any game you have played. Unless you want to be apart of the process of making the game better, defending yourself from cannibals with friends in co-op or in multiplayer, squashing bugs, and to see how the game develops. I've put quite a lot of time into this game and came to the conclusion that at certain times when I visit the game there always comes a point where I feel like I've explored, crafted, and had done everything the game was capable of at that point in time. What I like to do is revisit it every now and again and I am always impressed. My favorite part of the day is seeing the devlogs from the developer (Praise be to them). They update it frequently, packed with new content, systems. Every once in a while it's like a whole new game after a certain time period of updates. I didn't purchase the game. I won it on a twitch stream. If I did, however, purchase it I would have been very happy with my decision because of how the developers treat the games development and it's players. It's an incredibly beautiful game, sound design is constantly improving and is excellent, has moments that have never been done before in a game. The potential is unreal. I can't wait for final release. I would say that the game reminds me in certain ways of Silent Hill without spoiling anything.

content:
Posted: May 30, 2014
Early Access Review
								This game is great. This was my first experince with the game. I wake up in a crashed plane. I immediately gather food and meds that are left over from the crash. Then I pull an axe out of a womens stomach. I'm out of the plane and I see a bunny. The first thought into my mind is "FLESH. I NEED FLESH!" I charge at the bunny and chop it up. I then hear screaming from behind me. I look and see a pack of 5 mutants walking towards me. My heart stops and I♥♥♥♥♥♥my pants. I start running the opposite direction to try to get away and I come upon a cave. I look behind me and there still chasing. There was no other way to go but the cave. I walk inside. Its pitch black. I pull out a cigarette lighter using it for light. I trek deeper into the cave and I come across an underground pond. I look above me and I see bodies hanging from the ceiling. I think to myself "Oh♥♥♥♥♥♥" On the other side of the pond I see a man standing there. Another one of the mutants. I pull out my axe and approach him. I see no other choice but to kill him. I swing my axe in to him a couple times and hes dead. Then I hear more screaming from behind me. Another pack of mutants. I walk backwards only to end up walking into a wall. I'm trapped. They all start charging at me. I♥♥♥♥♥♥myself once more. I quickly press escape and exit the game. The Forest has been one of the most anticipated games of this year. It dosen't fail to impress. At this moment in the game there are a LOT of bugs. One of the major ones being not being able to save your game which kinda sucks. But its not a reason to not buy the game. The $15 is well worth it. Once the full game is released the price is surely to rise. So why not buy it now.11/10 would bang.

content:
Posted: July 27, 2014
Early Access Review
								Day 1:NoonI awoke in the wreckage of a small passenger aircraft, hungry and confused. All of my fellow passengers seemed to have vanished save for a woman with an axe lodged in her stomache. After finding a packaged snack and recovering the axe from that poor woman I struck out into the forest. Not long afterwards I began to hear rustling in the bushes. Fearing some sort of wild animal attack I quickly fled to a small clearing. As the sun began to set I realised that I would need warmth and shelter to survive the night. After creating a small fire and a makeshift lean-to I settled in for the night.Day 2:Sometime around midnightI awoke with a start and looked around, searching in vain for whatever disrupted my sleep. The stars shone brightly through the trees, but my fire had gone out. Quickly, I sat up and dug the old BIC lighter out of my pocket to re-light it. Once the warm glow of the fire had once again bathed me in its comforting glow I took my first proper look around.And thats when I saw them.There were three in total, standing just outside the firelight. They wore nothing but tattered loin cloths, and had no hair whatsoever. They appeared human, caucasian and tall in build. But their eyes. The eyes of those monsters had no human quality. They were completely black, glassily meeting my gaze. Just watching, waiting......staring

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 2, 2016
Early Access Review
								Let me begin by saying my hours in this game are far from accurate. I have spent countless hours playing this game offline.The forest is a game unlike any other on Steam. Some may claim this is not true, and there are other survival games, but in my opinion nothing compares to The Forest.When I first started playing this game the sounds of cannibals in the night would send chills down my spine. The light of a torch can only shine so far, and sometimes the most deadly creatures in the game lie right beyond the torches light, waiting for a chance to pounce. This thought in the back of your head makes you wary of working at night, but sometimes the sacrifice must be made if you wish to prolong your life in single player.The Forest takes many survival factors into consideration giving it one of the most realistic feels of any game on Steam as I said earlier. From sickness, starvation, and dehydration, anything could bring about your death. Cannibals aren't the only thing you must fear.The game is regularly patched, and new content is added with almost every update.Multiplayer is a new beast on its own. Though still focusing on survival the game seems to become both easier, and harder, at the same time. Survival from the elements grows drastically easier, for a time. The cannibals however, grow more frequent and more deadly as the days pass.Cave exploration becomes much easier with friends, and far less dangerous, and with the caves staying cleared thanks to one of the latest patches, the caves can also be used to escape danger if your base ever gets overrun in the later days of survival. (Caves may repopulate after a patch. I experienced this with a group of friends in the pit cave, and we had to flee from the sheer number of enemies that spawned, and our low supply count from the initial exploration).Overall the game is amazing, the gameplay is great, and the time you get to enjoy with friends if you wish is also a plus. I recommend this game to anyone that enjoys a challenge, and prefers their survival simulators more on the realistic side.Pros:+Great Game+Fun with friends+Great Simulator for Survival+Challenging+Interesting, and ever growing story with interesting side discoveries+Frequent Updates+Tree explosions sending logs into your friends heads is always worth a laughCons:-Sharks still stuck on the beach (kinda a plus because we just use the heads and stick them to rocks lol, and if it gets fixed I will update this)-You don't own it yet-Needs more enemy classes (Though it seems more have been added. With the addition of what me and my friends have called the Tubby, (you will be able to tell what I'm talking about if you ever see it, I won't spoil the experience hehehe) I can see many more enemies being added in the future though. So this isn't really a Con, more or less a suggestion that would make the game challenging and force the experienced players to rethink some of their tactics.  Buy this game, its worth it. And if you can find it on sale its a steal for the amount of content and fun you will recieve.

content:
Posted: January 1, 2015
Early Access Review
								From the one game I played, and the 5 days I survived -Day 1: Build Cabin off of edge of cliff overlooking ocean so no cannibals can sneak from behind it- Surround the front with traps- Try to sleep for the night, but cannibals chillin outside so can't- Spend the night behind my cabin with a small fire (theres a little spot for my character to hide, but not enough room for the cannibals to reach me, they just fall off the cliff)Day 2: Time to explore the beach-Find luggage scattered down the shore, with more energy bars than I know what to do with-Find boat, on it - flares, new axe, rope, someones mix tape and a skull-Head back to basecamp, but on the way find some camp with triangular cabins. Creeoy music starts up so I don't hang around too long-Actually get some decent sleep that nightDay 3: More exploring-Decide to explore the woods some more-Find berrys, seeds etc-Stumble across another one of those camps, this time I look around-Seems like the cannibals have a fetish for tennis balls since every corpse I find has about 8 shoved in them-Find a hole leading to a cave with a rope going down, decide against it since I'm probably not ready-Head back to camp for some sleepDay 4: Defenses-Decide I need better defenses around my cabin-Build walls almost all around my cabin (this takes about the whole day)-SleepDay 5: Death-Wake up and go to finish my wall-As I step out side my fortress to gather more logs I see a group of cannibals just walking around not far from me (about 6)-Stay away from them but don't actually run-As they get closer I go back into my fortress-They don't chase me but somehow they all wandered into the one spot I hadn't set up a wall-They want my blood now-I hide in my cabin as they all rush to me-5 of the 6 hit my traps-He starts attacking, I try to swing my axe and he doesn't swing it-I die because ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ didn't swing his axe no matter how many times I tried to get him to10/10 would play Cast Away Simulator again

content:
Posted: January 14
Early Access Review
								This game is in alpha, there are some gameplay bugs. Given. But, those few bugs aside, this game is amazing. 9/10Pros: 1. Best story, hands down, I have ever experienced in a game. (Cut scenes are rare, short, and ACTUALLY make groundbreaking inpacts on the plot.2. Amazing co-op experience. All of the bugs I experienced that I actually needed to note because they impacted my experience were because of co-op. (ex. Entering a cutscene with another player in co-op caused them to fall through the world infinitely. Had to restart from last save.)3. PvE is fun. It isn't exactly hard but once you enter the caves it sure as hell ain't easy when you find harder enemies. If you gear up, recruit a pal to take on the big guys with you, it's enjoyable and sometimes got my heart racing. (Boss fights are ♥♥♥♥ing awesome!)Either Pro or Con:1. If you don't look for the clues, you might never find a piece of the story. You actually have to put a lot of effort into solving the story for yourself, the game doesn't hand it to you. I personally enjoyed this and having someone to play with that had just enough information to get us to the next plot point made running around the island looking for clues a blast! :DCons:1. Not for the faint of heart. I'm not saying this game is utterly terrifying and competes with big horror games on the horror scale, but god damn I'm a ♥♥♥♥ing scardy cat. The sound engineering in this game is what sets the mood. Some cut scenes had the most generically ominous music I ever heard but holy♥♥♥♥♥♥.. (Just scheduled my first PTSD rehab session in town...)2. Saving progress can be annoying and inconvenient, but preventable. The only way to save in caves (where most of the plot points occur) are by building a small shelter with sticks and leaves. I ran out of sticks quick and ended up being forced to keep pushing on, and on, and on until my co-op friend and I decived to call it quits because it was 3am and to retrace ALL (A-♥♥♥♥ING-LOT) of our steps in the morning. Really ♥♥♥♥ing annoying, but annoyance here is preventable if you wait until you know you absolutely should.Notable bugs:1. Falling through floors, rare though. Sometimes through the entire map, sometimes just to the next durface available like falling through the floor of my cabin to the sand below. Eh.2. Being forced into the same spot as another co-op player or item like a log can launch you into the air and kill you from fall damage. Double Eh.TL;DR- ♥♥♥♥ing amazing story, chills me to the bone. Have fun digging for clues! :D

content:
Posted: January 10, 2015
Early Access Review
								If i had to use one word to describe this: "Beautiful". While this game has a few (a lot of) glitches, the stunning graphics make up for it. Now for the sake, of this review, I'll talk about some of the glitches that i've encountered:1. Log sled- If you are using a log sled, run over a stick holder and jump, you will fly in the air infinitely. Until you let go of the log sled, from which point you fall to your death. (Still hilarious. Im actually starting to think the developers meant to do that because it shows off the incredible landscape.2. Happy Birthday trap (the spikey one)- When you use the trap, the cannibals will appear dead. With this glitch, they arent. as soon as you reset the trap, they come back to life. A solution: wait for their bodies to despawn (although this is incomvenient if you are being raided.)3. The multiple bodies- This is actually hilarious and doesnt cause any harm to the player. Two cannibals can get into fights. Sometimes a canibal will glitch and stand there idle while the other one attacks it. The idle cannibal is technically dead, but has the animation of staning up. Everytime a player or cannibal hits the idle cannibal, another idle body forms behind it, leaving a marvelous spectacle. (Note: this has only happened once)Overall------------------------------------------------------------------------------I think this game is amazing for how small it is (data-wise) It doesnt require much fire-power to runand still looks beautiful. The ai is great, the cave systems are beautiful, as are the different types of cannibals found there. I am overjoyed that this game is in alpha because that means this already amazaing game will become much better.My only problem: glitches and lack of variety of melee weapons.Thank you for reading this review, I hope it helped.

content:
Posted: April 15, 2015
Early Access Review
								So this game is in alpha, remember that.  Things can change, so this review may be rendered pointless at some point.  But, seeing as I love it so much, even though I haven't spent a significant amount of time on it, I had to write a review.  For being in Alpha, they are working their absolute hardest to push out updates and big fixes every couple weeks.  Loads of new content always being added.  First, the normal survival mode.  AMAZING!  Haven't been that concerned about my health, clothing, shelter, and scariness factor in a while.  From the moment you jump in, landing in a new location, u can't wait to explore and find the perfect spot to build a cabin that will ultimately hopefully become a fort at some point (soon, if your lucky).  I must say, the plot is intriguing.  The random passenger counter you get when finding bodies strewn from the cieling in caves has me wondering, not to mention, will you get your SON back?  Second, multiplayer mode.  Still really buggy, and it is awkward trying to share items and stuff, but recently they released an update that added communal cabinets for people to share stuff, thus making it a bit better.  The developers have obviously worked hard on this and seem to be very invested in making it a great co-op experience instead of a copy and paste that we see from so many other franchises.  Lastly, gameplay, graphics, and other odds and ends.  The quality is simply stunning.  Sometimes I stand there and look at the water ripples or the sunlight for fun.  Because it looks awesome.  The building of items seems to be very decent, and the guidebook and inventory layout are super creative.  The hidden items around the island like the axe and flares and rope and stuff you can find in the boat, or the flare gun in caves or the cockpit of the plane if you find it.  So much to do and explore.  This game has not once failed to deliver me and my friends an entertaining time.  So I rate this game highly, singing it's praises.  :)  I look forward to what this game has to offer, seeing as it is far beyond fantastic as it stands in Early Access!  I recommend it.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 27, 2016
Early Access Review
								First things first: This game has been in early access "alpha" for literally years. Yes, that's annoying and yes, I wish the game had progressed further in that time than it has. That said, I have thoroughly enjoyed my time with it and love the changes and additions that have been made.The crafting system is really great, and I love the variety of things that you can build. From meat drying racks to spiked walls to creepy totems of limbs and heads, there are some really interesting things and they're really fun to build. Not to mention they look great, as does the game in general. The forest is probably my favourite survival type game to date, I've had more fun playing it than even Ark or Minecraft.Part of why I like it so much is the horror element I think. The cannibals are genuinely creepy, and I get scared every time they appear. It's a really compelling element which gives you a reason to build up as quickly as possible and stay hidden at night. The creepy mutilated bodies and trophies made from body parts littered around the map add to this element and really drive home that the cannibals are to be feared.TL;DR, if you see this game for cheap I'd recommend it. It's a lot of fun, especially if you play with friends, and you'll get your money's worth so long as you don't spend too much money. Just don't expect it to ever be a finished product, I don't think that's happening anytime soon.

content:
Posted: June 3, 2014
Early Access Review
								The Forest is a terrifyingly awesome game! Once you get ingame you are left alone after a horrific plane crash, where apparently know one survived but you. You are a lone survivor and have to build your own shelter hunt and find food to fill up your belly, but the world is in't a trip in lala land; you will run into inhumane enemies. You will run into these creatures that look very similar to humans, but they aare much stronger and faster than you. They are challenging, especially if you find yourself surrounded by more than one. The best way to survive these cannibals is by running away or fleeing. If you get killed by the cannibals they will abduct you, and take you to a cave where you will find the rest of the airplane passengers. This cavern is very big, and will have to be explored later on in the game, but I would stay away from it for the first few days. In this cavern you will have to escae, but if you get lost you might find yourself in a very dangerous situation. Deeper in the cavern live these mutations, some look like people wrapped around by human skin. These mutated creatures are probably the most dangerous, and they will be quick to kill you. Ofcourse they live in the caves! So if you don't go in there you'll be safe right? WRONG! After a couple of days when you have developed your little safe haven, and you think nothing can get you... they will emerge from the depths of the cave and will surround your home then they will break through anything they need too; just to kill you. This is a very challenging game, and I HIGHLY RECOMMEND getting it if you are into open world survival games like Rust, or are into horror games; trust me the cannibals do a good job at sneaking up behind you, then SCARING THE LIVING♥♥♥♥♥♥OUT OF YOU!!! This game is fun, but it does have a lot of bugs and glitches; it's fine because it is in Alpha and hopefully they will fix it soon - SlenderCat

Early Access Review
								I am completely amazed that this game was made by a group of only 4 people.  There are some issues here and it is an alpha; however the forthcoming patch is going to fix issues such as not being able to save the game.  The enviroment is beautiful, immersive and absolutely terrifying depending on where you are.  I am very much looking forward to seeing how this game develops. I personally think the price of this game will go up significantly once it is out of early access and I think the current price is fair for something quite so remarkable.  If you like games like Rust, DayZ, Project Zomboid definately check out the forest because I think you will love it.

content:
Posted: May 31, 2015
Early Access Review
								The Forest is a brilliant game. Both the concept, graphics, atmosphere, and the gameplay are all great. Early access or not, this a game worth picking up.Pros: well to start out, it looks beautiful. The island looks great, both thanks to the graphics and the layout of the island itself. The way the light goes through the trees has made me stop actually playing and just look at it many times. While obviously not what you buy the game for, this is something worth mentioning. On top of this, the world feels alive. It's hard to explain but the island really feels like a real forest (or at least as close as a game can come to feeling real). The combat feels good, as the weapons feel like they have weight and power. Also, of course the survival part of the game is great and is the strongest part of the game. You have to manage food and water intake and must build to protect yourself from the outside world. It can be truly nerve wracking to be stuck in your fort for the night knowing you're out of food. The building aspect is also pretty cool. It's really exciting when you're building your walls and you need just a couple more pieces of wood to complete it, but the sun has gone down so you have to finish before cannibals show up.Cons: well, the biggest problem is that it's early access. Many may claim that I can't list this as a problem since it is marketed as early access and never pretends to be anything but early access, but the truth is that it is a product and when you buy it this is what it'll be like (at least for now). The game is often a buggy mess. The "zombies" will glitch through walls often times. You'll use resources making something just to have it not actually be crafted. These kind of glitches aren't too common, but they can kill you when they do happen and ruin your 5 hour game. While I'm sure in 6 months they'll fix the problems, but for now they exist and that what you have to play with. The other problem is kind of a half problem half not. The game's weapons are too weak. Like I said, they feel powerful but they really aren't. While I don't mind weak weapons in a game like this, they're too weak in my opinion. Even when you're 10 hours into a game and have a super fort, if you get caught fighting even 4 or 5 enemies, you're life is in serious danger. I love having the game make you feel as if you're truly outgunned so to speak, but here it feels like you're using a foam sword to fight a tank. However, many people will love how the game makes you avoid combat often because of this so it's a personal preference really.In conclusion, this a game that is good as it is, but I feel will only truly reach its full potential in a couple of months. I recommend buying it now, as it is still REALLY fun and of course the more money the studio has, the better they can make their game. I'd give it a 7.5/10 as of now and expect it to be around a 9/10 when it's finished

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 14
Early Access Review
								This game is in alpha, there are some gameplay bugs. Given. But, those few bugs aside, this game is amazing. 9/10Pros: 1. Best story, hands down, I have ever experienced in a game. (Cut scenes are rare, short, and ACTUALLY make groundbreaking inpacts on the plot.2. Amazing co-op experience. All of the bugs I experienced that I actually needed to note because they impacted my experience were because of co-op. (ex. Entering a cutscene with another player in co-op caused them to fall through the world infinitely. Had to restart from last save.)3. PvE is fun. It isn't exactly hard but once you enter the caves it sure as hell ain't easy when you find harder enemies. If you gear up, recruit a pal to take on the big guys with you, it's enjoyable and sometimes got my heart racing. (Boss fights are ♥♥♥♥ing awesome!)Either Pro or Con:1. If you don't look for the clues, you might never find a piece of the story. You actually have to put a lot of effort into solving the story for yourself, the game doesn't hand it to you. I personally enjoyed this and having someone to play with that had just enough information to get us to the next plot point made running around the island looking for clues a blast! :DCons:1. Not for the faint of heart. I'm not saying this game is utterly terrifying and competes with big horror games on the horror scale, but god damn I'm a ♥♥♥♥ing scardy cat. The sound engineering in this game is what sets the mood. Some cut scenes had the most generically ominous music I ever heard but holy♥♥♥♥♥♥.. (Just scheduled my first PTSD rehab session in town...)2. Saving progress can be annoying and inconvenient, but preventable. The only way to save in caves (where most of the plot points occur) are by building a small shelter with sticks and leaves. I ran out of sticks quick and ended up being forced to keep pushing on, and on, and on until my co-op friend and I decived to call it quits because it was 3am and to retrace ALL (A-♥♥♥♥ING-LOT) of our steps in the morning. Really ♥♥♥♥ing annoying, but annoyance here is preventable if you wait until you know you absolutely should.Notable bugs:1. Falling through floors, rare though. Sometimes through the entire map, sometimes just to the next durface available like falling through the floor of my cabin to the sand below. Eh.2. Being forced into the same spot as another co-op player or item like a log can launch you into the air and kill you from fall damage. Double Eh.TL;DR- ♥♥♥♥ing amazing story, chills me to the bone. Have fun digging for clues! :D

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 10, 2015
Early Access Review
								If i had to use one word to describe this: "Beautiful". While this game has a few (a lot of) glitches, the stunning graphics make up for it. Now for the sake, of this review, I'll talk about some of the glitches that i've encountered:1. Log sled- If you are using a log sled, run over a stick holder and jump, you will fly in the air infinitely. Until you let go of the log sled, from which point you fall to your death. (Still hilarious. Im actually starting to think the developers meant to do that because it shows off the incredible landscape.2. Happy Birthday trap (the spikey one)- When you use the trap, the cannibals will appear dead. With this glitch, they arent. as soon as you reset the trap, they come back to life. A solution: wait for their bodies to despawn (although this is incomvenient if you are being raided.)3. The multiple bodies- This is actually hilarious and doesnt cause any harm to the player. Two cannibals can get into fights. Sometimes a canibal will glitch and stand there idle while the other one attacks it. The idle cannibal is technically dead, but has the animation of staning up. Everytime a player or cannibal hits the idle cannibal, another idle body forms behind it, leaving a marvelous spectacle. (Note: this has only happened once)Overall------------------------------------------------------------------------------I think this game is amazing for how small it is (data-wise) It doesnt require much fire-power to runand still looks beautiful. The ai is great, the cave systems are beautiful, as are the different types of cannibals found there. I am overjoyed that this game is in alpha because that means this already amazaing game will become much better.My only problem: glitches and lack of variety of melee weapons.Thank you for reading this review, I hope it helped.

content:
Posted: January 14, 2016
Early Access Review
								Yes, it's alpha game. And yes, there is some glitches and bugs. But game is pretty good at current state. This game is not like Rust where you have shotguns and rifles. You use spears, axes, bows and arrows to defend yourself against endless waves of cannibals at night. You are not immortal, sometimes you have run away and leave everything behind. Hunt animals for meat and leather. Maintain your garden. Build your own cabin. Explore caves where you press ESC after every sound or scream you hear. And sometimes, you just want sit down and watch environment. Rest your mind and body looking waves of sea and listen sounds of birds and water. Only to remind yourself that next night might be your last. Also, regular updates (there's countdown at main menu to next big update).

content:
Posted: June 1, 2014
Early Access Review
								This is my review for the intial release:Man, I just can't explain what I have gotten from this game, but the best thing I can describe my lagfilled experince (because my com is not awesome enough to handle this game's awesomeness) is it has been a joyride full of thrills, spills, laughs and weirdness.The AI, from what I've seen so far, is EXTREMELY advanced. The mutants themselves might be a bit buggy, but I have never been so scared of these enemies in any game I played before. They have stealth, they have the knowledge to fight or flight, they even have fricking attack patterns!!! They don't just go for me instantly, they wait for me to attack first before they counter! This part of the game I really love.Now, the gameplay. The UI is simple to understand. I managed to figure out which is my health, armor, stamina and hunger on the bar. The inventory was 3D as promised, and I was glad it was pretty simple to learn. Crafting was straightforward too, and I love it when I can figure things out. And you have to love the fact that you can see animals walking over your inventory if any are near!!!I wish to be able to play with a bit less lag so that I can experience more from this and help come up with a few suggestions to make it even better. For now, I guess it's bug hunting time! XD

content:
Posted: June 1, 2014
Early Access Review
								This game is very fun for what it is right now. The recent patch has disabled saving which is a little annoying but it will be fixed soon I'm sure. The biggest complaint I have is that for an open world off-rails horror game the beginning is very scripted. Before your first "death" (you get captured by tribesmen instead of killed by them) you are hunted constantly, they will always find you and always be on your tail. They will never let up even if you manage to escape and set up a small shelter, they will find you just after you sleep and come and try to kill you. Afterwards I don't know if I bugged or what but I only found a small group of them and empty huts. Still, for an extremely early alpha it is in good shape, you might just want to hold off your money until it is more finished unless you can deal with bugs such as dropping weapons when switching them(which annoyingly includes molotov cocktails so my feet are ensured to be charred most of the game), tribesmen sometimes flat out ignoring you when you wave at them as they walk by, weird land floating near the plane, water becoming staticky looking, etc.

content:
Posted: April 28, 2016
Early Access Review
								This game is overrall great, I played for a few hours a year ago with a friend of mine and thought it was fantastic. The graphics are good, the details are precise, shading is excellent and the mutants are terrifying. Now that I play it again, the things I liked most about the game are still there, but they haven't evolved much since I last played. They're still good and all but not as evolved as some games such as ARK; then again, with a team of only four developers, it's really nice. After playing this game again after a year, I bought it for my boyfriend, too, and now we both play it.Don't expect too much, but if you like building structures and defending your bases from monsters, have at it!PROS:-The graphics and shading are well done-The AI is difficult, the cannibals are very smart sometimes-Building and defending is overrall fun-Sound design is awesome-It's scary at first-The models are pretty niceCONS:-Repetitive at times-A bit unbalanced with the cannibals and humans-Only scary for a little while-Not much content (will be fixed by game's release)-A bit glitchy

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 2, 2014
Early Access Review
								When the plane went down, I couldn't believe I survived. As I laid there watching a strange man with black eyes carry my son away, I could only think, "why him?" Where is he taking him? I try to speak. “Take me instead”, but the words wont come. As soon as he appears, he’s gone with my son. I lay there waiting  for him to return to finish me off but he never comes. What had I done to deserve this? Why me? I can’t stay here. I wont stay here! I have to get up! As my strength returned and I got to my feet, I gathered what supplies I could and set off into the forest. Not knowing if he was alive or not, I knew that no matter what I had to find him. I walked for what seemed like days. Through water and over mountains, eating what I can only hope are harmless berries, until I came to a cove. There were rabbits running around, birds blackening the sky and more fish than I could count. Here is where I start. Here is where I begin the search for my son and hopefully a way to get out of this God-forsaken place. As I begin to take stock of what I have, I hear a noise. Not a noise one associates with a peaceful stroll through the woods. No. This was a screech from the deepest bowels of hell. A noise that only the darkest creatures that dwell in the deepest corners of your mind can make. Every muscle in my body is screaming for me to run, but I have to know. As I turn to face what ever creature this is, fear washing over my body, I realize. It's just a woman. She's just standing there in front of me. Eyes agape and the most puzzling look upon her face. We stand there for minutes just starring. Waiting for the other to do...Something, anything. I open my mouth to say, "I'm not going to hurt you", but the realization washes over me. She wasn't screaming in fear, oh no, that would be too simple. In fact she was calling for the others that I didn't know where there. One, two, four of them. Leaping from tree to tree so incredibly fast that it's inhuman. I run. Faster than my legs have ever carried me, but no matter how fast I run, THEY are faster. I cannot escape. I turn to face them. As the first one jumps down to attack, I lunge at him with my axe but I'm not fast enough. He strikes me long before I can hit him. I feel the cartilage break in my nose and the blood once contained in my nose now running freely down my face. I swing wildly, just hoping to connect, but to no avail. When they tire of this game of "Cat and Mouse" the deliver the final blow.....I wake up cold. So cold. Where am I? Is this what death feels like? Thank God it's over. Then, when I see the rest of the crew and passengers on the plane, I realize I’m not dead.  It's not that easy in this place..... I gather myself up and start feeling around for an exit, but I only find dead bodies. There’s a light in the distance. Am I hallucinating? Is it real or was I slowly going insane? I feel my way towards it. Inch by inch, through water filled with the decomposing remains of people I’d known days before. As I grow closer, I notice there is a table with a body on it. A child’s body. Oh God, is it him? Is it my son? I began to shake as shamble nearer and nearer, hands shaking uncontrollably the realization comes. It’s not him. I never knew I could be so happy to see a child dead in such a manner, but I didn’t care. There was still hope for him…and for me.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 10, 2015
Early Access Review
								If i had to use one word to describe this: "Beautiful". While this game has a few (a lot of) glitches, the stunning graphics make up for it. Now for the sake, of this review, I'll talk about some of the glitches that i've encountered:1. Log sled- If you are using a log sled, run over a stick holder and jump, you will fly in the air infinitely. Until you let go of the log sled, from which point you fall to your death. (Still hilarious. Im actually starting to think the developers meant to do that because it shows off the incredible landscape.2. Happy Birthday trap (the spikey one)- When you use the trap, the cannibals will appear dead. With this glitch, they arent. as soon as you reset the trap, they come back to life. A solution: wait for their bodies to despawn (although this is incomvenient if you are being raided.)3. The multiple bodies- This is actually hilarious and doesnt cause any harm to the player. Two cannibals can get into fights. Sometimes a canibal will glitch and stand there idle while the other one attacks it. The idle cannibal is technically dead, but has the animation of staning up. Everytime a player or cannibal hits the idle cannibal, another idle body forms behind it, leaving a marvelous spectacle. (Note: this has only happened once)Overall------------------------------------------------------------------------------I think this game is amazing for how small it is (data-wise) It doesnt require much fire-power to runand still looks beautiful. The ai is great, the cave systems are beautiful, as are the different types of cannibals found there. I am overjoyed that this game is in alpha because that means this already amazaing game will become much better.My only problem: glitches and lack of variety of melee weapons.Thank you for reading this review, I hope it helped.

content:
Posted: June 2, 2014
Early Access Review
								Day One: Looks like I crashed in the middle of nowhere. Huh. Well, first thing I should I do is loot. I proceeded to exit the half of the plan that I was in. I went to the shore and collected twigs. Found a boat that was wrecked pretty close to the shore. Got some booze, drank it and continued. Next, survival was important. I found a pond, jabbed a sharp stick at some fish and continued. I saw some weird tribal markers. I kept a low profile and headed inward. I had the perfect area: Flat piece of dirt with some foliage to cover myself. I just put down my blueprint for my shelter when I looked behind me. 3 "humans" were behind me. Two were male and one was female. We exchanged looks and I BONZAI charged them. Didn't go to well. They outnumbered me and I died. Or so I thought. Day Two: Woke up in blood, tried and hungry. I soon found out they kidnapped me to their lair and soon found some of the passangers. I found the exit and decided to start new again. I found a lake and from where I was standing, I had the higher ground. I also saw three "humans" run away when I got there. I shrugged it off and began to build camp. I just finished my hut when AGAIN the same people hunted me down and surrounded me. I died.10/10 would bonzai charge again

content:
Posted: May 30, 2014
Early Access Review
								What incredible potential! This Alpha is beautiful, unfinished, unpolished, but stunning and intriguing.  While playing you truely get a sense of what it's going to become.  Rather than being disapointed i find that even though it's buggy and at times frustrating, I cant wait for it to develop into the amazing game you can feel when you play it!Pros:* Scenic and picturesque* Sounds great (on my headset at least)* Intuitive crafting system* Inventory looks amazing* Enemies are as creepy as they promised!Cons:* Has quite a variety of bugs* Has no game saves yet* AI is difficult to kill/escape/hide from* Larger building is very time intensiveClearly there is a lot of things for them 'to do' in order to get this game to be consistently playable.  But given how far they've come, I get the impression that it'll get there.Update:This game is great.  Coop is so much fun.  Screaming at friends as they die is great.  Consistently updated.  More content added regularly (considering there's so few devs working on it at least).  10/10 get wrecked every time i play.

content:
Posted: June 25, 2014
Early Access Review
								The Forest is a great survival game and has loads of potential for expansion. After my crash landing I grabbed an axe i found and some food and headed for the forest. Immediately i tried gathering things for a camp...but in the distance i saw movement, it intrigued me, what was i thinking? approaching these tribal looking people...They spotted me and starting hunting me! I made a run for it, jumping over rocks and moving between trees, UNTIL...i couldn't run anymore...why? i had no stamina, and now i had to face these 3 tribals head on, 1 in the tree, 2 circling me and I'm standing there ready to swing at the first one to come for me..i was scared i must say, having these creatures starring at me..and then it happened, it leaped for as i swung my axe, hitting it to the ground, i didn't stop hitting it though, i swung that axe like I've never swung an axe before! Swinging it so viciously i was hitting two of them at the same time, completely out of control, fighting for my life, realizing I had just killed two of them, blood on my hands and axe, shaking, the third one does a mighty jump with a rock in hand and knocks me cold...BUT i woke up moments later in a strange cave...their home. I now need to escape.and so is the life of the forest...

content:
Posted: August 27, 2016
Early Access Review
								This is a great game to play co-op.  Once you establish a base and figure out crafting you can basically become unstoppable if you play smart.  Resources are pretty easy to collect except when you REALLY need something and then you can't find it anywhere for about 15 or 20 minutes.  It's like the game knows what you want/need and it hides it from you.  Or the local cannibals are using dark magic to hide the neccessities from you.  I really can't wait for the story line of the game to progress as my co-op partner and I have explored a good amount of the map, found the more impressive and helpful items, and crafted most of the materials that are available.  There are plenty of bugs in the game as it is still in Alpha.  None of which make the game unplayable or unenjoyable.  Some of which that I noticed most are my axe randomly switching to the plane axe when chopping trees and I push my log cart away or get aggroed my the locals and lay them to rest.  Getting stuck at my bed/save point after loading up the game at the start of play.  Wild life and enemies will run into and through things occasionally disappearing.  Trees and bushes growing under the foundation and into your base.  Wildlife will spawn repeatedly in the same spot occasionally as well as birds flying to same spot and landing.  Overall I am really enjoying this game and it's extremely fun to play.  I would like to see a wider variety of tougher enemies and enemies in general but the game is great so far at this point.  Updates and hotifxes about every 2 weeks so far which is awesome.  Hopefully the Devs keep it up because they have already fixed a lot of the bugs that I've noticed since I've started playing the game.

content:

								The open world survival genre seems to be growing by the day, we have Rust, Reign of Kings, Ark and many more.I had origanally thought about getting The Forrest but having bought the already mentioned games I thought " Nah" and placed it in my wishlist.I was intrigued by Forest, and kept looking at it like I wanted to buy it but didn't want to be disapointed like I was with RoK in regards to just being a plain bad game or Ark with it's Graphical problems!!!!Along comes the christmas period of 2015 and I was talking to a freind playing another game and he mentions Forest to which I mentioned that I was interested but don't know whether I should or not. 5 mins later " you have a gift alert" he only went and bought me The Forest.So we got on it, first thing I saw was some beautiful graphics, I thought why isnt ark like this? lolon a side note I do like ark, with that being the game I have most time on so far :-)the graphics were awesome, I didn't know what I was doing regarding building ect so that took a little learning but wow the game it self is amazing, sure there are a few faults in it but the game is awesome, finding canible villiges, or caves ect to explore, to craft weapons and items and to build a base area, everything in the game has SOME use to it, see a turtle? Kill it and use the shell as part of a water collector, see a canible? kill it and chop his arms and legs off and either cook them up to eat or hang them on a drying rack and eat as jerky :-) Nom Nom Nom Nom

content:
Posted: May 30, 2014
Early Access Review
								There are some things to know about this game before you buy it. #1: There are still many bugs (This is a EAG Review). Some tools will be inside eachother when you hold them in your hand. I found this very annoying because i couldnt get the right tool out withought dropping something. But im sure this will be fixed withen the next few updates. #2: You will be very paranoid about your surroundings and allways think that you're being watched, and most of the time you will be. The enemy will test you. Sometimes you may see one get right next to you just to look at you. As i was building my first shelter a nude woman came up to me and just stared. I didn't want to fight, so i just kept to my business and kept building. As soon as i picked up a big log and couldnt hold my weapon, she lunged towards me and attacked. I pulled out my axe and she ran away. I thought this was very interesting because she knew when i was vulnerable. In other occasions i have seen them on the beach eating. As i went up to them they looked at me, and it seemed like they were testing me in a way. They would run at me, stop, and just stare. It felt like they were seeing what I would do. Eventally they attacked me, nearly killed me, and i woke up in a cave covered in blood. #3: You will have to survive. Nothing will be easy and given to you. The Survival Guide book given to you in the beginning is your key to everything. You will need to use it to build shelters, fires, houses, ect. Keep in mind that this review was written the first day the game was released, and many things will changed, added, fixed, and removed. Im very happy with the game, and I know that it will just get better.

content:
Posted: December 21, 2016
Early Access Review
								This game is pretty good as it is but could be awesome.   This is my first review after playing only a few hours.  I'll edit and update this as I play!Pros:-Nice crafting system with creative uses for animal parts-Cool building system allows for variation-Realistic setting provides good immersion -Survival manual is a great way to browse craftable structures-Nice AI animals-Cool places to exploreCons:-I don't like the intro, it's very well done but I'd rather just spawn in-I didn't realize this game had an ending.  I'd prefer an open ended experience-I think the map is locked, so it's always the same.  This limits replayability and exploration.Overall I would give this 7/10 stars as it is.  I haven't been ovewhelmed or super impressed by anything aside from the brilliant tree chopping and building mechanics.  I also really like the creative use of skulls and skins for lights and decor.Suggestions for the devs:I would keep the intro for trailers etc.  But it doesnt need to be in the game, especially not in multiplayer.  You can wake up with amnesia and have no idea what happened but still have plane parts lying around as it is.  The player will figure it out.  This way you maintain the story without limiting the players imagination as to what happened in the past.  I think it's a lot more interesting and open ended if you provide an open world with very little narrative.I'd also recommend looking into a procedural option for land/terrain generation.  It is hard at first but pays off as each players maps can be varied.  You'll attract more players and build new tools to help develop your next game...7/10Thanks for reading

Early Access Review
								When I fell, I was a nothing, a worm in the dirt just hoping to kill a lizard or find some undeath berries. The savages stocked me and I was scared, for the first time in my life, I was scared. But I grew, I made myself a nest and would not resign myself to the fate of so many others, I would become something more. They would know the white man's soul was more black and corrupt than theirs. Soon enough I was hunting the savages, the cannibals, the islanders, I was killing them, their crimson tides spilled upon my axe arm and I made omens to their suffering. The pale demon would descend upon their homes and make them pay for being a part of this ancient land. I cut their trees, ate and wore their animals and burnt their forests, I could make them thralls but they lack even the simple ability to obey. So I would show them what the rest of the world knew, the white man is death.For real tho, I slaughtered a savage woman while her man ran behind a tree and watched me, then I kill him with her leg. 10/10Wait, I'm supposed to find my kid?

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 17, 2015
Early Access Review
								This is my first time reviewing a game, but this game is definitely, definitely worth the review. First and foremost, the game is a survival sandbox where you're pitted against Cannibals. There are different Cannibal tribes that are out to eat you, as they have with the rest of the flight passengers. There are also Mutant Cannibals that are terrifying to come up against. In the opening cinematic you find out that your son has been kidnapped by a Cannibal, and you spend the game hunting up clues to find out where he is and what happened to him, while trying to build a structure to protect yourself from the onslaught of enemies. What's so incredibly enthralling about the game is that there's no strict guidelines of what you HAVE to do. There are a lot of people who like to try and hide from the Cannibals. It's possible to actually avoid being seen at all by them, though this last patch has made it far more difficult to do so. There are some players who don't have any interest in finding their son, don't even bother with the caves and just build the most intricate structure they can before the next reset. There are also players, like myself, who enjoy building right in the middle of their patrol patterns and try to instigate them into attacking. The crafting system is pretty fun. They recently implemented that the Multiplayer games can now have customized walls and foundation, roofing and flooring. They also introduced the custom stairs which have been immensely helpful for everyone. The cannibals have a very advanced AI. It's incredible to see how they interact. I actually had a couple kneel before me to sacrifice themselves recently, and a cannibal drag off a dead cannibal as well. They are usually more active at night but you will see pats during the day. They won't always attack you, some will approach you and then back away, others will just run in the opposite direction. If you get the starving cannibals on you and you take one down then on occasion the other starving cannibal will actually stop attacking you to eat his fallen comrade.Fire, fire, fire. It's THE best way to kill the cannibals. Molotovs are good, though aiming is a little rough. Fire arrows are the best way to go, by far.There are glitches however, that can be rather game breaking. In multiplayer there has been an issue where it will randomly start making it to where you can no longer add items into the thing that you are crafting. Without being able to add to it, the game has to halt and you have to start over. There are several log sled glitches, the main one that I've seen recently is that you can put some logs into the sled but then cannot remove them. If the host tabs out for longer than 20-ish seconds then the clients in multiplayer will get kicked from game.Considering this game is still in Alpha, it's an incredible investment. They regularly update it and you can see a lot of progress. I'd prefer if they would post updates about what they're working on as they're working on it, but overall I'd definitely say to get this game!

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 14
Early Access Review
								The Forest! What an awesome game. I can only list pros to the game, even though there is a cons list, the cons list has things that will probably be implemented within the game, ready for full release.Pros:- The game looks and runs incredibly as it is designed to run on an array of systems from the very low end to the very high end so yes, you will probably be able to run it- It feels very real and it does not take long to be engrossed into the action- It feels like a survival game as nothing is obvious to the player. It doesn't feel like a game as you are a massive part to it- The crafting system is good so far and has been expanding slowly.- The mutants vary and you really do feel like you are being attacked by a co-ordinated tribe with a few rogue elements thrown in too.- The storyline is incredible. The lore for the mutants has been amazing to follow and invest in. And the story is heart breaking and shocking with the twists that occurCons:- The crafting system must be more realistic. For instance, it only takes logs to make a tree bridge but no 'tree sap' or 'rope' to hold it up. - Being able to change the landscape would be a welcomed adjustment. Big rocks and some tree types should be breakable.- Being able to make a pond or a moat around your base would be a cool addition- New crafting animations and being able to write your own notes in the bookOverall, if you want a good survival horror game, this is the best game on steam and NO - THERE ARE NO GUNS. Apart from one gun which takes 5 seconds to reload and you have no crosshair so good luck with that!

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 3, 2015
Early Access Review
								The Forest,one of the closest games to perfect. The controls are realistic without being too slow,and you really do feel like your a survivor carrying an axe or logs or whatever's in your hands,dealing with the cannibals and other threats such as dehydration,hunger,energy,and fall damage. The building construction works well,they can be damaged and deleted without exploding the second you touch one,and it's surprisingly satisfying to complete a project such as the full size log cabin,which takes at least 90 logs. It can get kinda boring to build larger things at times since you can only carry 2 logs at once,and you sacrifice any weapons until you put the logs down or place them. However,this is realistic without being terrible. There are now 3 different tribes of cannibal instead of the 1 kind there was when the game first released. These tall grey/silver ones that jump at you,the glowing ones that have always been there (now they throw you either forwards or hundreds of feet into the air,which can be fun,and deal significant damage,making them sort of the bosses of the game) and then the female cannibal,which is entirely naked except for a skirt,and these actually explode if hit from above,but otherwise throw basic punches. In addition to these 3 tribes the cave monsters will now come above ground and attack you,i first noticed them on day 20,so i guess that's when they come out. These things are horribly overpowered,2 hits and your down,but that's not nescessarily a bad thing,since these were kinda designed to be the "monsters in the shadows". The ones that drag you in before you can even scream. That kinda tension building is horror done amazingly well. To fight these bad guys you have to first build a base,starting off with nothing more than the posessions of the passengers that crashed in the plane alongside you,and a standard orange axe that hits fast but does relatively low damage. Along the way you can find ponds to drink from,stuff to collect and craft with,animals to hunt,and even other weapons such as a modern axe,which does more damage than the plane axe but is the slowest weapon,you can find rope in Cannibal villages to craft the appropriately named "craft axe",which is somewhere in between plane axe and modern axe,and then the Katana,which is faster than the plane axe and hits harder than the modern axe. This is the best possible thing to fight with.  Cannibals also drop their skull axes,but these can't really cut anything and you'd be better off using a stick. It's not just axes though,Molotovs can be crafted with cloth and booze,which are plentiful at the plane crash site and respawn in suitcases every day. I HIGHLY reccomend crafting as much of these as you possibly can when you first start out,they aren't great against enemies with bigger health bars,but against the scavengers you face on your first 6 nights or so,their amazing. Of course,your only way to build and know any of this is the Survival Guide. Think FNAF's phone guy if he was a book. It tells you what berries you can eat,what purpose certain things serve,and even suggests helpful locations and items to hunt for. By far the most important part of this book is the effigies section. In the tabs at the top of the book overlay there's one with a red X. Click it,and you can build a variety of effigies from the parts of mutants you chop with an axe (or stick). Larger ones last longer,but they all last at most 3 nights now,so i reccomend just going with the small fries,less trouble and less risk. These effigies will be your only hope against the mutant hoard,none of these guys are lit up,they'll march right over you,no matter how much you swing that axe around.So this is a very good,balanced survival experience,and even funner when you bring multiple players into the mix. I especially have fun naming the servers. That's right,no more fooling around with external programs,everyone and anyone can host servers on this game,new games or saved maps,it doesn't matter. If only all games made it this easy. The server naming thing is surprisingly fun to mess around in. I wish the character limit wasn't so small,but it's really only a minor nitpick. Just a little heads up,it doesn't work too well for me when i try to livestream it either,even on Ultra Low quality,but again,just a minor nitpick,if your just playing to play then you should be able to have high quality graphics with ease. They make the enviroments strangely ominous yet beautiful at the same time,even with Ultra Low settings,which is better than most games do.So the one negative i do have besides minor nitpicks? The death screens. Now i know what your thinking,dying is part of the game,it's bound to happen,it happens to all of us. While that is true,the deaths felt kind of dragged out to me. It plays this dramatic music as the cannibals roar and slash and jump at you,i guess it's supposed to make you feel something,and that would be all fine and good,games with emotional stuff such as Telltale's The Walking Dead have pulled it off spectacularly well. Only issue is,this game really has no story. I mean yeah,your in a plane crash,but after that it's an entirely sandbox survival game,racing against the clock to put that final log in place before dusk. But the main character never speaks,never shows any emotion,making these long,dragged out death scenes feel a little out of place at best and EXTREMELY annoying at worst. It's hard to connect to a silent protagonist unless it's something like the main hero from Need For Speed Most Wanted where nostalgia plays a part in it. The only reason i even mention this is that getting pounded by cannibals 5 times in a row trying to get your stuff,then having to sit through a 2 minute death,can really suck the fun out of a multiplayer party.In the end though,these devs are clearly willing to try,i mean,pushing out 3 UPDATES in one day!? Who else puts in that kind of effort developing a game? And the game is pretty fun despite that one major negative,so i'm giving it 4 stars just for the amount of effort put in and the amazing results it has given us. You have not played video games until you have played The Forest. It is that good. And if you buy it and don't like it,at least you know part of the money went to a group of developers that listen and spend their free time fixing the game for US.

content:
Posted: February 14
Early Access Review
								After roughly 40 hours in the game, I have nothing but good things and some very minor issues. First off I'd like to commend the developers on such a good survival experience. This game has been a fantastic experience so far. I got 5 other friends to pick it up and we have been having a blast exploring, building, and surviving.Pros: Fantastic AI (mutants/cannibals are done extremely well)Good BuildingEnvironment layoutGraphicsEasy to set up MP which a lot of survival games lackStory behind all of the survivalHorror part of the game is done really well while still focusing on exploration and survivalModing available through 3rd party program (allowed by developers)Cons: Minor BugsFew crashes in MP due to memory exceptions (Save Frequently)This has easily been one of the best games I've picked up in a long time. Great to play both solo and in a group. Supports up to 8 in game. More can be supported through mods. 10/10
