Early Access Review
								I LOVE THIS GAME, I highly recommend it to anyone who likes survival horror games, when I saw this game on youtube I thought it was kind of lame like "Oh how scary, just a bunch of naked people running around in a forest" in a sarcastic tone, but then I found out there was a story to this game and a lore, I finally decided to buy it with my steam wallet wondering if I made a good choice, IT... WAS... TERRIFYING. The first couple of days are the most dreadful with the cannibals not even attacking you, they are just watching you, which is so terrifying. I also love how the cannibals have behaviors, they don't just mindlessly attack you and be an annoyance, they watch you, they learn about you, and if they see you kill one of their tribe leaders, they usually don't mess with you. Same goes for the mutants, if you keep going into caves and attack and kill mutants, they will start attacking and killing you, I hope this was helpful and I hope you will play it

content:
Posted: September 15, 2014
Early Access Review
								The Short Version: Wait for the beta or the official launch.  None of the features are implemented in any kind of finished state.  It's better to spend money on a finished product, today, than to buy an unfinished/undesigned product for "tomorrow".  In all seriousness, this project might not even fully finish. (See TOWNS)I'm here to counter all these positive reviews by people who barely played 10 hours.Pros:This game has many outstanding concepts and features:     >FPShooter non-shooter          I've been waiting for games like these since TRIBES tRPG     >Open-World     >Crafting          Weapons and supplies     >Construction           Shelter and defenses     >Enemies          Danger and tension from the native mutants     >Needs driven          The one game that doesn't need a hunger and rest and cold mod!     >Dynamic Weather           Day to Night, Rainy/Sunny, possible snowy/frigid environment on the mountain.     >Absence of story          In a survival-game the ending is death and the story is literally the sum of the events of your game. There is no convoluted story to understand and follow. There is no main-line objective obstructing your progress.  It's more open-ended than anything out so far.  It's more solitary than any horror story.  You truly are alone and you truly don't know what to do next, rather than constantly hearing some tutorial or figuring out some menial puzzle, respectively.  This aspect of games are largely forgotten and gamers constantly feel like they got strangers holding their hands every time they play a new game.  It's refreshing to have a manual and a start game and to be set loose on this island without having to look at a picture of a slow-talking and historically-inaccurate representation of a person telling me how to wipe my own♥♥♥♥♥♥     That is the best aspect of the game, though; it's list of features.Cons:      And with that said, I move on to the finer points of the review.  Finer in terms of scope.  A more in-depth look at each point.  A more realistic gauge on what the game is, and where it lands on the scale between buy now and buy later.  Indeed, you wouldn't want a nice looking game that doesn't play well.     None of the features are anywhere close to being implemented.  Yes, you can fish, and farm, and build a boat, and build a house, and chop down a tree, and so on.... you could do all these things and be satisfied for a few days just working your way through the list of features, but you won't find yourself doing any of them a second or third time.     Very quickly, you learn that the quality of the implemented features are barely placeholder status.  Most things you can do are written off as an alpha feature when you read the responses to the complaint about it.  If you've ever played a hugely unsatisfying game then you'll know what I'm talking about. Chop down your twentieth tree and it's likely to be your last....out of boredom.  If there's a mutant attacking you he causes the game to play a spooky noise, which is quite thrilling.  The novelty of such things, however, wear out fast and soon even encountering the main threat of the game is like encountering a group of pidgeons being fed; utterly mundane.  That novelty would have hit me much better and would still be a factor if the game was immersive.  Sadly my experiences with these alpha features have likely ruined any future experience I might have with those features entirely.     My review would likely be far more positive if the game had improved over time but the features keep getting added in a very unsatisfying way, and much too little in between too long times.  I have tried every build since v0.01 and it still feels like im playing the same game except with more annoyances.  Every time Space Engineers updates they have a game changing edition in a pretty well polished form.   So far, the form in which features are implemented with this game falls just short of "worth throwing a tantrum".       I didn't even bother trying v0.06B.  Why are they populating the world when there's absolutely nothing for them to do?  These mutants can barely even do a patrol, let alone more complex scripting and even combat.  I'd rather they flush out the map borders, seeing as we can't even access the whole map yet.Features:     >FPS           Combat ranges from Clunky to downright garbage.  You can't even aim the bow properly and arrows collide with just about everything except your intended target.  Don't even get me started on melee.     >Open-World          We can't even access the whole map.  The part of the map that we can access has very little to see and even less to do.  Once you realize you've finished building your base you lose all purpose and start going on suicide missions to lure out and kill a super mutant as a quasi-achievement.     >Crafting          Just like most other games, gather the materials and combine them.  Unlike most other games, theres VERY little to make.     >Building          Probably the feature that's gotten the most attention and the feature that's the least satisfying.  From stairs to walls to prefab-buildings, they all have some kind of kink in them when they're actually built.  Building them raises many more problems, and gathering the materials raises even more.  From crude mechanics like how trees are chopped, to fun-sapping useless mechanics like how trees fall over in perfectly lengthened logs, to broken mechanics like resource spawns (Rocks, farms, etc)     >Enemies          Ridiculous combat and encounter AI will have you annoyed not long before the terror wears thin.  From idiotic women following you around to waking up to a group of mask wearing dudes who like theyre guarding a basketball hoop...all of your interactions get old very fast and the AI shows it's intelligence quickly.  They'll dart in and retreat over and over to no effect.  They'll trigger the spooky mutant noise while perched in a tree, obviously stuck from a bug.   You'll walk into ghost-town camps.  You'll come across patrols making bee-lines between the water and some point outside of their nearest village.     >Needs driven          For a game that revolves around satisfying your needs, AKA SURVIVAL, it does really poorly in giving you options to solve your needs-related problems.  There's only one building in which you can rest, currently.  There's only one reliable food-source (forage) in a game where farming and breeding would be a no-brainer second and third option and should be their top priorities.  Cooking raw meat can break your fire and force you to build another fire and cook another piece of meat.  The main hunting technique, in a survival game, is to run up to it and hit it with an axe, whatever "it" is.  Wet/Dry and rest/energy is rudimentary at best and broken at other times.  The only real penalty is having an annoying tooltip remind you of how cold you are, or not being able to sprint.     >Dynamic Weather          Just plain broken.  Thunderstorms frequency is way too high.  Night seems way longer, as if it's winter, and keeping yourself awake in day hours seems to be a trial in itself.  GTA III did it better a decade ago.     >Absence of story          Though I wrote up on how good it is that this game has no real story, the evidence of the child in the beginning cutscene seems to suggest that a story isn't out of the picture.  It could just be that the absence of story is another alpha feature.In my opinion, you're better off waiting for a finished game or at least a BETA.  The way it is now, spending money is just spoiling a good finished game for you.  It's like buying the episode spoilers for your favorite show.  Don't reward complacency.  Buy the game when the devs actually develop the game further.  I've been sitting on this product in the same state for months.

content:
Posted: January 1, 2015
Early Access Review
								From the one game I played, and the 5 days I survived -Day 1: Build Cabin off of edge of cliff overlooking ocean so no cannibals can sneak from behind it- Surround the front with traps- Try to sleep for the night, but cannibals chillin outside so can't- Spend the night behind my cabin with a small fire (theres a little spot for my character to hide, but not enough room for the cannibals to reach me, they just fall off the cliff)Day 2: Time to explore the beach-Find luggage scattered down the shore, with more energy bars than I know what to do with-Find boat, on it - flares, new axe, rope, someones mix tape and a skull-Head back to basecamp, but on the way find some camp with triangular cabins. Creeoy music starts up so I don't hang around too long-Actually get some decent sleep that nightDay 3: More exploring-Decide to explore the woods some more-Find berrys, seeds etc-Stumble across another one of those camps, this time I look around-Seems like the cannibals have a fetish for tennis balls since every corpse I find has about 8 shoved in them-Find a hole leading to a cave with a rope going down, decide against it since I'm probably not ready-Head back to camp for some sleepDay 4: Defenses-Decide I need better defenses around my cabin-Build walls almost all around my cabin (this takes about the whole day)-SleepDay 5: Death-Wake up and go to finish my wall-As I step out side my fortress to gather more logs I see a group of cannibals just walking around not far from me (about 6)-Stay away from them but don't actually run-As they get closer I go back into my fortress-They don't chase me but somehow they all wandered into the one spot I hadn't set up a wall-They want my blood now-I hide in my cabin as they all rush to me-5 of the 6 hit my traps-He starts attacking, I try to swing my axe and he doesn't swing it-I die because ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ didn't swing his axe no matter how many times I tried to get him to10/10 would play Cast Away Simulator again

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 14
Early Access Review
								This game is in alpha, there are some gameplay bugs. Given. But, those few bugs aside, this game is amazing. 9/10Pros: 1. Best story, hands down, I have ever experienced in a game. (Cut scenes are rare, short, and ACTUALLY make groundbreaking inpacts on the plot.2. Amazing co-op experience. All of the bugs I experienced that I actually needed to note because they impacted my experience were because of co-op. (ex. Entering a cutscene with another player in co-op caused them to fall through the world infinitely. Had to restart from last save.)3. PvE is fun. It isn't exactly hard but once you enter the caves it sure as hell ain't easy when you find harder enemies. If you gear up, recruit a pal to take on the big guys with you, it's enjoyable and sometimes got my heart racing. (Boss fights are ♥♥♥♥ing awesome!)Either Pro or Con:1. If you don't look for the clues, you might never find a piece of the story. You actually have to put a lot of effort into solving the story for yourself, the game doesn't hand it to you. I personally enjoyed this and having someone to play with that had just enough information to get us to the next plot point made running around the island looking for clues a blast! :DCons:1. Not for the faint of heart. I'm not saying this game is utterly terrifying and competes with big horror games on the horror scale, but god damn I'm a ♥♥♥♥ing scardy cat. The sound engineering in this game is what sets the mood. Some cut scenes had the most generically ominous music I ever heard but holy♥♥♥♥♥♥.. (Just scheduled my first PTSD rehab session in town...)2. Saving progress can be annoying and inconvenient, but preventable. The only way to save in caves (where most of the plot points occur) are by building a small shelter with sticks and leaves. I ran out of sticks quick and ended up being forced to keep pushing on, and on, and on until my co-op friend and I decived to call it quits because it was 3am and to retrace ALL (A-♥♥♥♥ING-LOT) of our steps in the morning. Really ♥♥♥♥ing annoying, but annoyance here is preventable if you wait until you know you absolutely should.Notable bugs:1. Falling through floors, rare though. Sometimes through the entire map, sometimes just to the next durface available like falling through the floor of my cabin to the sand below. Eh.2. Being forced into the same spot as another co-op player or item like a log can launch you into the air and kill you from fall damage. Double Eh.TL;DR- ♥♥♥♥ing amazing story, chills me to the bone. Have fun digging for clues! :D

content:
Posted: June 3, 2014
Early Access Review
								The Forest is a terrifyingly awesome game! Once you get ingame you are left alone after a horrific plane crash, where apparently know one survived but you. You are a lone survivor and have to build your own shelter hunt and find food to fill up your belly, but the world is in't a trip in lala land; you will run into inhumane enemies. You will run into these creatures that look very similar to humans, but they aare much stronger and faster than you. They are challenging, especially if you find yourself surrounded by more than one. The best way to survive these cannibals is by running away or fleeing. If you get killed by the cannibals they will abduct you, and take you to a cave where you will find the rest of the airplane passengers. This cavern is very big, and will have to be explored later on in the game, but I would stay away from it for the first few days. In this cavern you will have to escae, but if you get lost you might find yourself in a very dangerous situation. Deeper in the cavern live these mutations, some look like people wrapped around by human skin. These mutated creatures are probably the most dangerous, and they will be quick to kill you. Ofcourse they live in the caves! So if you don't go in there you'll be safe right? WRONG! After a couple of days when you have developed your little safe haven, and you think nothing can get you... they will emerge from the depths of the cave and will surround your home then they will break through anything they need too; just to kill you. This is a very challenging game, and I HIGHLY RECOMMEND getting it if you are into open world survival games like Rust, or are into horror games; trust me the cannibals do a good job at sneaking up behind you, then SCARING THE LIVING♥♥♥♥♥♥OUT OF YOU!!! This game is fun, but it does have a lot of bugs and glitches; it's fine because it is in Alpha and hopefully they will fix it soon - SlenderCat

content:
Posted: July 7, 2014
Early Access Review
								SPOILERS:So far the game has been through a lot of trial and error in the updates for the alpha. Don't buy this game unless you're willing to test it. And by test I mean enctouner glitch after glitch after glitch not to mention dealing with updates that make the cannibibals either too hostel or completely sedate. Pros: Beautiful environment, ambient atmosphere, scary monsters and disturbing noises in the dark that will surely make you second guess not building that shelter sooner.Cons: Ai is very dumb right now. I know the developers are trying hard  but the hostels are either too passive or too aggressive. The game has potential to be very very boring. You build stuff and then what? Maybe explore the island, find a cave or the other half of the aircraft? Needs more excitement. Needs missions and maybe some npcs scattered here and there. Even if all of this gets fixed the game itself is still very boring. Some might not agree but after you've built your traps and cabin its pretty much snoresville. It needs more variety, like mountains. I would argue it even needs a research station on the island thats abandoned that kinda gives background to why the natives are so extreme. Anything to add some kind of plot.

content:
Posted: November 23, 2016
Early Access Review
								The Forest is incredible! BUT I recommend you wait for full release. This is because the game is constantly improving and can only get better with each update. I think patience would be a true virtue in this case. To wait for a complete, finished product that would be unlike any game you have played. Unless you want to be apart of the process of making the game better, defending yourself from cannibals with friends in co-op or in multiplayer, squashing bugs, and to see how the game develops. I've put quite a lot of time into this game and came to the conclusion that at certain times when I visit the game there always comes a point where I feel like I've explored, crafted, and had done everything the game was capable of at that point in time. What I like to do is revisit it every now and again and I am always impressed. My favorite part of the day is seeing the devlogs from the developer (Praise be to them). They update it frequently, packed with new content, systems. Every once in a while it's like a whole new game after a certain time period of updates. I didn't purchase the game. I won it on a twitch stream. If I did, however, purchase it I would have been very happy with my decision because of how the developers treat the games development and it's players. It's an incredibly beautiful game, sound design is constantly improving and is excellent, has moments that have never been done before in a game. The potential is unreal. I can't wait for final release. I would say that the game reminds me in certain ways of Silent Hill without spoiling anything.

content:
Posted: June 2, 2014
Early Access Review
								I am completely amazed that this game was made by a group of only 4 people.  There are some issues here and it is an alpha; however the forthcoming patch is going to fix issues such as not being able to save the game.  The enviroment is beautiful, immersive and absolutely terrifying depending on where you are.  I am very much looking forward to seeing how this game develops.  Do not buy it if you are going to get upset over glitches and issues that are to be expected in an alpha.  I personally think the price of this game will go up significantly once it is out of early access and I think the current price is fair for something quite so remarkable.  If you like games like Rust, DayZ, Project Zomboid definately check out the forest because I think you will love it.

Died my first time by hitting a dead local's body. Awoke in the cave, quickly retrieved the Flare Gun and made my way out. Found my way back and went to sleep.Day 3: Killed some more locals, built un-needed structures.Day 4: Uneventful... Where did the locals go?Day 5: Uneventful... I am starting to feel lonely.Day 6: Ran through the forest out of boredom and committed suicide.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 14
Early Access Review
								Well, I just had to take the time to leave a review for this game which i would class as one of my absolute favourites dispite being early access and which i will continue following and playing. I am a scaredy cat... I couldn't bring myself to play this alone without freaking out at the pitter patter of a deer in the distance about to run past me or an unseen rabbit lurking in the bushes rustling. So i played with a couple of friends. Still scared but feeling a little more confident we ventured. Built a base on the island crafting whatever we could to help us survive. The cannibles are quite frankly horrifying at first. The noises when you are caught out at night are enough to curdle your blood at times. Especially when you can tell they are coming from a mountain somewhere probably spying down on you, stalking ready to strike some time.The caves are where the early access shows. Don't get me wrong they are unnerving and so fun to go through but lacking in enemys in some places. Never the less you want to search the entire thing to find clues to what has happened. All in the aim to get to that dramatic sinkhole you come across at some point while adventuring. The story had a turn i didn't really see coming and is open ended which makes it quite exciting to think of whats going to be added from now to the time of full release. In short terms. I have had an absolutely amazing time with this game already. Have completed it twice. The building and gathering has that addictive feel. The story is great for an alpha. I cannot make this game sound as great as it is so buy it and put in the time to find out!
